    Pediatric Sores and Ulcers Section

    Direct Method for Treating Children (Song Dynasty, Qian Yi)

    Dan Liu (Red Bumps)

    The symptoms of Dan Liu are caused by heat toxins invading the pores, clashing with qi and blood, and manifesting on the skin. One should apply Baiyu San (White Jade Powder).

    [Note: The aforementioned symptoms may be due to congenital toxins, clashes of wind and heat, frequent baths in hot water, frequent contact with warm clothing, food injuries leading to fever, or a wet and rich diet from the wet nurse. Emotional stress can also generate heat. The red, moving lesions are blood driven by wind and heat. If it is due to congenital toxins, use Hua Du Dan (Detoxification Pill); for wind-heat, use Bai Du San (Dispelling Toxins Powder); for frequent baths and warm clothing, use Si Wu Decoction, Lian Qiao (Forsythia), and Shan Zhi Zi (Gardenia); for food-related fevers, use Si Jun Zi Tang (Four Gentlemen Decoction), Chai Hu (Bupleurum), and Shen Qu (Malt); if the wet nurse eats rich foods, add Qing Wei San (Clearing the Stomach Powder); if the wet nurse has stagnant heat, use Jia Wei Xiao Yao San (Modified Happy Wanderer Powder). All should include Lou Lu (Reed) for both mother and child to take. Baiyu San has a very cold nature and can relieve heat toxins; it is suitable for lighter toxicity appearing on the limbs. If the condition extends to the chest, back, and abdomen, it is serious and requires Huo Ming Yin (Reviving Life Drink); one must encourage the patient to exert effort to expel toxic blood concentrated in one area. If the abdomen is distended and there is difficulty with urination and defecation, toxins have entered internally, and Da Lian Qiao Yin (Major Forsythia Drink) may also produce recovery.

    Complete Book of Sores and Ulcers (Jin Dynasty, Dou Hanqing)

    Chi You Dan (Red Bumps)[1p]

    　　小儿患此赤丹，皆从母胎中受蕴，故发皮肤，游走不定。但腹起，于四肢收者轻；四肢起，收于腹者重。急治得生。小儿赤游丹固蕴热所致，即胎毒也。或母怀胎之时，好食辛辣毒物，沐浴热汤，冬天炭火，以致热气入胎，嗜欲无度；或生下火烘衣棠，或火烘床褥，以致热毒内外交攻，半岁上下，无有不发者。初起身体发热，燃火视之，其色红赤，啼哭不止，其光游走不定。发于四肢者生，发于腰腹者死。急用磁锋砭去其紫血，自下而上，则毒血流下。不可逆砭，急用乳香末，鸡子清调匀涂砭处，时用芭蕉根汁涂之；内服朱砂化毒丹，生蜜调下，再服紫金锭水磨汁下。　　或游丹发于头者，何以治之？必须将患儿眠在床上，以床脚根一头加砖一二块，以坠毒气于头，用磁锋砭之，使毒气毒血皆从头顶而出。若乳母抱立在身砭之，则毒气顺下，遂壅咽喉，必难生矣。近观同道之友颠倒砭之，不得其手法，以害诸儿。故不辞琐琐，又明言之，并附十丹毒于后。[2p]

    When a child suffers from this red rash, it is due to toxins accumulated from the mother’s womb, hence it manifests on the skin and varies in location. If it arises from the abdomen and spreads to the limbs, it is mild; if it starts from the limbs and collects in the abdomen, it is severe. Urgent treatment can save the child. The child’s red rash is indeed caused by accumulated heat, known as fetal toxins.

    This may occur when the mother during pregnancy indulges in spicy and toxic foods, bathes in hot water, or uses charcoal in winter, causing heat to enter the womb due to excessive desires. Sometimes, the child is born into a heated environment, either from warm bedding or heated clothing, leading to an offensive heat and toxin attacking from within and without. Around six months of age, all children show symptoms.

    At first, there is a fever; upon inspection, the skin appears red, and the child cries incessantly, the rash seeming to shift locations. Rashes on the limbs are survivable, while those on the waist and abdomen predict danger. Urgently use a special magnet or needle to draw out the toxic blood from below upwards, allowing the poisoned blood to flow out. Do not apply the needle in reverse; instead, use powdered frankincense, mixing it with egg white for a uniform paste to apply where needed, and occasionally use juice from banana roots for application.

    Internally, take a detoxifying pill made with vermilion, mixing it with honey, and subsequently take a drink made from water-ground gold bars.

    If the rash appears on the head, how should one treat it? The child must sleep on a bed with one end raised using bricks, allowing the toxic vapors to flow out from the head. Use magnetic needles to expel both the toxic gases and blood from the crown. If a wet nurse holds the child while applying needles, the toxins will descend, possibly obstructing the throat, making survival difficult.

    Careful observation of fellow practitioners shows many fail in their techniques and cause harm to children. Hence, I do not shy away from reiterating these details and additionally provide ten formulas for detoxification.[2p]

    　　　　　小儿十种丹毒

    　　一飞灶丹，从头顶肿起，渐发红肿，颈项俱浮，眼睛红色，用生葱一束，捣烂取汁涂之。又方，以(石卜)硝五钱、雄黄末二钱和匀，芭蕉汁调和，用败笔蘸汁润之，须令病者卧之，将此汁自下润至颠顶，其毒从百会穴出。若随下润之，则毒气侵于咽喉，亦难治者。　　二吉灶丹，从头额肿痛，用赤小豆末，鸡子清调敷之。前方亦妙。[3p]

    Ten Types of Dan Poison in Children

    1. Feizao Dan: It begins with swelling from the crown of the head, gradually becoming red and swollen, with swelling in the neck and red eyes. Take a bundle of fresh green onions, crush it to extract the juice, and apply it to the affected area. Another remedy involves mixing five taels of (shibu) saltpeter and two taels of realgar powder, then combining it with banana juice. Use a broken brush to apply the mixture, ensuring the patient lies down so that the juice seeps from below to the crown, allowing the poison to exit through the Baihui point. If applied incorrectly from below, the toxic vapors could invade the throat, making it difficult to treat.

    2. Jizhao Dan: It presents as swelling and pain on the forehead. Apply a paste made of red adzuki bean powder mixed with egg white. This previous remedy is also effective.[3p]

    　　三鬼火丹，从面上起赤肿，用伏龙肝末，鸡子清调敷；再用芭蕉根汁润之，益母草灰为末，醋调敷亦妙。　　四天火丹，从背上起赤点，用桑皮末羊脂调敷之。　　五天灶丹，从背上起，一云从两手起，赤肿黄色，用柳树枝烧灰为末，蜜调敷之。　　六水丹，两胁虚肿，用生铁屑末、或针砂、或锈钉末，猪脂调涂。　　七胡芦丹，从脐上起黄肿，用槟榔末，米醋调敷之。　　八野火丹，从两脚起赤肿，用乳香末，羊脂调搽。　　九烟火丹，亦从两脚起赤白点，用猪槽下土，麻油调搽。　　十胡漏丹，从阴上起黄肿，用屋漏处土，羊脂调搽。
    　　　　外科精要 【宋　陈自明】

    　　　　　痈疽

    　　凡小儿属纯阳，其痈疽之疾也，多因心气热而患之。　　 【注　愚按前证，亦有因禀赋而致者。常治少参史南湖孙阴囊赤肿，余作胎毒治之而瘥。后患发热痰嗽，见证不一，难以名状。遂诊其母有郁火血热之证，乃用解毒清肝等药，子母俱服而愈。】[4p]

    Three Ghost Fire Pills: When red swelling arises on the face, use powdered dragon liver and chicken egg whites to apply. Then use banana root juice to moisten it, and apply powdered motherwort mixed with vinegar, which is also effective.

    Four Heavenly Fire Pills: When red spots appear on the back, apply powdered mulberry bark mixed with sheep fat.

    Five Heavenly Stove Pills: When swelling starts on the back, sometimes also from the hands, and appears red and yellow, use powdered ash from willow branches mixed with honey for application.

    Six Water Pills: For swollen areas on both sides, use powdered fresh iron filings, or needle sand, or rusty nails, mixed with pig fat for application.

    Seven Gourd Pills: When yellow swelling arises around the navel, apply powdered betel nut mixed with rice vinegar.

    Eight Wild Fire Pills: When red swelling arises from both legs, apply powdered frankincense mixed with sheep fat.

    Nine Smoke Fire Pills: Also when red and white spots arise from both legs, use dirt from under a pigsty mixed with sesame oil for application.

    Ten Leak Pills: When yellow swelling arises in the genital region, use dirt from a leaky roof mixed with sheep fat.

    External Medicine Essentials 【Song Dynasty, Chen Ziming】

    Abscesses

    All children belong to pure Yang, and their abscesses are often caused by heat in the heart. 【Note: It is foolish to assume this is solely due to constitution. There are cases, like when treating the red swelling of Sun from Nanku with my method of detoxifying from maternal toxins, resulting in recovery. Later, he experienced fever and cough, with differing symptoms that were hard to define. Upon diagnosis of his mother showing signs of stagnant heat and blood heat, I used detoxifying and liver-clearing medicines, and both mother and child were cured.】[4p]

    　　　　儒门事亲 【元　张从政】

    　　　　　二火类

    　　凡小儿疮疤瘾疹，麸疮丹熛等疾，如遇火运胜时，荧惑乱行之者，不可便用升麻汤解之。升麻汤味辛性温。《内经》曰积温而成热，是谓重火，止可以辛凉之剂解之。如遇平时，可以辛温，盖平时无事，便同水化。然而更审察病机，甚者亦不可以辛温，但发散之后，便以凉膈散加当归及白虎汤、化斑汤、玉露散煎服之，更甚者解毒汤、调胃散治之。古人云：斑疹疮疱首尾俱不可下，皆误矣，岂不闻扬汤止沸，不如釜底抽薪？《内经》曰：五寅五申之岁，多发此病者，盖少阳相火之所为也。又曰：少阳客气胜，丹疹外发。又曰：诸痛痒疮疡皆属心火。王太仆又谓百端之起，皆自心生。岂可便用辛温发散乎？如致热势增剧，渐成脏毒下血，咬牙发搐，大热明矣。[5p]

    The Matters of Filial Piety in Confucianism
    By Zhang Congzheng (Yuan Dynasty)

    On Second Degree Fire

    In the case of children suffering from ailments such as sores, hives, and pox, especially during a time when fire energies are predominant or when the wandering star brings chaos, one should not hastily use Shengma Decoction to resolve them. Shengma Decoction possesses a spicy and warm flavor. The "Inner Canon" states that heat is produced by accumulated warmth, which is termed heavy fire; it should only be treated with cooling herbs that are spicy in nature. If encountered at normal times, spicy warmth may be applied, as there is usually no urgent issue.

    However, it is necessary to carefully examine the state of the illness; in severe cases, spicy warmth is also unsuitable. After a dispersal, one should use Liangge Powder combined with Angelica and Baihu Decoction, or Huadan Decoction, or Yulu Powder for decoction. For even more severe cases, detoxifying decoctions and regulating stomach powders should be applied. The ancients said: "Rashes and sores, both at the beginning and end, should not be purged," which is erroneous. Do we not know that pouring water to stop boiling is inferior to removing the firewood from beneath the pot? The "Inner Canon" states: “In the years of the fifth yin and the fifth shen, this illness occurs frequently, primarily due to the yang fire of Shaoyang.” Furthermore, it is noted that when Shaoyang's external energy prevails, hives and rashes manifest on the exterior. Additionally, all pain-related ailments and sores are attributed to heart fire. Wang Taifu further stated that all maladies stem from the heart. How can one rashly apply spicy warmth to disperse? If the heat intensifies, it may lead to internal toxins and blood loss, resulting in severe symptoms such as grinding teeth and convulsions; this indicates significant heat.[5p]

    如白虎加人参，凉膈散加当归、桔梗，勿问秋冬，但见疮疹，用之神良。　　凡小儿疮疱、瘾疹、麸疮、丹熛、斑毒之后，脏毒下血。《内经》曰：少阳客气胜，则丹熛疮疹发外也。盖余热不解，故脏毒下血。治以黄连解毒汤、白虎汤、凉膈散，临证选而用之。所谓白虎，旧说秋冬勿用，皆悞也。但有此证便用之，盖其证属相火故也。　　凡小儿丹瘤浮肿毒赤，走引遍身者，乃邪热之毒，可用磁片撤出紫血，其病立愈。如不愈者，后用凉膈散加大黄、芒硝，利三五行为妙；次用拔毒散扫三五度必愈矣。经曰：丹熛赤瘤，火之色也，相火主之。　　凡小儿有赤瘤暴肿，可先用牛黄通膈丸泻之，后用阳起石散敷之，则肿毒自消；如不消，可用(金非)针砭刺，血出而愈矣。[6p]

    Like the white tiger combined with ginseng, and the Cooling the Diaphragm Powder added with Angelica and Platycodon, do not ask about autumn and winter; just see the sores and rashes, it works effectively. For children with sores, hives, grain rashes, red swellings, and blotch toxins, if there is internal poison leading to bleeding. The Inner Canon states: if the minor yang's guest qi prevails, then the red swellings and rashes appear externally. This is because residual heat has not been resolved, thus leading to internal poison and bleeding. Treat it with Huanglian Jiedu Decoction, White Tiger Decoction, and Cooling the Diaphragm Powder, selecting according to the clinical presentation. The so-called white tiger is traditionally said not to be used in autumn and winter, but that is a mistake. It can be used whenever there is this symptom, for it belongs to the fire of the corresponding organs.

    For children with red swollen tumors with toxic heat spreading throughout the body, it indicates the poison of pathogenic heat. You can use magnet pieces to draw out the purple blood, and the illness will immediately improve. If it does not heal, later use Cooling the Diaphragm Powder combined with Rhubarb and Glauber's Salt for a good effect; next, use the Poison Cleansing Powder to wash out three to five times for guaranteed recovery. The classic says: red swellings and tumors of the fire color are governed by the fire of the corresponding organs.

    For children with sudden red swellings, you can first use Niuhuang Tongge Wan to purge it, then apply Yangqishi San for the swelling and poison to dissipate by itself; if it does not, you can use a (Jinfei) needle to puncture, letting blood flow out to ensure recovery.[6p]

    　　　　　疮疥风癣

    　　小儿疮疥风癣，可用雄黄散加芒硝少许，油调傅之。如面上有疮癣，不宜擦药，恐因而入眼则损目矣。
    　　　　　疮疖瘤肿

    　　小儿赤瘤肿发之时，疼痛不止，《内经》曰：诸痛痒疮疡，皆主于心火，可用一咒法禁之。法者是心法，呪曰：　　龙鬼流兮诸毒肿，痈疮脓血甚被痛；忘心称念大悲咒，三唾毒肿随手消。　　右，一气念咒三遍，望日月灯火，取气一口，吹在疮肿丹瘤之上，右手在疮上虚收虚撮三次，左手不动。每一气念三遍，虚收虚撮三次，百无禁忌。如用之时，心正为是。此法得于袓母韩氏，相传一百余年，用之救人，百发百中。若不食荤酒之人，其法更灵。病疮肿者，大忌鸡猪鱼兔发热动风之物。此法不得轻侮，无药处可用之。
    　　　　平治会萃 【元　朱震亨】[7p]

    Ulcers and Skin Conditions

    For children with ulcers, scabies, or skin lesions, you can use a mixture of realgar powder with a little bit of mirabilite, mixed with oil for application. If there are sores or lesions on the face, it’s not advisable to apply medicine, for fear of it getting into the eyes, which could result in damage to vision.

    Boils and Tumors

    When children experience red tumors and swellings that cause continuous pain, the "Inner Canon" states that all pains and itchy sores are due to heart fire, and a specific incantation can be used to suppress it. The method involves a mental focus, and the incantation goes as follows: "Dragon spirits flow, all toxic swellings; sores with pus and blood are causing pain; forget the mind, recite the Great Compassion Mantra, and the toxins will dissipate."

    Repeat the incantation three times, while facing the sun, moon, or a light source, take a breath, and blow it onto the swollen tumors. With the right hand, make a gentle gathering and compressing motion over the sores three times, while keeping the left hand still. Each breath should be followed by three gentle gathers and compresses, with no taboos to worry about. When using this method, ensure your mind is focused. This method comes from my ancestor, Han, and has been passed down for over a hundred years, successfully helping countless people. If the patient does not consume meat or alcohol, the method becomes even more effective. Those suffering from sores and swellings should avoid warm and moving foods like chicken, pork, fish, and rabbit. This method should not be treated lightly; it can be applied where no medicines are available.

    Pingzhi Huicui 【Yuan, Zhu Zhenheng】[7p]

    　　　　　赤溜

    　　赤溜宜用生地黄、木通、荆芥苦药带表之类，再用芭蕉油涂患处。　　夫小儿心气郁而多疮疽，由胎食过而受毒，此至论也。小儿识见未萌，欲想未动，心气何郁？先哲谓乳下小儿，常多湿热，与胎食过而受毒；又有成胎之时，父母气血有寒热之偏，多致子之病。况形体未坚完，肓膜尚脆嫩，何为略而未论？向见一人连年痁病，新愈而生一男，生来三月，病热，右腋下阳明少阳之间生一疖，甫平，左腋下相对又生一疖，脓血淋漓，无复生意。医者王寿甫以四物汤、败毒散加参，以香附为佐，犀角为使，大料饮乳母两月而安。逾三月，忽腹胀生赤疹如霞片，取剪刀草汁调晚蚕沙，敷之随消。半月胀移入胞囊为肿，黄莹可畏；越两日囊裂开，两丸显露，出清水，以紫苏叶承面炭细末托之，旬余而合。夫以父之久病，其母宁无忧郁之火，与痁之余热毒致此，亦不可不知。
    　　　　卫生宝鉴 【元　罗天益】[8p]

    Red Sores

    Red sores should be treated with fresh rehmannia, mutong, and the bitter herbs such as dogbane, along with balsam oil applied to the affected area. Children often suffer from stasis of the heart qi leading to sores and abscesses, which result from excessive intake while in the womb. This is a principle that must be addressed. Children, before they are able to see or think, have no means to feel such stasis in their hearts. Ancient sages stated that infants often have much dampness and heat due to prenatal excess; also, when the fetus is being formed, the parents’ qi and blood may be imbalanced in cold and heat, leading to numerous illnesses in their offspring. In particular, as their bodies are not yet sturdy and their membranes are delicate, any slight disturbance should be addressed rigorously.

    I once saw a person who had suffered from long-term cough illness. After recovery, he had a son who, at three months old, developed a fever and a boil appeared under the right armpit between the yangming and shaoyang areas. As this abscess healed, another one formed under the left armpit, oozing pus and blood with no signs of recovery. The physician Wang Shoufu treated him with Siwu Decoction and Baidu San, adding ginseng, using xiangfu to assist and rhinoceros horn as the main ingredient, feeding the mother for two months, after which the child was stable.

    After three months, he suddenly developed abdominal swelling and a red rash resembling clouds. Juices from cut grass were mixed with silkworm droppings and applied to it, leading to gradual disappearance. Half a month later, the swelling moved into the capsule, becoming a lump that looked concerning. After two days, the capsule burst, revealing two masses that discharged clear fluid. Using perilla leaves to hold fine charcoal powder, it took about ten days for the condition to heal. It must be understood that the prolonged illness of the father likely caused the mother to have worries and anger, exacerbating the remaining heat and toxins from the cough, leading to this situation.

    — From "Treasures of Health" 【Yuan Dynasty, Luo Tianyi】[8p]

    　　　　　眉炼

    　　小儿眉炼，在面曰眉炼，在耳曰辄耳，在足曰靴痒，此三者皆谬名也。《内经》曰：诸痛痒疮疡皆属心火，乃心火热盛之致然也。可用(金非)针刺之而出血；一刺不愈，当再刺之，二刺则必愈矣。《内经》云：血实者宜决之。决者破其血也。眉炼者，不可用药敷之。其疮多痒则必爬，若药入眼则眼必损矣。
    　　　　片玉心书 【明　万全】

    　　　　　丹毒

    　　小儿赤游丹毒，虽有十种，皆由心火内盛，热与血搏，或起于手足，或发于头面胸背，游移上下，其热如火，痛不可言，赤如丹砂，故名丹毒。自腹出四肢者易治，自四肢入腹者难治。疗此证者，其法必先用表药以解热毒，方可搽敷。若遽用药搽，使气无所泄，而入里伤人者多矣。　　小儿丹毒，一岁以上者易治，未周岁者难治。　　小儿十种丹瘤：一飞灶丹，二走灶丹，三鬼火丹，四天火丹，五天窜丹，六水丹，七葫芦丹，八野火丹，九烟火丹，十胡漏丹。[9p]

    Eyebrow Refinement

    The refinement of the eyebrow in children is called eyebrow refinement on the face, it is referred to as zjier in the ears, and as shoe itch in the feet. These three names are all erroneous. The Inner Canon states that all pain, itch, sores, and ulcers are attributed to the heart fire; it is the result of excessive heat from the heart fire. One can use a (non-metal) needle to prick it and cause bleeding; if it does not heal with one prick, it must be pricked again, as a second prick will surely lead to healing. The Inner Canon states that when there is excess blood, it should be drained. To drain means to break the blood. For eyebrow refinement, one must not apply medication externally. If the sores are very itchy, it will lead to scratching; if the medicine enters the eye, it will surely cause damage.

    Dan Poison

    Children with red dan poison, although there are ten types, are all caused by the internal exuberance of heart fire, where heat collides with blood. It may arise from the hands and feet or manifest on the head, face, chest, and back, wandering up and down. Its heat is like fire, with pain that is indescribable, and red like cinnabar, hence it is named dan poison. If it emerges from the abdomen to the limbs, it is easy to treat; if it goes from the limbs into the abdomen, it is difficult to treat. The method to treat this condition must first use exterior medications to resolve heat poison before applying topical treatments. If medications are applied hastily, causing the qi to be trapped without release, they might harm the internal organs. Dan poison in children is easy to treat for those over one year old, but difficult for those under one year old. The ten types of dan tumors in children are: 1. Flying stove dan, 2. Walking stove dan, 3. Ghost fire dan, 4. Heavenly fire dan, 5. Heavenly escape dan, 6. Water dan, 7. Gourd dan, 8. Wild fire dan, 9. Smoke fire dan, 10. Hu lou dan.[9p]

    许学士云：此十种丹毒，如三日不治，攻入肠胃，则不救也。宜逐一仔细辨认，依方为之，万不失一。　　小儿十种丹毒，俱先服防风升麻汤以解其毒，次用蜞针法以去其毒血。如无蜞针，用砭针法。然后用救急法。　　小儿丹毒，腹胀气喘，闷乱不乳，及惊搐者，皆不可治。　　小儿生后百日之内，半岁以上，两眼泡红晕微起。面青黯色，夜则烦哭，或脸如胭脂，此因伏热在内，发之于外，初则满面状如水痘，脚微红而不壮，出没休息无定次，至颈项赤如丹砂，名为惊丹，三解散治之。　　西江月[10p]

    Scholar Xu said: This ten types of dandu (toxic rash) cannot be treated if not addressed within three days; if it attacks the intestines and stomach, it is beyond saving. One should carefully distinguish each type and follow the prescribed methods to avoid any mistakes.

    For children with the ten types of dandu, first administer a decoction of Fangfeng and Shengma to resolve the toxicity, followed by the use of the Qizhen method to eliminate the toxic blood. If Qizhen is not available, use the Bian needle method. Then employ emergency measures.

    For children with dandu, symptoms such as abdominal bloating, wheezing, unrest and refusal to nurse, or convulsions, indicate that treatment is not advisable.

    If a child is within a hundred days after birth and more than half a year old, with slightly swollen reddish eyelids and a dusky complexion, becoming restless at night or having a face resembling rouge, this is due to internal heat manifesting externally. Initially, the face may appear similar to chickenpox, with slightly reddened feet and irregular appearance. If the neck becomes as red as cinnabar, it is called "jingdan" (startling dan). Treat with Sanjie San.[10p]

    　　小儿赤游丹毒，虽有十种原根。皆由心火热多深，上下游移不定。其色浑如丹石，故称丹毒之名。治法方册甚分明，全在医家体认。　　小儿流丹最毒，十种发出不同。自上而下莫至胸，自下至肾可恸。半周之内休见，满周病此宜攻。蜞针的的有神功，内解外敷兼用。　　内解归梢赤芍，羌活荆芥防风。升麻甘草地黄通，竹叶元参煎用。外用益元敷贴，更加寒水相同。三朝五日急相攻，惊搐灵丹如梦。　　治丹用功次第，从头一一铺陈。解表下毒药先行，次用蜞针吮进。若是蜞针不便，须臾急用砭针。然后涂药救孩身，此法前人已定。　　捷法先须解毒，或将利药疏通。初起涂敷莫胡攻，毒入于里遏壅。解毒无价散子，防风升麻汤同。利药灵应有神功，只在医人善用。　　经验治丹妙法，而今说与后人。先将灵应涤病身，下后纔施涂润。田螺捣饼敷贴，或用水调灶心。又将南星大黄停，芒硝研匀水浸。　　歌[11p]

    Children suffering from red rashes and dan disease may originate from ten causes. It is all due to excessive heat in the heart, fluctuating up and down. Its color is murky like cinnabar, hence the name “dan disease.” The treatment methods are clearly laid out in medical texts, depending on the practitioner's understanding.

    In children, dan is the most toxic, manifesting differently in ten forms. From above to below, it may not reach the chest; from below to the kidneys, it can cause great distress. Within half a cycle, it should not be seen; a full cycle indicates the need for intervention. The use of qīzhēn (a kind of needle) is effective both internally and externally.

    For internal relief, one uses red peony, qinghao, and protective wind herbs. Sheng ma, licorice, and rehmannia are combined, while bamboo leaves and original ginseng are boiled for use. Externally, Yiyuan is pasted on, and cold water is similarly employed. Within three to five days, urgent measures should be taken, for surprises may arise akin to dreams.

    The treatment of dan follows a certain order, starting from the head and laying out each step. Dissolving the exterior and using detoxifying agents comes first, followed by inserting qīzhēn. If qīzhēn is inconvenient, one should urgently use acupuncture needles. Then apply medicinal ointments to save the child, a method established by predecessors.

    The swift method requires detoxification first, or employing purgative medicines to relieve blockage. At the onset, do not aggressively attack; poisons lurking within must be expelled. The treasure of detoxification is unparalleled, along with decoctions of protective wind and sheng ma. Effective medicinal substances possess divine power, depending entirely on the skill of the healer.

    Experienced methods for treating dan are now shared for future generations. First, cleanse and purify the sick body, then apply soothing treatments. Bashed field snails can be prepared for application, or water can be mixed with heating methods. Moreover, use nansheng and rhubarb in moderation, with mang xiao ground and soaked in water.[11p]

    　　烘热衣与儿，火丹遂成之。芒硝寒水石，青黛石膏奇。赤痣因何起？胎中受热多。原来无大害，不必请医和。[12p]

    Heating the clothes for the child, the fire elixir is thus formed. Bitter salt and cold water stone, blue indigo and gypsum are marvelous. Why does the red mole arise? It is due to excessive heat in the womb. In truth, it is not a great harm, there is no need to seek a doctor for treatment.[12p]

    　　　　　胎毒

    　　胎毒者，精血中之火毒，即命门相火之毒。命门者，男子以藏精，女子以系胞也。观东垣有红瘤之论，丹溪胎毒之论，治法可见矣。古方有解毒之方，如黄连甘草法，又有育婴解毒延龄丹，皆良法也。余新立一方，用丹溪三补丸方，芩、连、蘗半生用半酒炒，甘草半生半炙，各等分为末，雪水丸麻子大，朱砂、雄黄为衣，名曰生熟解毒丸。小儿日与服之，佳。　　有胎毒所生者，如虫疥流丹，浸淫湿疮，痈疖结核，重舌木舌，鹅口口疮，与夫胎热胎寒，胎黄胎惊之类。儿之初生，有病多属胎毒，如一腊之脐风、百晬之痰嗽难医，恰半岁而真搐者凶，未一周而流丹者死，是也。况初生之儿，肠胃薄小，血气未充，药石难进，荣卫微弱，筋脉未实，针灸难周，业幼科者，慎勿忽诸！　　或问胎毒之说，余曰：先贤论之详矣。盖人生而静，天之性也。感于物而动，胎之性也。欲者火也。[13p]

    Fetal Toxicity

    Fetal toxicity refers to the fiery poison within the essence and blood, specifically the poison of the Fire of the Vital Gate. The Vital Gate is where men store their essence and women maintain their womb. Observing the discussions by Dongyuan on red tumors and Danxi on fetal toxicity, the treatment methods can be discerned. Ancient formulas exist for detoxification, such as the Huanglian Gancao method, and there are also elixirs for nurturing infants and detoxification, which are both good methods.

    I have recently established a new formula using Danxi's Sanbu Pill recipe, with Qinxian, Huanglian, and Hainang half-cooked and stir-fried in half wine, and Gancao half-cooked and half-roasted, each blended into powder in equal portions. Forming them into pills the size of sesame seeds with a coating of vermilion and realgar, I named it the Shengshu Jiedu Pill. Administering this to children daily is beneficial.

    Those born with fetal toxicity exhibit issues such as scabies, moist sores, abscesses, hard lumps, heavy or aberrant tongues, and oral sores, as well as feelings of heat or cold, jaundice, and fright associated with fetal conditions. Many newborns are afflicted by fetal toxicity-related ailments. For instance, issues such as umbilical wind or stubborn phlegm coughs can be difficult to treat; if a child has true convulsions at six months, that is ominous, while those with sores before a week are likely to die. Moreover, newborns have delicate stomachs and intestines, their blood and qi are insufficient, making it hard to introduce herbs or stones, and their defenses are weak with underdeveloped meridians, making acupuncture challenging. Practitioners should exercise caution!

    When asked about the concept of fetal toxicity, I replied: the wise have discussed it thoroughly. After all, humans are born in a state of tranquility, which is the essence of nature. They are stirred by stimuli, which is the nature of the fetus. Desire is akin to fire.[13p]

    故思虑之妄，火生于心；恚怒之发，火生于肝；悲哀之过，火起于肺；酒肉之餍，火起于脾；淫佚之纵，火起于肾。五欲之火，隐于母血之中，即是毒也。男女交媾，精气凝结，毒亦附焉，此胎毒之原也。如谓儿在母腹，饥则食母之血，渴则饮母之血，及其破胎而出，口有余血，拭之不净，咽下腹中，是名胎毒。斯言也，一人倡之，百人和之，未有辩之者，此书之不可尽信也。胚胎资始，父精所生；身体资生，母血所养。[14p]

    Therefore, the delusions of thought arise as fire in the heart; the outburst of anger manifests as fire in the liver; the overflow of sorrow ignites as fire in the lungs; the indulgence in food and drink causes fire in the spleen; and the uninhibited desires spark fire in the kidneys. The fire of the five desires lies hidden within the maternal blood, and this is poison. In the act of sexual union, when the essence凝结, poison is also attached, which is the origin of the fetal poison. It is said that when a child is in the mother's womb, if hungry, it consumes the mother’s blood, and if thirsty, it drinks the mother’s blood. Once it breaks free from the womb, if there is residual blood in its mouth that is not cleaned properly and is swallowed into the belly, this is called fetal poison. Such words, once proposed by one person, are echoed by many, and none have sought to argue against them, which shows the unreliability of this text. The embryo begins from the father's essence; the body is nourished by the mother's blood.[14p]

    是水珠露花，男女渐分，毫发筋骨，形象斯具，诞弥厥月，气足形全，乃破胎而生矣。初在母腹之时，如鸟之雏伏于卵壳之中，何所饮食耶？口之血，乃母临产，恶露渍入口中，未必是母腹中所(口衔)血也。既云咽下腹中，则入于大肠界，从大便出矣，安得留在命门待时而发耶？　　丹瘤发搐，视其先后何如，先发丹后发搐者不治，此胎毒自外入里也。先发搐后发丹者，此名惊丹，可治，此胎毒自内而外也，宜用大连翘饮主之。　　小儿诸疮，皆胎毒也。命门者，右肾也。[15p]

    It is like water droplets dewy on flowers, as men and women gradually separate. The hair and bones, the form and essence are complete, and thus, born after a month. Initially, in the mother's womb, it resembles a chick nestled within an eggshell; what is there to eat or drink? The blood from the mouth comes as the mother delivers, and the lochia soaks into the mouth, not necessarily the blood from within the mother's womb. Once swallowed, it enters the large intestine, discharging through feces; how can it remain in the life gate waiting to emerge?

    As for the red swellings and convulsions, consider their order: those with red appearing first and convulsions later are incurable; this is the poison of the fetus entering from the outside. However, if convulsions appear first and red follows, it is known as startled red and can be treated; this is the poison of the fetus coming from within and should be managed with a decoction of Lianqiao.

    All sores in infants are due to fetal poison. The life gate refers to the right kidney.[15p]

    虽云男子以藏精，女以系胞，父母命门之中原有伏火，胚胎之始，儿即受之，既生之后，其火必发为痈疽丹疹疥癣一切恶疮，名曰胎毒者是也。古人立法于儿初生之时，有拭口法，有黄连甘草朱蜜法，无非为解毒而设也。后人因之合上三法，取脐带合药，名曰育婴延龄解毒丹。　　东垣之治红丝瘤，丹溪之治小便淋，皆有解毒之法，见《格致余论》，须博求之。　　小儿初生，有育婴延龄解毒丹，服之能解其胎毒。其有发疮疡者，有溯源解毒汤，乳母服之。　　小儿丹发于睑，眼中红肿，手不可近，必三日死。　　小儿生下一月后，遍身虫疥，浸淫湿烂，其皮如脱，日夜啼叫，忽一日其疮尽隐，必发搐而死。　　小儿丹瘤，此胎毒之最酷者，即红丝瘤也，又名龙缠火带，乃小儿之恶疾。二岁以上儿可治，半岁周岁者难冶，百无一二也。发处肿硬一块，其色甚赤，手不可近，如火炙流铜，往下迸走，自头上起至心即死，自足下起至肾即死。[16p]

    Although it is said that men store essence and women bind the womb, there is hidden fire in the gate of life of parents. At the beginning of the embryo, the child receives this fire. After birth, this fire must manifest as abscesses, sores, rashes, scabies, and all kinds of vicious sores, which are termed "fetal poison." The ancients established laws for newborns, including methods to cleanse the mouth and formulas of yellow root, licorice, and vermilion honey, all devised to detoxify. Later generations combined these three methods, using the umbilical cord and medicines, naming it "Infant Nurturing Longevity Detoxification Pill."

    In the treatment of red fibrous tumors by Dongyuan and the treatment of urinary dribbling by Danxi, there are detoxification methods found in "Gzhiyu Lun," which must be broadly studied.

    For newborns, there are "Infant Nurturing Longevity Detoxification Pills" that can resolve fetal poison. If there are sores and abscesses, there is a detoxifying soup for breastfeeding mothers to consume.

    When a child develops red sores on the eyelid, with redness and swelling in the eyes, do not approach; they will surely die within three days.

    If a child, one month old, is covered in scabies, soaked and rotten, with skin resembling peeling, crying day and night, and suddenly all the sores disappear, they will surely convulse and die.

    Red tumors in children, the most severe fetal poison, are the red fibrous tumors, also known as "dragon binding fire belt," a dire disease in children. Those above two years can be treated; those under a year or half a year are difficult to cure, with very few exceptions. The affected area appears swollen and hard, with a very red color, and should not be approached, as if it were being burned with flowing copper; if it spreads downwards from the head to the heart, death is certain, and if it spreads from the feet to the kidneys, death is also inevitable.[16p]

    古方治法无可取者，惟家传蜞针法、砭法出其恶气，以泄其火毒，十治六七，诚良法也。经云：血实者决之是也。切不可用寒凉之药敷之，使火毒郁而不得泄，入腹为腹胀、为腹痛，为喘为惊狂，为搐搦者，必死。宜用通圣散全料銼细，入酒中浸透晒干，炒研为极细末，蜜水调服；外以通圣散加金银花藤叶煎汤浴之，此水渍法，亦火郁则发之也。先发惊后发丹者，可治；通圣散主之，或用导赤散加连翘、元参、防风、荆芥穗丸。先发丹后发惊者，不治。[17p]

    In ancient methods of treatment, there is nothing to be taken; only the family tradition of the needle technique and the use of stone for dispelling malevolent energy and releasing toxic fire can achieve results, treating six or seven cases out of ten—truly a good method. The text states that "blood that is full should be drained." One must never use cold or cooling medicines externally, as they can cause the toxic fire to become stagnant, leading to abdominal distension, pain, shortness of breath, anxiety, or convulsions, which results in certain death. It is advisable to use Tongsheng Powder, finely ground, soaked in wine and dried, then ground into a very fine powder, to be taken with honey water; externally, use Tongsheng Powder combined with honeysuckle vine leaves, boiled and used for baths—this method through water also releases stagnant fire. If the shock is treated before the redness, it can be cured; Tongsheng Powder is used primarily, or one may add Daohong Powder with honeysuckle, Scrophularia, Siler, and Schizonepeta to form pills. If redness is treated before shock, it cannot be cured.[17p]

    　　小儿生下遍身虫疥干痒，喜人摩拍，余制一方，用乌蛇酒浸焙干，取肉一钱，苦参酒浸焙干二钱，炒胡麻仁、炒去刺白蒺藜各一钱五分，共为末，用浸蛇与苦参酒糊为丸，甘草汤下愈。　　小儿初生，遍身生虫疮，及流水疮、风疮，皆胎毒也。切勿搽药；恐逼毒入腹。宜服胡麻丸。　　凡有误用搽药，逼毒入腹，以致腹胀者；解毒丸主之。　　凡有头面遍身生疮，非关搽药，忽然自平，加痰喘者，切不可解利，当以连翘汤治之。以上数证，俱是胎毒，不可用灸法。　　西江月
    　　小儿遍身疮疥，虫窠脓血浸淫。此由胎毒内藏深，故有许多形证。凉血杀虫解毒，胡麻丸子通神。切防搽洗毒归心，腹痛神昏命尽。　　若是要用搽药，瘙痒无过蛇床。(上匿下虫)虫作楚用硫黄，痛肿寒水为当。不痒须加狗脊，喜盐汤火硫黄，斑【（阙五字）】 良，手擦鼻闻擦上。[18p]

    A child is born with itching and skin lesions all over their body, enjoying being massaged and patted. I have devised a prescription: using black snake wine to soak and dry the meat of a black snake, one qian; using bitter bergamot wine to soak and dry two qian; and frying sesame seeds and removing the thorns from white tribulus, each one and a half qian. Combine these into a powder, then make into pills with the soaked snake and bitter bergamot wine as a binder, and take with licorice soup for recovery.

    When a child is newly born, if they have sores all over their body, as well as running sores and wind sores, these are all due to fetal toxin. Do not apply any medicines topically; it may cause the toxin to enter the abdomen. It is advisable to take sesame pills.

    If there is a mistake in applying topical medicine, causing the toxin to enter the abdomen and resulting in abdominal distension, use the detoxifying pills as the main remedy.

    If the head and face as well as the whole body develop sores, and they are not related to topical applications but suddenly heal, accompanied by phlegm and wheezing, one must not induce diarrhea; instead, treat it with honeysuckle decoction. The above cases are all related to fetal toxins, and moxibustion should not be used.

    In the "West River Moon," it says:
    A child suffers from sores and scabs over their body, with pus and blood from insect nests. This is due to deeply hidden fetal toxins, hence there are many symptomatic manifestations. Cooling the blood, killing insects, and detoxifying with sesame pills is effective. Care should be taken to avoid applying topical drugs, which may bring the toxin back to the heart, causing abdominal pain, mental confusion, and potential death.

    If topical medication is to be used, for itching, one should not exceed using wild rue (for insects beneath the surface). For insect-related issues, use sulfur; for pain, swelling, and cold water, that is appropriate. If it is not itchy, add dog spine herb and enjoy salt water with heated sulfur. Use caution, and apply what is effective, such as rubbing the hands and smelling at the nose.[18p]

    　　　　育婴家秘 【明　万全】

    　　　　　丹毒

    　　一丹毒发搐者病在少阳，少阳者胆相火也。先搐后发丹瘤者，此毒火自内出外也，可治；先发丹后发搐者，毒自外入内也，必死。自内出者，火之余，宜发散解毒及砭法，防风通圣散主之，或用加减升麻葛根汤。　　一疮痈发搐，此胎毒也。小儿身生虫疥，浸淫痒痛，不知用药，内服解毒之剂，外用砒硫毒药搽之，疮忽自平，或不搽自平者。其候腹胀便闭，肤无血色，目闭不开而发搐者，乃恶候也，急进解毒之剂，疮出方生，疮不出加喘者死。雄黄解毒丸主之。　　凡小儿未周岁者，不问痈毒疮疥丹瘤，但发搐者皆难治，脾胃嫩脆，谷气未实，难以药攻也。[19p]

    Secrets of Infant Care
    [Ming Dynasty, Wanquan]

    Dan Poison

    When a child experiences spasms due to Dan Poison, the illness is located in the Shaoyang, and the Shaoyang pertains to the fire of the gallbladder. If spasms occur before the appearance of Dan tumors, this indicates that the toxic fire is emanating from within and can be treated. Conversely, if the tumors appear before the spasms, the poison has entered from the outside and is fatal. For those where the poison is from within, which is a residual fire, it is advisable to disperse and detoxify by using methods such as Feng Tong Sheng San, or employing a modified version of Sheng Ma Ge Gen Decoction.

    For sores and abscesses causing spasms, this indicates prenatal poison. Infants may develop parasitic skin conditions, causing itching and pain, not knowing what medication to use. Internal detoxifying medicine and external applications of arsenious sulfur drugs may lead to a quick relief of sores, or in some cases, the sores may resolve without application. Signs of abdominal distension and constipation, lack of blood color in the skin, and inability to open the eyes while having spasms indicate a severe condition, necessitating urgent detoxifying medicine. The emergence of sores is necessary; failure to do so, coupled with difficulty breathing, leads to death. The main remedy is Xiong Huang Detoxicating Pill.

    For infants under one year of age, regardless of whether it is sores, abscesses, or Dan tumors, if spasms occur, it is all difficult to treat, as their spleen and stomach are delicate, their digestive qi is not yet fully developed, making it hard to administer medicinal attacks.[19p]

    　　　　幼科发挥 【明　万全】

    　　　　　疥癣

    　　疥癣干者可治，胡麻丸主之。若浸淫溃烂，身无完肤，日夜啼哭者，不可治。切不可用砒硫粉汞为药搽之，使毒气乘虚入腹，发搐发喘者皆死。凡小儿疮疥，宜调乳母溯源解毒汤主之。
    　　　　婴童百问 【明　鲁伯嗣】

    　　　　　丹毒赤游肿

    　　仲阳云：热毒之气，客于腠理，搏于血气，发于外皮上赤如丹，热毒与血相击，而风气乘之，所以赤肿游走而遍体也。此由乳母食酒面煎炙过度，与夫烘衣与儿，不候冷而即穿着，多成此证。或发于头面胸背，令儿躁闷腹胀，如火之热，痛不可言。有入腹入肾之证，便不可救。又小儿一周之内，皮毛肌肉，筋骨髓脑，五脏六腑，荣卫血气，皆未坚固，譬如草木萌芽之状，未经寒暑，娇嫩软弱，故今婴孩称为芽儿也。一周之内，切不可频频洗浴，恐湿热之气郁蒸不散。[20p]

    Scabies and Eruptive Skin Conditions

    遍身生赤游丹毒，倘谓之瘤，片片如胭脂涂染，皆肿而壮热。若毒入腹者，则腹胀硬气以致杀儿，此因洗浴而得也。若肌肉宽缓，腠理开泄，包裹失宜，复为风邪所乘，而身生白瘤，皆肿而壮热也，或增寒壮热，鼻塞脑闷，或上气痰喘，咳嗽吐逆，种种之疾，皆因洗浴脱着而得也。治赤瘤丹毒，可用小刀子疏去瘤头赤晕恶血毒汁，次以冰黄散、葛根白朮散、惺芎散主之；败毒散及升麻汤、防己散皆可选而用之。又丹热、实热、龙带热，并用大连翘汤加大黄及灯心煎服，殊验。[21p]

    　　　　　发斑

    　　发斑有两证，有温毒发斑，有胃烂发斑也。温毒发斑者，为冬月温暖，人感乖戾之气，未即病发，至春或被积寒所折，毒气不得泄，至天气暄热，温毒始发，则肌肉斑烂，瘾疹如锦纹，其治用葛根橘皮汤、黄连橘皮汤主之。若胃烂发斑者，伤寒未下即发斑，下早亦发斑。盖不当下而下之，热气乘虚入胃；当下失下则胃热不得泄，所以皆发斑，不可用表药。盖表虚里实，若发其汗，重令开泄，更增斑烂，表虚故也，黑参升麻汤、化斑汤主之。伤寒发斑，只是热气在脏腑，先攻肠胃，里蕴成疮，方发出外。赤者易治，黑者难治，盖毒气入胃之深故也。羌活散加蝉蜕，治斑亦可。[24p]

    Rashes

    Rashes have two types: those caused by warm toxins and those resulting from gastric decay. The rashes due to warm toxins happen during warm winter months when individuals are exposed to an adverse atmosphere. If not immediately manifested as illness, they may be triggered in the spring by accumulated cold, preventing the release of toxic energy. As the weather warms, these warm toxins manifest, causing the muscles to rot and resulting in rashes resembling brocade patterns. The appropriate treatments include Ge Gen and Ju Pi Decoctions, and Huang Lian and Ju Pi Decoctions as primary remedies.

    On the other hand, rashes resulting from gastric decay may appear before or shortly after an attack of illness. This is due to improper purging, allowing heat to invade the stomach; when purging is needed but not done, gastric heat fails to dissipate, resulting in rashes. In such cases, surface medicines should not be used, as the surface is weak while the interior is strong. If sweating is induced, it could aggravate the problem and worsen the rashes due to the surface weakness. The recommended treatments include Hei Shen Shengma Decoction and Huaban Decoction.

    Rashes from a febrile illness indicate that heat is within the organs, attacking the intestines and stomach, resulting in internal sores before appearing externally. Red rashes are easier to treat, while black rashes are harder, due to the deeper invasion of toxic energy into the stomach. Qiang Huo Powder with Ciban is also suitable for treating rashes.[24p]

    　　　　　疮癣

    　　汤氏云：小儿伤湿，血气壅滞则生疮，多由父母并奶子不好洁凈，衣褥不与频换清濯，或尿屎秽污连日不洗，亦能浸渍而成疮。天气温和，频与澡洗更衣，名曰外宣，亦不须服药。小儿不得已而服药，此乃下策。将养合宜，何病可侵？更令乳哺有节，勿令过饱，其身乃如莳树，此调养之理也。浴方，春用柳条荆芥，夏用枣叶槐枝，秋冬用苦参，频浴身安，外宣无病。金华散，又敷疮癣等方，皆可用也。摩风膏敷疮癣极妙，兼服羌活散加防风、荆芥，及大连翘饮、升麻汤等剂。[25p]

    　　　　　小儿遗毒烂斑

    　　遗毒，乃未生前在于胞胎禀受，因父母杨梅疮后，余毒未尽，精血孕成。故既生之后，热汤洗浴，烘熏衣物，外热触动，内毒必发于肌肤之表。先出红点，次成烂斑，甚者口角、谷道、眼匡、鼻面皮肉俱坏，多妨乳哺，啼叫不安。初治宜早，内与土茯苓汤调人中黄末，每日数次，共饮四五分；外用解毒紫金丹磨涂患上。效者可保十中三四；迟延毒甚，烂斑遍身不乳者，百中难活一二。此由根蒂受毒之深故也。[26p]

    　　　　Authentic Practices of Surgery 【Ming Dynasty – Chen Shigong】

    　　　　　Childhood Residual Toxicity and Ulcerative Spots

    Residual toxicity refers to the remnants received in utero before birth. This occurs when parents suffer from conditions like yang mei sores, leaving behind lingering toxins that affect the essence and blood during conception. After birth, if the child is bathed in hot water and heated clothing is applied, the external heat will provoke the internal toxins to surface on the skin. Initially, red dots appear, followed by ulcerative spots; in severe cases, the corners of the mouth, genital area, eyes, and facial skin might all deteriorate, hindering breastfeeding and causing restlessness and crying. Early treatment is essential; administer a mixture of tu fu ling (smilax) powder and yellow essence in the mouth several times a day, about four to five portions. Externally apply the detoxifying Zi Jin Dan (Purple Gold Powder) to the affected areas. Those that respond effectively may have a survival rate of three or four out of ten; however, if treatment is delayed and the toxic condition worsens with widespread ulcerations, the chance of survival may drop to one or two out of a hundred. This is due to the depth of the toxin's roots.[26p]

    　　　　　小儿赤游丹

    　　赤游丹受毒于未生前，发病于有生后。盖身在胞胎，皆赖父精母血，借以生养，父母不能节其欲，多致淫火猖炽，胎必侵受；又不能戒诸厚味，以及炭火烘熏，重衾迭褥，往往受热，子无弗有；及至生后，热汤洗浴，烘熏衣物，触动内毒而发。欲发之时，先必身热，啼叫惊搐，次生红肿，光亮发热，瞬息游走，发无定处。先从头额起者，名天罩丹，以升麻葛根汤母子同服。余皆起于腹背，流入四肢者轻；起于四肢，流入胸腹者重。医此总皆先砭恶血为要；砭血之后，先用精猪肉切片贴之，一时许，换如意金黄散，用水芭蕉根捣汁调敷，甚者日换二次；内以大连翘饮、消毒犀角饮、五福化毒丹。毒气入里，腹胀坚硬不乳者，紫雪散下之。三日后身渐彻凉，砭血之处，肉便软活，声清腹软，乳哺如常者，顺；反此为逆。[27p]

    Childhood Scarlet Fever

    Scarlet fever is contracted before birth, but symptoms appear after birth. While in the womb, a child relies on the father's essence and the mother's blood for nourishment. If the parents cannot control their desires, excessive heat can harm the fetus; moreover, they cannot avoid rich flavors or the warmth from coal and heavy bedding, which often causes heat to accumulate in the child. Once born, bathing in hot water, exposure to heated clothing, and the activation of internal toxins can trigger the disease.

    When symptoms arise, the child first experiences fever, crying, and spasms; next, rashes appear that are red, swollen, bright, and hot, often moving quickly and unpredictably. If the rash starts on the forehead, it is named "Heavenly Covering Powder," to be treated with a decoction of Rhubarb and Kudzu that both mother and child should consume. If the rash begins from the belly and back, spreading to the limbs, it is mild; if it originates in the limbs and spreads to the chest and belly, it is severe.

    The treatment focuses initially on blood-letting to remove toxic blood. After blood-letting, slices of fatty pork should be placed on the affected area for a while, and then replaced with a golden powder mixed with juice from water banana roots. For severe cases, this should be changed twice a day. Internally, one can use a decoction of Lonicera japonica, a detoxifying mixture with rhinoceros horn, or a five-fruit detoxification pill. If toxicity leads to a hard, swollen belly without milk production, one should administer “Purple Snow Powder.”

    Three days later, if the body gradually cools, the area where blood was drawn becomes soft and active, with clear sounds and normal milk production, then the recovery is on track; otherwise, it may be a sign of deterioration.[27p]

    　　　　　腮痈

    　　腮属足阳明胃经，其生痈者，多因儿食甘甜厚味，脾胃积热所致，亦有乳母郁怒而受其患者。若因热积于内，二便不通者，用凉膈散；风邪相搏，二便如常者，用漏芦汤；胃经风热或兼咽喉肿痛，用升麻防风汤。
    　　　　　耳疮

    　　若禀赋阴虚，火动颏间，或两耳内生疮，或出脓不止者，宜用地黄丸。若因乳母肝火乘脾，用加味逍遥散；脾经郁热，用加味归脾汤；膏梁积热，用东垣清胃散；脾胃风热，用清咽利膈汤。仍参口疮治之。
    　　　　　斑疹丹毒脉治

    　　脉浮者，消风为主。脉浮数者，袪风清热。脉沉数者，泻火为主。脉数按之沉实者，解表攻里。
    　　　　外科经验方 【明　薛己】 [明　薛己　原缺，据《中医图书联合目录》补。]
    　　　　　丹毒

    　　小儿丹毒，多生头面四肢，色赤游走不定，用磁芒令毒血遇刺皆出，更以神功散敷之，内服荆防败毒散，或五福化毒丹。入腹者不治。[31p]

    Mumps

    Mumps belongs to the Yangming stomach channel of the foot, and the occurrence of abscesses is often due to children consuming sweet and rich foods, which causes heat accumulation in the spleen and stomach. There are also cases where the nursing mother’s anger affects the child. If caused by internal heat accumulation leading to obstruction of urination, use Liangge Powder; if due to wind invasion with normal urination, use Liu Lu Decoction; if there is wind-heat in the stomach channel or simultaneous throat swelling and pain, use Sheng Ma and Fang Feng Decoction.

    Ear Sores

    If one is constitutionally yin-deficient with fire affecting the chin, resulting in sores in or on both ears, or persistent pus discharge, it is advisable to use Di Huang Pill. If caused by the nursing mother's liver fire affecting the spleen, use modified Xiao Yao San; if there is heat accumulation in the spleen channel, use modified Gui Pi Decoction; if there is accumulated heat from rich foods, use Dong Yuan’s Qing Wei Powder; for wind-heat in the spleen and stomach, use Qing Yan and Li Ge Decoction. Additionally, refer to the treatment for mouth sores.

    Treatment of Rashes and Toxicity

    If the pulse is floating, the main focus is to dispel wind. If the pulse is floating and rapid, the focus is on dispelling wind and clearing heat. If the pulse is deep and rapid, the main focus is on draining heat. If the pulse is rapid but felt as deep and solid, it indicates a need to relieve the exterior and attack the interior.

    Surgical Experience Formulas [Ming Dynasty, Xue Ji]

    Erysipelas

    In children, erysipelas often appears on the head, face, and limbs, exhibiting a red and wandering nature. Use magnetic powder to draw out the toxic blood; additionally, apply Shen Gong Powder, and internally administer Jing Fang Bai Du Powder or Wu Fu Hua Du Dan. Cases with abdominal involvement are not treated.[31p]

    　　　　外科心法 【明　薛已】 [明　薛己　原缺，据《中医图书联合目录》补。]
    　　　　　痈疽论

    　　李氏云：小儿纯阳多热，心气郁而多疮疡，胎食过而受热毒，犀角散为最，余如常法，大下恐伤其胃。
    　　　　证治准绳 【明　王肯堂】

    　　　　　疮疡

    　　痈疽证治已详《疡医准绳》。其在小儿，虽肌体柔脆，而天真未凿，鲜五发之毒，亦无五善七恶之诊。初生周晬前后，遍体生疮，俗忌疗治。其他小小痈疖，自可敷贴而消。若增寒壮热，沉困躁扰，为心腹之害，又当求其本而治之。乳下婴儿，母子俱服，是在医师神而明之，无按图索骥之理。薛氏乃掇大科痈疽证治，赘附保婴，近于骈拇枝指矣。若夫溯流穷源，明经络，分表里，审顺逆，则无大小之异，有专科书在，又何赘焉！今第以小儿所专者，集为是编。[32p]

    Surgical Heart Method
    [By Ming Dynasty - Xue Yi, source supplemented from "Joint Directory of Traditional Chinese Medicine Books."]

    Discussion on Furuncles and Abscesses

    Li states: Young children, being purely Yang, often have excessive heat, with their heart Qi being obstructed and leading to many sores and lesions. If they consume too much fetal food, they will suffer from heat toxicity. Rhinoceros horn powder is the best remedy; the rest follows the usual methods, but excessive purging may harm their stomachs.

    Standards for Diagnosis and Treatment
    [By Ming Dynasty - Wang Kengtang]

    Sores and Ulcers

    The treatment for furuncles and abscesses is detailed in "Standards for Ulcer Medicine." In children, although their bodies are weak and delicate, their nature is still innocent, and they rarely experience the five toxins or the diagnoses of the five excesses and seven deficiencies. Before and shortly after birth, sores may appear all over the body, and treatment is often avoided. Other small boils can be treated with topical applications for resolution. However, if there is excessive cold or heat, causing distress and harming the heart and abdomen, one must seek the underlying cause for treatment. For infants under breast care, both mother and child should receive treatment, and it is essential for the physician to possess insight and clarity, rather than simply following dogmatic methods. Xue has focused on the significant aspects of treating furuncles and abscesses, adding in childcare, which is akin to adding branches to a trunk. If one delves deeply into the source, clarifies the meridians, distinguishes exterior and interior conditions, and carefully observes patterns, there will be no difference in size; specialized texts exist, so there is no need for redundancy. This compilation focuses specifically on what is pertinent to children.[32p]

    以至危且急，杀人顷刻，莫如丹毒，故首列之，且独加详焉。　　夫疮疡皆因脏腑不调，经络壅滞而得，或由胎毒，或是风化为虫，或则热气有盛，或是惊入皮肤。其大者是滞于血脉而横出于皮肤之间，若节其气血则易破；若或风缠，则生瘾轸；或是外邪所入，即多瘙痒而不定。其食毒则滞死其血气，久则化为脓也。或作惊疮者，惊本无物，亦蹉其血气在脏而为积在腑，故出皮肤为疮，发遍身而四肢难较。风疮亦发遍身，其形甚小，世呼为疥热毒疮，发处不定，节滞其血，故作疮。[33p]

    In times of utmost danger and urgency, when lives are lost in an instant, nothing is more alarming than dan toxic lesions. Therefore, they are mentioned first and detailed separately.

    Skin ulcers arise from imbalances in the internal organs, with blocked meridians leading to their formation. They may result from congenital toxins, or from wind transforming into parasites, or from excess heat, or from shock entering the skin. The most severe cases involve stagnation in the blood vessels, manifesting as lesions on the skin. If one restricts the flow of vital energy and blood, it can easily rupture; if it becomes entangled in wind, it leads to severe itching; or if external pathogens enter, it often causes widespread itching without resolution. Food toxins can stagnate and impair the blood and vital energy, eventually transforming into pus over time. Shock-induced ulcers derive from a mental disturbance with no tangible cause, causing a blockage of blood and energy in the organs, leading to skin eruptions that spread throughout the body, particularly affecting the limbs. Wind ulcers, also widespread and characterized by very small forms, are commonly referred to as scabs and heat toxins, emerging unpredictably as blood stagnates, resulting in lesions.[33p]

    虫窠疮常发于胫后作其窠，窠内虫如虮子；盖因腹内蛲虫随气而化，其疮即较而再发，或片子如癣相似，甚有死血痒。若以药敷较，只是归腹中，须是取却虫方瘥，及与杀虫药。　　《内经》曰：诸痛痒疮疡，皆属心火。火郁内发，致有斯疾。盖心主乎血，血热生风，热郁内甚，递相传袭，故火能生土，血注阳明，主肌内风热与血热相搏，发见皮肤，其名不一。黄脓而白者，土生金，母归子也。始生微痒而热轻；肿痛溃烂，为热极血凝化水，气滞成脓，甚至寒热作而饮食减，尤为可虑。[34p]

    Worm nests and sores commonly appear on the back of the shins, creating nests where the worms resemble lice. This is due to roundworms in the abdomen transforming with the qi. The sores may recur, sometimes resembling tinea, and can cause intense itching and the presence of stagnant blood. Simply applying medicine externally may only affect the abdomen; one must remove the worms to heal and use anti-worm medication.

    The Inner Canon states that all pains, itching, sores, and lesions relate to heart fire. The internal fire becomes stagnant, leading to such diseases. The heart governs the blood; when the blood becomes hot, it generates wind. Severe internal heat leads to a cycle of transmission, causing fire to generate earth, while blood fills the Yangming channel, which controls inner wind heat and the conflict of heat in the blood; thus, various skin manifestations occur. When it appears yellow and purulent, it signifies the earth generating metal, the mother returning to the child. Initially, it presents mild itching and slight heat; when swelling, pain, and ulceration occur, it indicates extreme heat causing blood to congeal and transform into fluid, resulting in stagnation that turns into pus. Symptoms may include alternating chills and fever and decreased appetite, which are particularly concerning.[34p]

    宜宣泄风毒，凉心经，解胃热，用当归散加黄连、升麻、干葛，生姜，葱、灯心煎服，及三解散、牛蒡汤、木通散、外涂以四黄散、一抹金。　　初生芽儿一块血，也无形证也无脉。有惊即系是胎惊，有热即系是胎热。婴儿实与乳母一体，凡患疮疾，但审乳母肝经有热，用加味小柴胡汤之类；肝经虚热用加味逍遥散之类；肾水不能生肝，用地黄丸；心经积热，用柴胡栀子散；心经虚热，用茯苓补心汤；膏粱积热，用东垣清胃散；脾经郁热，用钱氏泻黄散；脾经虚热，用钱氏异功散。若服犀角丸、化毒丹，外敷寒凉之药，复伤生气，乃促其危也。[35p]

    It is appropriate to vent the wind-heat, cool the heart, and relieve stomach heat, using a mixture of Angelica Decoction with Huang Lian, Sheng Ma, and Gan Cao, along with ginger, scallions, and light hemp for decoction; also apply Three Relief Powder, Burdock Soup, and Mu Tong Powder, externally using Four Huang Powder and Yi Mo Jin.

    For a newborn with a block of blood, there are no tangible symptoms or pulse. If startled, it is the fetal fright; if there is heat, it is fetal heat. The infant is essentially one with the wet nurse; if there are sores, examine the wet nurse's liver channel for heat, treating it with Modified Xiao Chai Hu Decoction; if there is deficiency heat in the liver channel, use Modified Xiao Yao San; if kidney water cannot generate liver, use Di Huang Pills; for accumulated heat in the heart channel, use Chai Hu and Zhi Mu Powder; if there is deficiency heat in the heart channel, use Fu Ling Heart-Strengthening Decoction; for accumulated heat from rich foods, use Dong Yuan's Clear Stomach Powder; if there is stagnant heat in the spleen channel, use Qian's Xie Huang Powder; if there is deficiency heat in the spleen channel, use Qian's Yi Gong Powder.

    If Rhinoceros Horn Pills or Detoxifying Pills are taken, and cold cooling medicines are applied externally, it will harm the vital energy, leading to urgency in the condition.[35p]

    　　　　　热毒疮疡

    　　小儿因食膏粱厚味，或乳母七情郁火所致。若肿臖作痛，气血凝滞也，用仙方活命饮；口渴便秘，热毒内蕴也，用四顺清凉饮，佐以如圣饼；肿硬色赤，热毒凝聚也，用活命饮，佐以隔蒜灸；肿焮不消，欲作脓也。用托里消毒散；不成脓，或成脓不溃，气血麻也，用八珍汤；溃而肉赤不敛，脾血虚也，用四物、参、朮；肉白而不敛，脾气弱也，用四君、芎、归；食少体倦而不敛，脾气虚也，用六君、当归、升麻。凡药对证，无有不愈。设或妄行攻毒，元气亏损，则变恶证而难治矣。大抵疮疡属腑者易治，元气无亏者不治自愈；属脏者难治，元气亏损者则变为恶证。误行克伐，元气亏损，尤难疗理，故切不可用峻厉之剂。观东垣、丹溪云：但见肿痛，参之脉证虚弱，便与滋补，血气无亏，可保终吉；若用驱逐败毒，不免有虚虚之祸矣。[36p]

    Heat Toxic Sores

    Children develop sores due to consuming rich and heavy foods, or due to the emotional distress of their wet-nurses. If there is swelling, pain, and stagnation of qi and blood, one should use the Immortal's Life-Preserving Drink. If there is thirst and constipation, it indicates internal heat and toxin; one should use the Four Shun Cooling Drink, supplemented with the Sacred Cake. If the swelling is hard and red, indicating a gathering of heat and toxin, one should use the Life-Preserving Drink, supplemented with garlic moxibustion. If the swelling is hot and fails to subside, threatening to form pus, use the Tuo Li Xiao Du Powder; if pus does not form or if it does form but does not rupture, indicating stagnation of qi and blood, use the Eight Treasures Decoction. If there is an opening and the flesh is red and does not heal, indicating spleen blood deficiency, use the Four Substances, ginseng, and atractylodes. If the flesh is white and does not heal, indicating spleen qi weakness, use the Four Gentlemen, chuanxiong, and angelica. If there is reduced appetite and fatigue with non-healing, indicating spleen qi deficiency, use the Six Gentlemen, angelica, and drinks of elevating herbs. Generally, with proper medication matched to the symptoms, there is nothing that cannot be cured. If one rashly attacks the toxin, resulting in a loss of vital energy, it will lead to severe conditions that are difficult to treat. In general, sores related to the bowels are easier to treat; if there is no loss of vital energy, they can heal on their own. Those associated with the organs are more difficult to treat, and if there is a loss of vital energy, they may transform into severe conditions. Misusing aggressive treatments leads to a loss of vital energy, making healing even harder; thus, it is crucial to avoid using harsh medications. Observing the teachings of Dongyuan and Danxi: when swelling and pain appear, along with signs of weak pulses, one must administer tonics; if blood and qi are not deficient, healing can be assured; however, if one uses methods to expel the evil toxins, one may inevitably encounter the dangers of deficiency.[36p]

    　　　　　丹毒

    　　《婴童宝鉴》小儿诸丹毒歌云：丹火初成似火烧，天火浑身赤转饶。伊火髈边青黑色，厉从额上起根苗。臀并谷道熛丹毒，如带黳红暴火调。留火发时一日盛，改变无常五色标。家火颊连双腋乳，天灶内踝及阴尻。背并膝赤飞丹病，股内脐阴尿灶招。　　巢氏云：火丹候，往来如伤寒，赤着身而日渐大者是也。　　又云：火丹候状，发赤如火烧，须臾熛浆起是也。　　《婴孺方》云：火丹者，来往如伤寒，赤着身体，不从伤火而得名，如日出时以从其处，又名日丹。宜同用千金漏芦散。　　经云：赤紫丹瘤，皆心火内郁而发，赤如丹砂。[37p]

    Dandruff

    In "The Treasure Mirror for Infants," the song about children's dandruff says: When the fire of red is first begun, it seems like burning flames, the heavenly fire turning the body red. The fire from the edges is dark bluish, with symptoms sprouting from the forehead. The hips along the groin area burn with dandruff, resembling a red band in fiery spurts. When the fire is strong, it reaches its peak in a day, changing unpredictably among five colors. The home fire connects to the cheeks and both armpits, while the heavenly oven affects the ankles and the lower body. The back and knees present with a red flying dandruff, and the groin's navel area invites the urinary discharge.

    Cao Shi says: The signs of fiery dandruff come and go like a febrile illness, reddening the body and gradually increasing. He further states: The appearance of fiery dandruff is red like it is burning, with rapid bursts of eruptions.

    In "The Infant Formulas," it is stated: Fire dandruff comes and goes like febrile illnesses, reddening the body, not derived from burned fire and thus named; it resembles the sun at its rise, hence also known as solar dandruff. It is advisable to use the Qianjin Loulu Powder simultaneously.

    The scripture states: Red and purple nodules, all stem from internal heart fire, manifesting as red as cinnabar.[37p]

    心主血而火性热，血热相搏，阴滞于阳，即发丹毒。心虚寒则痒，心实热则痛。先用百解散表之，次以当归散加连翘、荆芥水煎服，及牛蒡汤加炒麻仁研碎同煎，与宣热拔毒；其次赤葛散，或初用化丹汤亦好。　　有身上发时，亦如前证，不甚燥痒，但见出浮于遍体，神昏不悦，名阴毒证。先以冲和饮加南木香，水、姜煎服；次用当归散、雄黄散。然此二证不问赤白，若入腹入肾，多致为害，不可轻视如常，自取困耳。　　大抵丹毒虽有多种，病源则一。有赤丹毒遍身痒者，或女子十五六而脉未通者，多发丹疹，皆由血有风毒乘之，宜服防己散。　　小儿黑斑、红斑、疮痒、瘾疹，并用防风通圣散治之。[38p]

    The heart governs the blood and has a fiery nature. When the blood becomes hot and clashes, and yin becomes stagnant in yang, this results in the onset of toxic rash. When the heart is deficient and cold, there is itching; when the heart is full and hot, there is pain. First, use Bai Jie San to release the exterior, then take Dang Gui San with Lian Qiao and Jing Jie's decoction, along with Niu Bang Tang mixed with fried flaxseed, to help clear heat and expel toxins. Following that, Chi Ge San may be used, or initially, Hua Dan Tang is also suitable.

    In cases where there are rashes on the body, the symptoms are similar to those described earlier, not excessively dry or itchy, but presenting as raised spots over the body, along with a state of dizziness and discomfort, known as yin toxic symptoms. First, use Chong He Yin with Nan Mu Xiang, ginger, and water to decoct and take; next, apply Dang Gui San and Xiong Huang San. Both of these symptoms do not discriminate between red and white; if it enters the abdomen or kidneys, it can cause significant harm and should not be treated lightly, as it could bring distress.

    Generally, while there are various forms of toxic rash, the source of the illness is singular. For those with red rashes covering the body that itch, especially among young girls aged fifteen or sixteen whose menstrual flow has not yet started, rashes may develop due to wind-toxic blood; it is advisable to take Fang Ji San.

    For children with black spots, red spots, itchy sores, or urticaria, Fang Feng Tong Sheng San should be used for treatment.[38p]

    　　　　　胎毒发丹

    　　胎毒发丹者，因胎毒内伏，或频浴热汤，或着烘衣，或乳母饮食七情，内热助邪为患。发于头面四肢，延及胸腹，色赤游走不定。古人云：从四肢起入腹囊者，皆不治。当急令人随患处遍吮毒血，各聚一处砭出之，急服活命饮。惟百日内忌砭，以其肌肉难任也。若发散过剂，表虚热而赤不退者，用补中益气汤加防风、白芷；寒凉过剂，胃气受伤而热赤不退者，用异功散加柴胡、升麻；或兼发搐等证，用四君、升麻、当归、钓藤钩。若复用攻毒，必致不起。头额间患者，当卧鐮砭之。[39p]

    Fetal Toxin Eruption

    The eruption of fetal toxin occurs when the toxin lies hidden within. This can be caused by frequent baths in hot water, wearing heated clothing, or the nursing mother’s diet influenced by emotions, which generate internal heat, exacerbating the condition. It manifests on the head, face, and limbs, spreading to the chest and abdomen, with a red color that moves unpredictably. The ancients said: Those who experience onset from the limbs into the abdomen are all difficult to treat. One should urgently have the afflicted suck the toxic blood from the affected areas, gathering it in one place to be needled out, and then immediately take a lifesaving decoction. However, avoid needling within the hundred days, as the muscles are fragile at that time. If the eruption is caused by excessive dispersing treatments, resulting in superficial heat that does not subside, use the Bai Zhong Yi Qi Decoction with added Fang Feng and Bai Zhi; if it is caused by excess cooling, with injured stomach Qi and persistent heat, use the Yi Gong San with added Chai Hu and Sheng Ma; or if there are concurrent symptoms of spasms, use Si Jun, Sheng Ma, Dang Gui, and Diaoteng Gou. If one continues to use toxic purges, it will lead to further complications. For those affected on the forehead, they should lie down and receive needling treatment.[39p]

    　　　　　伤食发丹

    　　伤食发丹者，因脾胃之气方充，乳食过多，不能运化，蕴热于内而达于肌表也。若因乳食停滞者，先用保和丸消之，大便秘结，量加大黄通之；乳食既消而丹尚作者，用清中解郁汤治之；丹邪既去而乳食不思者，用五味异功散补之；发热作渴，或饮食少思者，用七味白朮散补之。大凡饮食厚味所致者，赤晕或行而缓慢；若饮烧酒，或误吞信石所致者，遍示赤晕，其行甚速。又有疮疡发焮，周围有赤晕，其热消散，或脓出自退。凡此俱忌砭法，皆宜安里为主，不可攻伐。若自吐泻，亦不可止之。吐泻中有发散之意。因饮烧酒者，饮冷米醋一二杯解之，此神妙之法也。因母多食炙煿膏粱，或饮烧酒，或服辛热燥药，或郁怒伤肝脾，致儿为患者，当参胎热毒疮疡治之。[40p]

    Harm from Food Leading to Rashes

    Harm from food leading to rashes occurs when the energy of the spleen and stomach is fully engaged, yet an excess of dairy and food cannot be transformed, causing heat to accumulate inside and surface on the skin. If food stagnation from dairy persists, first use Baohuan pills to disperse it; if there is constipation, increase the dosage of Da Huang to facilitate bowel movements. Once food is digested but rashes continue to appear, treat it with Qingzhong Jieyu Decoction; if the rashes persist and there is no desire for food after the heat is removed, use Wuwei Yigong Powder to nourish. If there is fever and thirst, or a reduced appetite, use Qiwwei Baizhu Powder to replenish. Generally, rashes caused by heavy or rich foods lead to a red halo that spreads slowly; however, if caused by drinking liquor or mistakenly swallowing foreign objects, the redness spreads quickly. There are also cases of sores with redness around them, where heat dissipates or pus discharges spontaneously. In all these cases, needling is to be avoided, and calming methods should be prioritized, with no aggressive treatments. If vomiting or diarrhea occurs, do not stop it, as these symptoms have a dispersing effect. For those who drink liquor, taking a cup or two of cold rice vinegar can be a miraculous remedy. In cases where mothers excessively consume roasted rich foods, drink liquor, or take spicy and drying medicines, or if liver and spleen are harmed by pent-up anger, leading to ailments in their children, one should treat it as a case of fetal heat and poisonous sores.[40p]

    　　　　　惊丹

    　　婴孩生后百日之内，半岁以上，忽两眼泡红晕微起，面带青黯色，向夜烦啼，或脸如胭脂，此伏热在内。亦有脸不红者。始因居胎之时，母受重惊，惊邪伤胎，递相传袭，形发于外，初发时散生满面，状如水痘，脚微红而不壮，出没休息无定，收到颈项，赤如朱砂，名为惊丹。用四圣散，先洗其目；次百解散加五和汤同煎，与解惊热丹毒。牛蒡汤、当归散、三解散、黄芩四物汤皆可为治。　　如惊丹发至胸乳间，微有痰喘作搐，急宜宣热拔毒，免致内攻，为害不浅。五和汤加升麻、生干地黄，水姜灯心煎服，则自消除；仍用前数药调治，不生他证。或投万安饮。
    　　　　　五色丹

    　　夫小儿五色丹者，由丹发而改变无常，或青、黄、白、黑、赤。此是风毒之热，有盛有衰，或冷或热，故发为五色丹也。孔氏家传用小柴胡汤，如法煎服，以滓傅丹上，良。
    　　　　　白丹[41p]

    Jing Dan

    Within a hundred days of a baby's birth, particularly after six months, if the eyes appear red with slight swelling, the face shows a bluish-dark hue, and the baby cries restlessly at night, or if the face resembles rouge, this indicates inner heat. There are also instances where the face does not turn red. This initially stems from the mother experiencing a severe shock during pregnancy, which harms the fetus and transmits illness, manifesting outwardly. Initially, this conditions presents widely across the face in a manner resembling chickenpox, with slightly red feet that are not inflamed, exhibiting erratic patterns of rise and fall, and extending to the neck, bright red like vermilion, known as Jing Dan. It is treated with Four Sacred Powder; first, wash the eyes; then, boil Baijie Powder combined with Wuhuo Decoction, to alleviate the shock-induced heat and toxicity. Burdock soup, Angelica Powder, Sanjie Powder, and Huangqins' Four Ingredients Decoction can also be used for treatment. If Jing Dan spreads to the chest and armpits leading to phlegm and wheezing, it is urgent to dispel heat and draw out toxins to prevent internal harm. Use Wuhuo Decoction with added Shengma and raw Rehmannia, boiled with ginger and the heart of lantern, to eliminate it; continue using the aforementioned medicines without causing other issues. Alternatively, administer Wan'an Decoction.

    Wuse Dan

    The five-colored Dan in children arises from the changes in the Dan, manifesting inconsistently in colors like blue, yellow, white, black, and red. This is due to the heat from wind toxins, which can be intense or mild, hot or cold, leading to the occurrence of the five-colored Dan. The Kong family passes down a method of using Xiao Chai Hu Decoction, prepared according to regulations, with the residue applied on the Dan for effectiveness.

    Bai Dan[41p]

    　　夫白丹者，由挟风冷之气，故使色白也。初发痒痛，微虚肿，如吹奶起，不痛不赤而白色也。
    　　　　　赤丹

    　　夫赤丹者，由风毒之重，故使赤也。初发起大如连钱，小者如麻豆，肉上生粟，色如鸡冠，故亦谓之茱萸丹也。
    　　　　　黑丹

    　　夫黑丹者，由风毒伤于肌肉，故令黑色也。初发痒痛，或熛肿起，微黑也。
    　　　　　天火丹

    　　夫小儿丹发肉中，有如丹赤色者，大者如手，剧者遍身赤痒，故号天火丹也。
    　　　　　赤流

    　　夫小儿身上或一片赤色如胭脂，及渐引，此名丹毒，俗谓之流。若因热而得者色赤，或因风而得者色白，皆肿而壮热也。可用一铍刀以砭去其恶血。毒未入腹者，可疗也。
    　　　　　身有赤处

    　　小儿因汗，为风邪热毒所伤，与血气相搏，热气蒸发于外，其肉赤而壮热也。

    White Dan refers to the presence of cold wind, which causes the color to be white. Initially, it manifests as itching and pain, with slight swelling akin to blown milk; it is neither painful nor red, but white in color.

    Red Dan is caused by the heaviness of wind toxicity, resulting in a red color. It initially appears as large as a coin or as small as a bean, with grains forming on the flesh, resembling the color of a chicken's comb, therefore also called Zhu Yu Dan.

    Black Dan comes from wind toxins injuring the muscles, resulting in a black color. It initially manifests as itching and pain, or it may swell slightly and appear black.

    Heavenly Fire Dan appears in children as red spots on the flesh, with the larger ones the size of a hand. In severe cases, the entire body may break out in red and itch, hence named Heavenly Fire Dan.

    Red Flow refers to patches of red on a child's body that resemble rouge, and it spreads gradually; this is called Dan poison, commonly known as flow. If it arises from heat, the color will be red, and if from wind, it will be white; both conditions are swollen and fevers arise. One may use a scalpel to drain the bad blood. If the poison has not entered the abdomen, it can still be treated.

    Red areas on the body occur in children as a result of sweating, being harmed by wind and heat toxins, causing a clash with blood and energy, leading to the evaporation of heat and resulting in red and feverish flesh.

    　　一气念二十一遍，吹在病处，自立东南方上，令病人在西北方，以大指陷中指头节纹，以第二指掐大指中节，两手皆然，吹时即放手。持咒四十九日，于五更初向北受持。　　灶额丹：先从头上起，渐满身，其丹赤色，用猪槽下土并桃柳根皮捣末，生油调敷。　　灶尾丹：从腰起，黑色遍身疼痛者，用堂屋四角草烧灰，入白矾末，鸡子白和涂。　　龙火丹：先从腹起至心，微黄赤色，用屋脊上草烧灰，松花白、鸡子黄、猪槽内水调涂。　　君灶丹：从右手上起，引似蛇行，赤色，用灶下土油调涂。　　母灶丹：从左脚上起者，用燖猪汤，灶额上灰敷。　　女灶丹：从阴上起紫赤色，用女儿小便，生煤灶右边砖缝上土，和调涂。　　朱黄升：从右脚起，彻至遍身，用屋四角草，铁匠家磨刀水调傅。　　星子丹：从头起，彻遍身如钱大，赤色，用桃树向北枝烧灰，油调敷。　　蜂子丹：从头面四向彻，用灶头上土，入腻粉，以鸡子白调敷。[43p]

    Here are the ten methods for treating toxic swellings:

    1. Feizao Dan: Begins at the top of the head, swelling first appears; grind scallion white, extract the natural juice, and apply it.
    2. Guzhao Dan: Starts with redness and pain on the head; mix red adzuki bean powder with egg white and apply. Tan's method is effective regardless of location.
    3. Guihuo Dan: Arises on the face with redness and swelling; use stove earth mixed with egg white for application. This method is also effective regardless of location and is quite marvelous.
    4. Tianhuo Dan: Starts with red dots on the back; use powdered mulberry bark mixed with sheep fat for application.
    5. Tianzao Dan: Appears as yellow-red swelling around the kidneys; use ash from willow leaves mixed with water for application. Note that the kidney sometimes refers to the arm.
    6. Shui Dan: Appears as generalized swelling on both sides; grind raw iron filings to a powder, mix with pig manure for application.
    7. Hulu Dan: Begins just above the navel with yellow swelling; use powdered betel nut mixed with rice vinegar for application.
    8. Yefeng Dan: Starts with redness and swelling on both feet; apply powdered frankincense mixed with sheep fat.
    9. Yanhuo Dan: Appears with red and white spots on both feet; use earth from under a pigsty mixed with sesame oil for application.
    10. Hulou Dan: Begins with yellow swelling in the groin area; use earth from a leaking roof mixed with sheep fat for application.

    These ten types of toxic swellings are not to be taken lightly; if treatment is delayed, it can lead to severe consequences.
