If treatment is not applied within three days, it can invade the internal organs and become untreatable, so prompt action is essential.[46p]

    　　　　　赤白游肿

    　　夫小儿有肌肉虚者，为风毒热气所乘，热毒搏于血气，则皮肤赤而肿起，其风随气行游不定，故名也。　　又有游肿之状者，为青黄赤白，无复定色，游走于皮肤之间，肉上微光是也。　　治游肿，以生布一片蘸油，以火燃之，持照病上，咒曰：日游日游，不知着脂，火燎你头！呪七遍，即瘥也。　　又云：凡天下极冷，无过藻菜。但有患热肿毒丹等，取渠中藻菜细切熟捣，敷丹上，厚三分，干即易之。予谓不可以此涂，若毒在表，犹可措手；若抑之则外不得泄，势必入里。必先服托里药，方可施此。[47p]

    Red and White Swelling

    Children with weak muscles are affected by the invasion of wind, toxins, and heat. When heat and toxins attack the blood and qi, the skin becomes red and swollen. The wind moves restlessly with the qi; thus, it is named "swelling that travels."

    Moreover, the appearance of this traveling swelling includes shades of green, yellow, red, and white, with no fixed color, moving between the layers of the skin, and a slight glow on the flesh.

    To treat this traveling swelling, take a piece of raw linen, dip it in oil, ignite it with fire, and hold it over the affected area while chanting: "Day moves, day moves, not knowing the grease, fire burns your head!" Repeat the incantation seven times, and it will heal.

    It is also said: In extreme cold conditions, do not exceed the use of algae. However, if there is a heat-related swelling or toxin, take the algae from the water, finely chop it, cook it, and then mash it, applying it thickly—about three-tenths of an inch—over the affected area. Change it when it dries.

    I believe this should not be applied directly; if the toxin is on the surface, it may be dealt with, but if suppressed, it will not be released, and may enter deeper. It is essential to first take a purgative to address the internal condition before applying this.[47p]

    　　　　　辨小儿欲发丹毒候

    　　初生小儿，蓄伏胎热，欲发丹者，必先见于外，但人不之察耳。小儿在襁褓中无故眼生厚眵者，此丹毒欲发之候也；更微喘急者，毒气已甚而上乘于肺也。才觉有此证，急以水调龙脑饮子，或蓝根、犀角等药，潜消其毒。如浑身已有赤处，即更以芸薹等外挫其锋，消息而次第治之。予家凡两儿，初生眼有厚眵，后俱发丹，何宰宜人外孙女生七日眼多眵，已而小腹下有赤丹一点如钱，渐渐引开，上至腹心而死。不可不知也。　　初虞世谓百日内发必死不治，然亦有可治者，不可不治也。[48p]

    Identifying the Signs of Scarlet Fever in Infants

    In newborn infants, the stored fetal heat may manifest as scarlet fever, which will first be observable externally, though people may not notice it. If a baby in swaddling shows excessive eye discharge without any apparent cause, this indicates a potential outbreak of scarlet fever. If there is also slight wheezing or rapid breathing, the toxic condition has worsened and is affecting the lungs. Upon noticing these signs, it is urgent to mix dragon's brain with water and give it to the child, or use medicines such as indigo root or rhinoceros horn to gradually eliminate the poison. If the body already shows red spots, then further external treatments with substances like mustard greens should be applied, following a gradual and systematic approach to treatment. In my family, both of my sons had thick eye discharge at birth and subsequently developed scarlet fever. There is also a case of a certain official's granddaughter, who at seven days old had abundant eye discharge, and later developed a small red spot like a coin in her lower abdomen, which gradually spread upward to the heart, leading to her death. This is crucial knowledge. Initially, it was believed that if scarlet fever developed within a hundred days, it would be fatal and untreatable; however, there are cases that can be treated and should not be neglected.[48p]

    　　　　　禁忌

    　　大凡小儿病诸丹肿，其势虽盛，切不可遽用大黄、芒硝辈快药大下之，恐毒气乘虚入里，以客为主，则难施功也。但用性平解毒托里药，当调停脏腑，微微通利而已。此则护元气而排外邪，庶保十全也。比舍陶氏子半岁病丹，医以青金丹下之太过，蓄毒入里，发喘生惊而死。盖婴孺肌肤柔弱，易虚易实，而服药复不能多，治之固不可怠慢，然亦不可躁急，全在精专调护，以保无虞。世俗多不知此，故广记而备言之。[49p]

    Taboos

    Generally, when a child suffers from swelling and inflammation, even if the condition seems serious, one must not hastily use strong laxatives like Da Huang or Mang Xiao, for fear that toxins may invade the interior and take control, making treatment difficult. Instead, one should use mild, detoxifying herbs that regulate the internal organs, facilitating gentle movement and benefits. This approach protects the vital energy while expelling external pathogens, thereby ensuring overall well-being. There was a case of a half-year-old child with swelling, for whom a doctor improperly administered Qing Jin Dan, leading to excessive purging, retention of toxins internally, and resulting in wheezing, agitation, and death. Infants have delicate skin and are easily affected by both deficiency and excess, and they cannot tolerate many medications. Therefore, treatment must not be taken lightly, nor should one act impulsively; it all relies on meticulous care and attention to ensure safety. Many in the world do not know this, hence the need for thorough documentation and advice.[49p]

    　　小儿丹发，若预度其势必展引至咽颈腹心，阴尻诸虚处，可先用涂药以护之，仍砭其引头所向，微出恶血以泄其毒。或谓当以篦子刮去恶血令尽，直至清黄水出即止，此必势危气壮而血热者始宜之。大抵此疾，人受之有轻重，年长气实，乃能禁当；若未满月儿而感之又重，恐不可概用此法。无为主簿张康道子二岁，火焰丹，鲁医为砭之，出恶血盏余，两日而殂。不可不知也。　　《本草》云：大人小儿丹毒，宜食鲫鱼鲙及(虫宅)。(虫宅)即水母，名海蜇者是也。然不可以宜食而恣食之，反能为害。鲫鱼亦鱼类，得无不宜。[50p]

    If a young child has scarlet fever, one must anticipate that the condition may extend to the throat, neck, abdomen, and other vulnerable areas. One can apply ointment to protect those areas and use a needle to draw it towards the point of occurrence, allowing any bad blood to escape and relieve the toxicity. Some believe that it is necessary to scrape off the bad blood completely with a comb until clear, yellow fluid emerges, which is appropriate only for those with vigorous energy and hot blood. Generally, this illness varies in severity; older children with strong vital energy can endure it better, while infants under one month who contract it severely may not be suitable for this method. It is crucial to note that a child, two years old, named Zhang Kangdao, died two days after undergoing treatment with acupuncture that drew out toxic blood. It should not be ignored.

    The “Compendium of Materia Medica” states that for adults and children suffering from scarlet fever, eating crucian carp and jellyfish (known as "sea stingers") is beneficial. However, one must not overindulge in these foods, as doing so can lead to harm. Crucian carp is a type of fish that is generally safe to consume.[50p]

    　　　　　禁法

    　　无为南汰寺僧宋澄师传酎文法禁火焰丹：用松明五条，细如箸，以火点着一头，右手执之，大指掐定第二指中节纹，左手亦如此掐定；面北立，静想北方壬癸水，渺漫无际，一口吸尽，吹在火上，再想再吹，如是三次；将火向自己口中试，如不烧人，即以松明火于小儿升上周回焠一遭，兼于丹上十字焠过，即已。如试得烧人疼，更想吸水。正旦及端午日受持。古今图书集成医部全录卷四百五十四[51p]

    Forbidden Method

    Master Song Cheng from the Namta Monastery transmitted the method of prohibiting fire for the refinement of Dan (elixir): Use five torches, as thin as chopsticks, lighting one end with fire. Hold it in your right hand, pinching the section between the second and third fingers with your thumb, and do similarly with your left hand; stand facing north, quietly envisioning the northern water of Ren and Gui, vast and boundless. Inhale completely, then blow onto the fire, imagining once more and blowing again, repeating this three times. Test the fire by bringing it towards your mouth; if it does not burn you, then use the torch fire to pass over a child once, also passing over the Dan in a cross pattern. If you test and find it burns and hurts, focus again on inhaling water. This should be practiced on New Year’s Day and the Dragon Boat Festival.

    — From "Complete Collection of Medical Works, Volume 454"[51p]

    小儿疮疡门

    　　　　证治准绳 【明　王肯堂】

    　　　　　疔疮

    　　诸疮惟疔疮为甚。杀人亦速。古云：疔有十二种，种各不同，内三十六疔，满其数即不可救；亦有不满其数而死者，乃毒气走散故也。若痘毒染人，发于头面或遍身者，又非此类。在小儿，多因乳母食有毒之物，或儿卒中饮食之毒，或感四时不正之气，皆能致之。其疮多生头面四肢，形色不一，或如小疮，或如水泡，或痛或痒，或麻木不仁。外证寒热，呕吐恶心，肢体拘急。大要当分邪之在表在里，急用隔蒜灸法，并解毒之剂。[52p]

    Childhood Sores

          Guidelines for Diagnosis and Treatment 【Ming Dynasty, Wang Kentang】

           Boils

    Boils are the most severe among all sores. They can be fatal quickly. The ancients say: there are twelve types of boils, each different; among them, thirty-six are critical, and once they reach their full count, they become incurable; there are also cases where one dies without reaching that count due to the dispersal of toxic gases. If the pox virus infects a person, appearing on the head and face or spreading all over the body, it is not of this type. In children, these often arise from the mother consuming toxic foods, the child accidentally ingesting poisonous substances, or being affected by improper seasonal climates, all of which can lead to this condition. These sores mostly appear on the head, face, and limbs, with varied shapes and colors; they may resemble small sores, blisters, be painful, itchy, or associated with numbness. External symptoms include chills and fever, vomiting, and nausea, with tightness in the limbs. The main approach is to determine if the pathogen is on the surface or internal, and promptly use the method of burning garlic as a moxibustion technique, along with detoxifying agents.[52p]

    若不省人事，牙关紧闭，急以夺命丹为末，热酒调灌。如食生冷之物，或用凉水淋洗，则轻者难愈，重者不治。生于两足者，多有红丝至脐；生于两手者，多有红丝至心；生于唇口之内者，多有红丝入喉。急用针挑出恶血，以泄其毒，可保无虞。其在偏僻之处，药难导达者，惟灸法有回生之功；若投峻厉之剂，是促其危矣。小儿肌肉柔脆，且不能言痛否，灸法须将蒜切薄片，着肉一面，略剜少空，灼艾燃蒜，先置大人臂上，试其冷热得宜，然后移着疮上；又别灼艾如前法试之，以待相易，勿令间歇。[53p]

    If one does not regain consciousness, their jaw tightly clenched, one should urgently grind a life-saving pill to powder and mix it with hot wine to administer. If one consumes raw or cold substances, or if one is doused with cold water, the milder cases will struggle to recover, while the more severe cases will not be curable. Those affected in the legs often have red threads reaching the navel; those in the arms often have red threads reaching the heart; those within the lips and mouth often have red threads reaching the throat. Quickly use needles to extract the bad blood to release the poison, which can ensure safety. In remote areas where medicine is hard to reach, moxibustion has the power to revive; if harsh and drastic medicines are taken, it will only worsen the danger. Children’s muscles are delicate and they cannot express whether they feel pain, so when applying moxibustion, one must cut garlic into thin slices and place them on the skin, slightly hollowing out a space, then ignite the moxa on the garlic, first testing the heat on an adult's arm to ensure it is suitable, and then moving it to the sore; also prepare additional moxa in the same manner for testing before switching, without allowing pauses.[53p]

    　　　　　时毒

    　　小儿时毒，因四时不正之气，致鼻面耳项或咽喉赤肿，寒热头疼；甚者恍惚不宁，咽喉闭塞，状如伤寒，五七日间亦能杀人。脉浮数者，邪在表；脉沉濇者，邪在里。在表用葛根牛蒡子汤；在里栀子仁汤；表里俱病者犀角升麻汤。甚则宜砭，及用通气散宣泄其毒，旬日自消。若不消而欲作脓者，用托里消毒散；欲收敛者，用托里散。若咽肿不能言，头肿不能食者，必死。[54p]

    Seasonal Toxins

    In children, seasonal toxins arise from the improper energies of the four seasons, leading to redness and swelling of the nose, face, ears, neck, or throat, accompanied by chills, fever, and headaches. In severe cases, there may be confusion and restlessness, and a feeling of throat obstruction, resembling typhoid fever, which can be fatal within five to seven days. If the pulse is floating and rapid, the pathogen is on the surface; if the pulse is deep and slippery, the pathogen is internal. For surface ailments, one should use the Ge Gen Niu Bang Zi Decoction; for internal issues, the Zhi Zi Ren Decoction; if both surface and internal are affected, the Xi Jiao Sheng Ma Decoction is recommended. In severe cases, one should apply acupuncture and use dispersing remedies to expel the toxin, which will resolve in a matter of days. If the condition does not improve and pus begins to form, use the Tuo Li Xiao Du San; if constriction is desired, use the Tuo Li San. If swelling of the throat prevents speech or swelling of the head prevents eating, death is certain.[54p]

    　　　　　流注

    　　小儿流注，乃气流而滞，血注而凝，元气不足之证也。或因闪跌堕伤，或因肝火气逆，或因六淫内侵，或因脾虚食积，或因禀赋所致，结于四肢节髀，患于胸腹腰臀，或结块，或漫肿，或作痛，悉用葱熨之法，须固元气为主。闪跌者，和血定痛丸；肝火者，九味芦荟丸；食积者，四味肥儿丸。药能对证，未成自消，已成自溃。若脓成不溃者，元气虚也，先补而针之，庶使毒气不致内攻，气血不致脱陷。若脓出而反痛者，气血虚也，用八珍汤。作呕少食者，胃气虚也，用四君子汤。欲呕不食，或腹作胀者，脾气虚也，用六君子汤。口噤搐搦者，气血虚极而变证也，十全大补汤。内热晡热，阴血虚也，四物、参、芪、白朮。表热恶寒，阳气虚也，十全大补汤。热来复去，或昼见夜伏，昼伏夜发者，虚热也，当大补元气。若色赤肿起而脓稠者，尚可治；不赤硬而脓清，或脉洪大，寒热发渴，及不受补者，皆不可治。[55p]

    Flowing Accumulation

    In young children, flowing accumulation occurs when qi flows and stagnates, blood accumulates and clots, indicating a deficiency of the vital essence. This may result from falls or injuries, from liver fire rising, from the six excesses invading internally, from spleen deficiency and food accumulation, or from congenital factors. It can manifest in the limbs and joints, causing issues in the chest, abdomen, waist, and hips. Symptoms may include nodules, swelling, or pain. All should be treated with scallion poultices, focusing on reinforcing the vital essence as the priority. For falls or injuries, use the Blood-Settling Pain Pill; for liver fire, the Nine-Flavor Aloe Pill; for food accumulation, the Four-Flavor Child's Pill. Medicines can correspond to symptoms, resolving issues before they become serious or allowing existing problems to dissipate on their own. If pus forms but does not discharge, it indicates a deficiency of the vital essence, requiring nourishment and acupuncture to prevent toxic qi from attacking internally and blood qi from collapsing. If pus discharges but the pain worsens, it indicates a deficiency of qi and blood; use the Eight Treasure Decoction. If nausea occurs with reduced appetite, it indicates stomach qi deficiency; use the Four Gentlemen Decoction. If there is a desire to vomit but no appetite, or if the abdomen feels bloated, it indicates spleen qi deficiency; use the Six Gentlemen Decoction. If there are severe muscle spasms and rigidity of the mouth, it indicates extreme deficiency of qi and blood leading to a change in symptoms; use the Ten Complete Great Supplement Decoction. If there are signs of internal heat and afternoon heat, it indicates deficiency of yin and blood; use the Four Substances, Ginseng, Astragalus, and Atractylodes. If there is exterior heat with aversion to cold, it indicates deficiency of yang qi; use the Ten Complete Great Supplement Decoction. For fluctuating heat, or if symptoms appear in the daytime and disappear at night, or vice versa, it indicates deficiency heat and requires a substantial replenishment of vital essence. If there is redness and swelling with thick pus, treatment is still possible; if there is hardness without redness, or if the pus is clear, or if the pulse is large and rapid, accompanied by thirst with cold and heat, and a lack of response to nourishment, these conditions are treatable.[55p]

    　　　　　天蛇毒

    　　手指头生疮，俗名天蛇毒。然五指各有经络，拇指属手太阴肺经，食指属手阳明大肠经，中指属手厥阴心包络经，无名指属手少阳三焦经，小指属手少阴心经。亦有患于足者，足跌属肝胆胃三经，大指属肝脾二经，次指属胆经，小指属膀胱经。各当随经而治其致患之由。或因胃中积热所致，或因乳母膏粱厚味所致，或因湿热下流，或因风毒外中，大率多由所禀足三阴之经虚，故邪得以入之也。其初患肿痛者，先用仙方活命饮，次用托里消毒散。元气下陷，重坠作痛，久而不溃者，用补中益气汤。若服败毒散及敷寒凉之剂，则疮口变黑，或努肉突出，或指皆黑。大抵手足为气血难到之处，手属于胃，足属于脾，不可损其真气。丹溪以臀居僻位，尚言气血罕到，况肢末乎？故寒凉克伐之药所宜深戒者也。[56p]

    Heavenly Serpent Poison

    A sore on the fingertip, commonly known as Heavenly Serpent Poison. Each of the five fingers has its own meridian: the thumb belongs to the Lung Meridian of the Hand, the index finger to the Large Intestine Meridian of the Hand, the middle finger to the Pericardium Meridian of the Hand, the ring finger to the Sanjiao Meridian of the Hand, and the little finger to the Heart Meridian of the Hand. There are also afflictions on the feet: the big toe corresponds to the Liver and Spleen Meridians, the second toe to the Gallbladder Meridian, and the little toe to the Bladder Meridian. Each should be treated according to the meridian and its cause of affliction.

    The cause may be due to accumulated heat in the stomach, rich foods from nursing mothers, dampness and heat flowing down, or external wind and poison. Generally, it is often due to the deficiency of the Three Yin Meridians in the feet, allowing the evil to enter.

    In the initial stages of swelling and pain, first use the Xianfang Huoming Decoction, then follow with the Toli Xiaodu Powder. If the vital energy sinks and there is heavy pain that does not rupture for a long time, use the Buzhong Yiqi Decoction. If one takes the Baidu Powder and applies cooling remedies, the sore may turn black, or flesh may protrude, or the fingers may turn black.

    In general, the hands and feet are areas where qi and blood have difficulty reaching. The hands relate to the stomach, and the feet to the spleen; therefore, one should not damage their true qi. Danxi noted that in the buttocks, where circulation of qi and blood is rare, let alone in the extremities. Therefore, cooling and depleting medicines should be used with great caution.[56p]

    　　　　　天泡疮

    　　天泡疮状如水泡，属肺胃二经风热。若发热焮痛，邪在表也，用人参败毒散；发热咳嗽，邪在肺也，用加味泻白散；热渴便秘，邪在内也，用加味清凉饮。此肌肤之证，当去毒水，以金黄散或黄蘗、蚯蚓敷之，当归膏亦善。既安，不必服药。若因攻伐过度，元气虚而变生别证者，当参各门治之。[57p]

    Heavenly Blisters

    Heavenly blisters appear like water bubbles and are associated with wind-heat in the lung and stomach meridians. If there is fever and pain, the pathogenic factor is at the surface, and one should use Ginseng Dispersing Toxin Powder. If there is fever and coughing, the pathogenic factor is in the lungs, and one should use a modified Xiao Feng San (Disperse Wind Powder). If there is thirst and constipation, the pathogenic factor is internal, and one should use a modified Clear Cool Drink. For skin conditions like this, toxins must be eliminated; one may use Golden Yellow Powder or apply Huangbo (Phellodendron) and earthworms. Angelica ointment is also effective. Once stable, there is no need for medication. However, if excessive attacking has led to a deficiency of vital energy and the emergence of other conditions, one should seek treatment from various schools.[57p]

    　　　　　杨梅疮

    　　杨梅疮乃天行时毒，亦有传染而患之。或禀赋所得者，受证在肝，故多起于下部。治失其宜，多致蚀伤眼目，腐败肾茎，拳变肢节。初起之时，上体多者，先用荆防败毒散；下体多者，先用龙胆泻肝汤；大便秘者，先用大连翘饮，后用换肌消毒散。若蚀伤眼目，兼用九味芦荟丸、六味地黄丸；肢节拳挛，兼用蠲痹解毒汤。若因脾胃亏损而不能愈者，先用异功散，后用换肌消毒散。若用轻粉之药，多致败证也。　　【按　杨梅疮起于近代，多淫夫御不洁之妇，传染而致者。其在小儿，得之乳抱传染者，轻；得之父母遗体者，重。治法与大人同，更当求之专科。】[58p]

    Yangmei Sores

    Yangmei sores are a seasonal poison that manifests at certain times; they can also be transmitted. Some individuals are predisposed, with evidence in the liver, hence they often arise in the lower parts of the body. Improper treatment can lead to injuries to the eyes, decay of the kidneys, and deformities of the limbs and joints. In the early stages, if there are many sores on the upper body, one should initially use Jingfang Baidu Powder; if there are many on the lower body, start with Longdan Xiegan Decoction. For constipation, begin with Dalianqiao Drink, followed by Huanzhi Xiaoduo Powder. If there are injuries to the eyes, use Jiumei Luhui Pills and Liuwai Dihuang Pills concurrently; if there are contractions in the limbs, also use Juanbi Jiedu Decoction. If it is unable to heal due to deficiency in the spleen and stomach, start with Yigong Powder, then use Huanzhi Xiaoduo Powder. If using light powders, it may often lead to adverse effects.

    (Note: Yangmei sores primarily occur in modern times, often transmitted by unclean women involved with promiscuous men. In children, those who contract it through breastfeeding are generally mildly affected; those who inherit it from parents are severely affected. The treatment methods are similar to those for adults, but should be approached with specialized care.)[58p]

    　　　　　王烂疮

    　　夫小儿腑脏有热，热熏皮肤，外为湿气所乘，则变生疮。其热偏盛者，其疮发势亦盛，初生如麻子，须臾出大汁，溃烂如汤火所伤灼，故名王烂疮也。
    　　　　　红丝疮

    　　有一种红丝疮，虽非丹胗，其毒实同。多生于两手中指节上，男左女右，则尤甚也。其状但一水泡，清澄光莹，如小鸡头大，其底下濈濈然数十如小针孔，不痒不痛，都无妨碍。泡边则有一丝脉如红丝，隐隐在皮里，其行甚速，循臂而上，过肘则危，至心即死。有此证者，急以针迎头挑断，或嚼白梅封之，丝即不行。[59p]

    Wang Lan Chuang (King's Rot)

    When a child has heat in the internal organs, the heat affects the skin, and if dampness invades from the outside, sores will appear. If the heat is particularly strong, the sores will also manifest vigorously, initially appearing like small sesame seeds, and soon oozing large amounts of fluid, decaying as if burned by fire, hence named Wang Lan Chuang.

    Hong Si Chuang (Red Thread Sores)

    There is a type of sore known as Hong Si Chuang, which, although not a dan zhan (red sore), possesses a similar poison. It often appears on the knuckles of the middle fingers, more severely on the left for males and the right for females. Its appearance is that of a clear, shiny water bubble, about the size of a small chick's head, with dozens of tiny needle-like holes underneath, causing no itch or pain, posing no issue. The edge of the bubble has a red thread-like vein subtly visible beneath the skin, which moves very quickly; if it travels up to the elbow, it becomes dangerous, and if it reaches the heart, it can be fatal. For those with this symptom, urgent treatment involves puncturing the head of the sore with a needle or sealing it with chewed white plum, halting the movement of the thread.[59p]

    　　　　　恶核瘰疬

    　　瘰疬一证，先贤名曰九漏。究其所因似热，稽考形状非一，不过随象命名。大概初发于颈项肌肉之间，未成脓者，从本引末，可使衰去，针之、灸之、敷之，从其所因而施疗。然小儿幼弱，岂堪针灸？但以服饵涂贴之剂为治。此疾多生于耳后及颈项两旁，初发止是一枚，次必连生大小十数，缠绕项下，累累如贯珠，逐个先肿，作脓穿破。轻者可愈，重者难治。先穴漏脓，长岁不干，谓之漏项。原其得病之初，自是三阳感受风热，与血气相搏而成。治以百解散加当归散，水、姜、葱、灯心煎服；次用元参饮及牛蒡汤、木通散、内消丸与之，宣热化毒；洗以槲皮散、涂用白芨散、二香散，使血气行，脓干汁尽，则自愈矣。仍忌臊毒野味，其证不致再作。　　热毒瘰疬，乃手足少阳、足厥阴二经风热之证，或肝疳食积所致。其证发于项腋，或耳前后，或如贯珠，当分表里虚实。[60p]

    Evil Kernels of Scrofula

    Scrofula, an ailment, was previously called "Nine Leaks" by ancient sages. Its cause appears to be heat, and its manifestations are varied, merely named according to their appearance. Generally, it begins between the muscles of the neck, and if not yet suppurated, it can be alleviated by drawing out the core, using acupuncture, moxibustion, or topical applications, tailored to the underlying cause. However, young children are too weak for needles and heat, so medicinal formulations for ingestion and topical application are used instead. This disease often arises behind the ears and on both sides of the neck, initially presenting as a single bump, which then usually proliferates into multiple bumps of various sizes, encircling the neck like a string of pearls. Each bump swells first and then suppurates. Mild cases can heal, while severe ones are difficult to treat. If the kernels leak pus for many years without drying up, it is referred to as "Leaky Neck." The initial occurrence of the disease results from the three Yang patterns receiving wind and heat, which clash with blood and qi. Treatment involves a formulation like Bai Jie San combined with Dang Gui San, taken as a decoction with water, ginger, scallions, and lotus heart; followed by the use of Yuan Shen drink, Burdock soup, Mu Tong powder, and Nei Xiao pills to disperse heat and transform toxins; washing with Quercus powder, applying Bai Ji powder and Er Xiang powder to promote the movement of blood and qi. Once the pus has dried up and the essence is exhausted, healing will occur. Moreover, one should avoid consuming toxic wild foods to prevent recurrence. Heat-toxicity scrofula originates from the hand-foot Shaoyang and foot Jueyin meridians due to wind and heat, or may stem from liver abscesses and dietary accumulation. Symptoms manifest in the neck, armpits, or around the ears, resembling a string of pearls, and one must discern between exterior and interior conditions of deficiency and excess.[60p]

    若焮赤肿者，肝经热毒也，用人参败毒散；作痛寒热者，肝火内作也，用加味小柴胡汤；不痛而小便黄，肝血虚也，用六味地黄丸；隐于肉里而色不变者，肝疳内作也，用九味芦荟丸；脓成而不溃，或溃而不敛者，脾气虚弱也，用益气养荣汤。凡此肿焮疼痛，寒热作渴者，属病气有余，形气不足，宜清肝火生肝血；肿硬不溃，溃而不敛者，属病气形气俱虚，治宜补肾水，实脾上；若因乳母恚怒，肝火遗患者，又当随所因而治之。[61p]

    If there is redness and swelling, it indicates heat toxin in the liver channel; use Shen Shen Bai Du San. For pain accompanied by cold and heat, it indicates internal liver fire; use Jia Wei Xiao Chai Hu Tang. If there is no pain but the urine is yellow, it indicates liver blood deficiency; use Liu Wei Di Huang Wan. If it is hidden in the flesh without color change, it indicates internal liver sores; use Jiu Wei Lu Hui Wan. If pus forms but does not drain, or drains but does not heal, it indicates spleen qi deficiency; use Yi Qi Yang Rong Tang.

    In general, for swelling, pain, and thirst with cold and heat, it belongs to excess disease qi and insufficient body qi; it is advisable to clear liver fire and generate liver blood. For hard swelling that does not drain, or drains but does not heal, it belongs to both deficient disease qi and body qi, and treatment should supplement kidney water and strengthen the spleen. If it is due to anger from a wet nurse, resulting in liver fire affecting the patient, treatment should be directed according to the cause.[61p]

    　　惊风结核，属肝胆二经，风木相火用事，木旺生风，热同化，其病抽掣扰动，此乃风热血燥而然耳。盖风动则肝火盛，火盛则肝血内消，血不能养筋，故筋挛结核如贯珠。然颈项两侧，正属肝胆经部分，治宜滋肾水，清肝火，养阴血，壮脾土。盖肾水旺则肝火自清，肝火清则阴血自生，阴血生则相火自宁，火既宁则无热伤元气火乘土位之疾矣。　　胎毒瘰疬者，乃禀肝胆二经郁火气滞所致。盖肝胆经行人身之侧，若因肝火动而受患，故发于肝胆二经部分，当审其因而药之。或因乳母恚怒，或血虚内热者，当审其所因而调其母，不可用峻厉之药，恐伤元气也。[62p]

    The convulsions caused by the wind are associated with the liver and gallbladder channels. The interaction of the wind and wood with fire shows that when wood is strong, it produces wind, leading to heat and dryness in the blood, which causes the condition of spasms and disturbances. This occurs because the wind increases the liver fire, which in turn consumes the liver blood. Insufficient blood fails to nourish the tendons, resulting in contractions and knots similar to pearls.

    The sides of the neck are specifically related to the liver and gallbladder channels. Treatment should focus on nourishing kidney water, clearing liver fire, nurturing yin blood, and strengthening the spleen's earth aspect. When kidney water is abundant, liver fire naturally diminishes; when liver fire is cleared, yin blood is generated. The generation of yin blood calms the fire, and when the fire is calmed, it does not harm the original qi, preventing diseases from fire overpowering the earth.

    Regarding congenital toxins causing scrofula, this arises from stagnation of liver and gallbladder fire. The liver and gallbladder channels travel along the side of the body, and if affected by liver fire, it manifests in that area. Therefore, one must carefully analyze the cause and apply the right medication. If it results from the anger of the wet nurse or from blood deficiency leading to internal heat, one must adjust the mother’s condition accordingly, avoiding harsh medications for fear of damaging the original qi.[62p]

    　　　　　疮疥

    　　小儿经络蕴热，头面及身体生疮，四君子加瓜蒌根、桔梗各半钱，煎服。　　小儿恶疮，天气温和，频与澡洗，更衣，名曰外宣，亦不宜服药。小儿不得已而服药，此乃下法。若将养合宜，何疾可侵？更令乳哺有节，勿令过饱，此养生之理也。胎毒疮疥，因禀胎热，或娠母饮食之毒，七情之火。初如干癣，后则脓水淋漓，或结靥成片。或发于两眉，或耳前后发际之间，属手少阳经；若发于四肢，属脾胃经；发于两胁，属肝经；发于额属心经；发于脑属膀胱经；发于颏颊属肾经。当随各经所主，五脏胜负，及乳母食啖厚味郁怒所传致而调治之，不可骤用化毒、犀角等丸。设元气复伤，转变他证，尤为难疗。　　热毒疮疥，因乳哺过早，或嗜甘肥，脏腑积热，或母食膏粱厚味，或七情内火所致，当分脏腑所属之因，病之虚实，调其血气，平其所胜。如肝经实热用柴胡清肝散，虚热用六味地黄丸。心经实热用导赤散；虚热用补心汤。[63p]

    Ulcers and Scabs

    Children’s meridians store heat, causing ulcers to form on the head, face, and body. For treatment, use the Four Noble Herbs, adding half a coin's worth of Trichosanthes root and Platycodon root, and decoct for consumption. When children have skin ulcers in warm weather, frequent washing and changing clothes is helpful, referred to as external dispelling. It is not advisable to take medicine unless absolutely necessary, as this is a purging method. If proper nourishment is maintained, no illness can invade. Breastfeeding should be regulated, avoiding overfeeding, which is the principle of health preservation.

    Toxin-based ulcers and scabs arise from inherited fetal heat or food toxins consumed by the mother during pregnancy, along with emotional heat. Initially resembling dry eczema, they later produce pus and water, possibly forming patches. They may occur between the eyebrows or around the ears, corresponding to the Shaoyang channel; if on limbs, it relates to the Spleen and Stomach channel; on the sides, it relates to the Liver channel; on the forehead, to the Heart channel; on the brain, to the Bladder channel; and on the chin and cheeks, to the Kidney channel. Treatment should align with the corresponding channels and the balance of the five organs, considering factors like the mother's diet and emotions. Care must be taken not to hastily use detoxifying methods or medicines such as rhinoceros horn, as this may further harm the vitality and complicate the condition, making it difficult to treat.

    Heat toxin-based ulcers and scabs are caused by premature breastfeeding, a preference for rich and fatty foods leading to accumulation of heat in the organs, or by heavy, rich food consumed by the mother, or excessive emotional heat. It is essential to identify the organ-related causes of the condition, assess its deficiency or excess, and regulate the blood and qi to harmonize defiance. For excess heat in the Liver channel, use Chai Hu Qing Gan San; for deficiency heat, use Liu Wei Di Huang Wan. For excess heat in the Heart channel, use Dao Chi San; for deficiency heat, use Bu Xin Tang.[63p]

    脾经实热用泻黄散；虚热用补中汤。肺经实热用泻白散；虚热用五味异功散。肾经热用六味地黄丸。大凡手足冷者属虚寒，手足热者属实热。脉沉数有力，作渴饮冷，大便干实，此邪在里，宜内疏；若脉浮数有力，作渴饮冷，此邪在表，宜发散。若脉浮大按举无力，或作渴饮汤，乳食少思，此其气虚而发热也，调理脾胃，其病自愈，切不可用寒凉之剂，复损真气。婴儿宜调治乳母为主。[64p]

    For excess heat in the spleen channel, use Xie Huang San; for deficiency heat, use Bu Zhong Tang. For excess heat in the lung channel, use Xie Bai San; for deficiency heat, use Wu Wei Yi Gong San. For kidney heat, use Liu Wei Di Huang Wan. Generally, cold hands and feet are considered to be deficiency cold, while hot hands and feet are considered to be excess heat. If the pulse is deep, rapid, and strong, with thirst for cold drinks, and dry, hard stools, it indicates internal evil, which should be expelled internally; if the pulse is floating, rapid, and strong, with thirst for cold drinks, it indicates evil on the surface, which should be dispersed. If the pulse is floating, large, and weak when pressed, or if there is thirst for broth, with reduced appetite for milk and food, this indicates deficiency of qi leading to heat. Regulating the spleen and stomach will lead to recovery; avoid using cold and cool remedies to prevent harming the true qi. For infants, treatment should focus on adjusting the diet of the nursing mother.[64p]

    　　诸疳疮疥，因脾胃亏损，内亡津液，虚火妄动，或乳母六淫七情，饮食起居失宜，致儿为患，当分其因，审其经而平之。如面青寒热，或白翳遮睛，肝经之证也；面赤身热，或作渴惊悸，心经之证也；面黄体瘦，或作渴泄泻，脾经之证也；面白咳嗽，或鼻间生疮，肺经之证也；面黧体瘦，或喜卧湿地，肾经之证也。婴儿宜调治乳母。若不审五脏胜负，形病虚实，妄行败毒，多致不救。　　癣疮治法：浸淫疮宜用苦瓠散涂之；干癣宜用羊蹄根绞自然汁，调腻粉涂之；湿癣宜用青金散贴之。[65p]

    Various sores and skin diseases occur due to the deficiency of the spleen and stomach, leading to the loss of bodily fluids and the uncontrolled movement of empty heat. This may also result from the six evils and seven emotions affecting the wet nurse, as well as improper diet and lifestyle affecting the child, causing illness. It is important to identify the causes, examine the patterns, and bring balance.

    For symptoms like a pale complexion with a mix of cold and heat, or white spots obstructing vision, these indicate liver dysfunction; a red face with fever or thirst and palpitations suggests heart dysfunction; a yellow face with thin body or thirst and diarrhea points to spleen dysfunction; a pale face with coughing or sores in the nose relates to lung dysfunction; and a dark complexion with thin body or preference for sleeping on damp ground signifies kidney dysfunction. Infants should be treated by regulating their wet nurse.

    If the five organs' strengths and weaknesses are not assessed correctly, and if the symptoms of empty and full conditions are not understood, rash treatments can worsen the situation and lead to dire consequences.

    For treating skin lesions: for immersed sores, apply a bitter gourd powder; for dry eczema, use the squeezed juice of goat’s hoof root mixed with fine powder; for wet eczema, use blue gold powder as a patch.[65p]

    　　　　　斑疹

    　　洁古云：斑疹之病，焮肿于外者，属少阳相火也，谓之斑；小红靥隐于皮肤中者，属少阴君火也，谓之疹。斑疹并出，则小儿难禁。然首尾俱不可下。大抵安里药多，发表药少。小便秘则微疏之。身温者顺，身凉者逆。大忌外敷寒凉，内用疏导，无此二者，可保无虞。
    　　　　　黄水粘疮

    　　小儿黄水粘疮，属肝脾二经风热积热所致。邪在表而痛痒者，轻则犀角消毒散，重则连翘防风汤。邪在内而大便秘者，轻则九味解毒散，重则大连翘饮。若头目不清，憎寒壮热，作渴便秘者，表里俱有邪也，加味清凉饮。若悞服克伐之药而致发热恶寒者，肺气伤也，用四君、桔梗、柴胡。发热呕吐，胃气伤也，用异功散。发热作泻，脾气虚也，用六君子汤。并加柴胡、升麻。余当随证裁之。[66p]

    Rashes

    Jie Gu said: The disease of rashes occurs when there is swelling on the outside, which belongs to the fire of the lesser yang, referred to as "spots;" small red patches hidden beneath the skin belong to the fire of the lesser yin, referred to as "rashes." When both spots and rashes appear, it is difficult for young children to endure. However, neither should be purged. Generally, there are more medicines for calming and fewer for dispersing. If urination is constipated, slightly relieve it. If the body feels warm, treat it normally; if cool, treat it in reverse. It is paramount to avoid applying cold externally and using dispersive internal medications; without these two, one can be assured of safety.

    Sticky Sores with Yellow Fluid

    In the case of children's sticky sores with yellow fluid, this is due to accumulated wind-heat from the liver and spleen meridians. If the pathogen is on the surface causing pain and itching, if mild, use the rhinoceros horn disinfecting powder; if severe, use the lianqiao and fangfeng decoction. If the pathogen is internal leading to constipation, if mild, use the nine-flavored detox powder; if severe, use the great lianqiao drink. If there is head and eye discomfort, aversion to cold and strong heat, thirst, and constipation, then there is a pestilence inside and out; add a modified cooling drink. If fever and aversion to cold arise from taking purging medicines, it indicates lung qi injury; use the four gentlemen's formula, plus zhike and chaihu. For fever with vomiting indicating stomach qi damage, use the yigong powder. For fever with diarrhea indicating spleen qi deficiency, use the six gentlemen's decoction, plus chaihu and shengma. The rest should be adjusted according to the symptoms.[66p]

    　　　　　头面疮

    　　人身诸阳之气，会于首而聚于面，其有患疮痍者，因脏腑不和，血气凝滞于诸阳之经，或禀赋肾阴虚肝火，或受母胎毒，或乳母六淫七情，或食膏粱醇酒，或儿食甘肥厚味所致。其因不同，当各辨其经络，审其所因而治之。若发于目锐眦、耳前，上颊抵鼻，至目内眦者，皆属小肠经，发于巅及头角下颊，耳后脑左右者，皆属胆经；发于颊前鼻孔，及人中左右者，皆属大肠经；发于鼻之挟孔下唇口，及承浆、耳后、颊车、耳前、发际额颅者，皆属胃经；发于目内眦，上额尖，至后脑项者，皆属膀胱经。既察其经，即当分治。[67p]

    Head and Face Sores

    The Yang energies of the human body converge at the head and accumulate on the face. When there are sores, it is due to disharmony among the internal organs, causing blood and Qi to stagnate in the Yang meridians. This may result from a deficiency of kidney Yin and liver fire, or from maternal toxicity during pregnancy, or from the six excesses and seven emotions experienced by the wet nurse, or from the consumption of rich food and strong alcohol, or from overindulgence in sweet and heavy food by the child. The causes differ, thus each condition must be assessed in terms of its meridians, examining the specific cause for treatment.

    If the sores appear at the inner corners of the eyes, in front of the ears, on the upper cheeks near the nose, and at the inner corners of the eyes, these are linked to the small intestine meridian. If they occur on the crown of the head, at the lower cheeks, behind the ears, and on both sides of the brain, these belong to the gallbladder meridian. Sores in front of the cheeks near the nostrils, or on either side of the philtrum, relate to the large intestine meridian. Sores on the sides of the nose, beneath the lips, at the承浆 (Chengjiang), behind the ears, on the cheekbones, in front of the ears, and at the hairline on the forehead belong to the stomach meridian. Finally, sores at the inner corners of the eyes, on the forehead, and extending to the back of the head and neck are associated with the bladder meridian. After identifying the meridians, differentiated treatment should be applied.[67p]

    若禀肾火者，用六味地黄丸；胎毒者，犀角消毒丸；食积疳者，四味肥儿丸；乳母膏粱者，东垣清胃散。至于诸腑受病，必兼诸脏，故患于额间属心经，发热饮冷者为实热，用导赤散；发热饮汤者属虚热，用养心汤。左腮属肝经，或颈项劲强者为实热，用柴胡清肝散；或咬牙烦闷者，虚热，用六味地黄丸。右腮属肺经，咳嗽饮冷者为实热，泻白散；发热咳嗽者为火刑金，用人参平肺散。鼻间属胃经，发热饮冷，大便黄硬者为实热，用泻黄散；发热饮汤，大便清白者为虚热，用异功散。患于颏及耳轮者属膀胱经，肾无实证，用地黄丸。若疮已溃，久而不愈，则当审其脏气之相胜，病邪之传变，而以调补脾胃为主。若因乳母遗热为患者，当先治其母，则儿病自愈也。[68p]

    If there is excess kidney fire, use Six Flavor Rehmannia Pill; for fetal toxins, use Rhinoceros Horn Detoxification Pill; for food accumulation causing diarrhea, use Four Flavor Fat Baby Pill; for nursing mothers with rich food, use Dongyuan Stomach Clearing Powder. As for diseases affecting the various organs, they must also involve the internal organs; hence, if there is a condition in the forehead related to the heart channel with fever from drinking cold, it is real heat, use Daochi Powder; if fever from drinking soup, it is empty heat, use Nourishing Heart Decoction. The left cheek pertains to the liver channel; if there is stiffness in the neck, it is real heat, use Chaihu Clear Liver Powder; if there is teeth grinding and irritability, it is empty heat, use Six Flavor Rehmannia Pill. The right cheek concerns the lung channel; if there is coughing with drinking cold, it is real heat, use Xie Bai Powder; if there is fever and cough, it is fire harming metal, use Ginseng Lung Calming Powder. The nose corresponds to the stomach channel; if there is fever from drinking cold and yellow hard stool, it is real heat, use Xie Huang Powder; if there is fever from drinking soup and clear white stool, it is empty heat, use Yigong Powder. If there is a condition at the chin and ear rim, it pertains to the bladder channel; if the kidney is not in excess, use Rehmannia Pill. If the sore has already festered and not healed over time, one must carefully examine the interactions of the organ energies and the transmission of pathogenic factors, focusing on tonifying the spleen and stomach. If the illness is caused by heat left by the nursing mother, treat the mother first, and the child will naturally recover.[68p]

    　　　　　头疮

    　　小儿头疮，是六阳受毒热而攻头成疮也。若头上散成片，常常燥痒，毛发稀少，有类白屑，此因积热上攻，名曰秃疮。疮虽生于头，世人只知以药外傅得愈，不逾旬月，其疮又发，何为而然？盖头者，诸阳所会之处，《洪范》五行火曰炎上，热毒上攻，两阳相灼，故疮生于头。法当解陈莝之积热，导心经之烦躁，斯可矣。　　又用防风通圣散酒制，除大黄另研为末，再用酒拌晒干为末，每一钱水煎，日四五服，至三十贴见效。[69p]

    Head Sores

    Head sores in children are caused by the six yang energies being attacked by toxic heat, leading to sores on the head. If the sores spread in patches, often causing dryness and itching, and there is sparse hair with a resemblance to white flakes, this is due to accumulated heat attacking upward, known as bald sores. Although the sores occur on the head, people only know to apply external medicine for healing. However, within a short month, the sores reappear. Why is this so? It is because the head is the meeting place of the yang energies. In the "Hong Fan," the five elements state that fire rises, and when toxic heat attacks upward, the two yangs scorch each other, which is why sores develop on the head. The treatment should focus on resolving the accumulated heat of the Chen Gao and alleviating the restlessness of the heart channel; then, it can be effective. Additionally, use Fangfeng Tongsheng Powder mixed with wine, separately grind the Dahuang into a powder, then mix with wine to dry before grinding into a powder. Prepare a decoction using one qian and take four to five doses daily, expecting noticeable results after thirty applications.[69p]

    　　　　　面疮

    　　治小儿面疮，通面烂无全肤，脓水淋漓不效者，陈年腊、猪油不入盐者敷之，神效。
    　　　　　眉炼

    　　眉炼者，小儿两眉闲生疮如疥癣，当求其因而药之。盖眉属胆经，若原禀肝胆经热，或乳母肝胆经有热者，用柴胡栀子散；或乳母食厚味醇酒者，用加味清胃散；或乳母有郁怒者，用加味逍遥散。俱与乳母服，子亦饮少许，仍参前证主之。　　眉炼治法，用青金散傅之；如不愈，烧小麦存性，细研，好酒调涂。
    　　　　　耳脓

    　　汤氏云：耳有五般，常出黄脓者为聤耳，出红脓者为脓耳，出白脓者为缠耳，疳臭者为伍耳，其内虚鸣出青脓者为震耳。证虽五般，病源一也。皆由风水入耳，积热上壅而成。若不早治，久则成聋。宜胭脂膏治之，仍服化痰退热等剂即愈也。[70p]

    Facial Sores

    To treat facial sores in children, when the face is sore and the skin is entirely broken, with pus oozing out, apply aged lard or unsalted pig fat; it is remarkably effective.

    Eyebrow Sores

    Eyebrow sores refer to sores that develop between a child's eyebrows resembling scabies. One should seek the cause and treat it accordingly. The eyebrows relate to the gallbladder meridian; if there is inherent heat in the liver and gallbladder or if the wet nurse has heat in her liver and gallbladder, use a decoction of Bupleurum and Gardenia; if the wet nurse consumes rich food and strong alcohol, use a modified Clear Stomach Decoction; if the wet nurse is emotionally distressed, use a modified Xiao Yao San. Both the wet nurse and child should take this, with the child consuming a small amount, considering the previous symptoms. For treating eyebrow sores, apply Qingjin powder; if there is no improvement, burn wheat until charred, grind finely, and mix with good wine for application.

    Ear Pus

    According to Tang’s writings: There are five types of ear conditions, with constant yellow pus being referred to as "ear fullness," red pus as "ear pus," white pus as "entangled ear," foul-smelling pus as "five ears," and internal ringing with green pus as "trembling ear." Although there are five types of symptoms, they all stem from the same source. They result from wind and water entering the ear, causing heat accumulation and obstruction. If not treated early, it may lead to deafness. It is recommended to use lipstick ointment for treatment, along with medications to clear phlegm and reduce heat, to achieve recovery.[70p]

    　　　　　口疮

    　　口疮一证，形与名不同，故治法亦异。有发于未病之前，有生于已病之后。大抵此疾不拘肥瘦，有血气盛者，又如将养过温，或心脾二经有热，或客热在胃，熏逼上焦而成其疮，此为实证，宜宣热拔毒，使无炎炽，自然作效。可用当归散加升麻、干葛、黄芩、水姜、葱、灯心煎服，及投牛蒡汤、拔毒饮、木通散，点以硝黄散。　　若口内白烂于舌上，口外糜溃于唇弦，疮少而大，不甚为痛，常流清水，此因脾胃虚热上蒸，内已先发而后形于外，宜百解散疏表；当归散，水、姜、枣煎服，和胃气，理虚热；次投牛蒡汤、三解散，涂以绿袍散，立效。饮黄金散，或投天竺黄散、地黄膏。　　若疮生于口角，是脾有积热，才开口则燥痛，饮食多难。[71p]

    Mouth Ulcers

    Mouth ulcers present differently in form and name, hence the treatment varies. They may arise before illness or occur after an illness has developed. Generally, this ailment does not depend on thinness or leanness; those with excess blood and qi, or those who have been too warm in their nourishment, may experience this. It can also be due to heat in the heart and spleen channels, or heat accumulating in the stomach, which heats and forces upwards to cause ulcers. This is a condition of excess, and treatments should focus on dispelling heat and extracting toxins to eliminate inflammation, resulting in natural recovery.

    One may use Danggui powder with additions of Shengma, Gancao, Huangqin, Shengjiang, green onions, and prepared as a decoction; also consider Burdock root soup, Detoxifying drink, and Mutong powder, applied with nitrate yellow powder.

    If the ulcers present as white sores on the tongue and there are external ulcers on the lips, characterized by few but large sores, with little pain and often fluid discharge, this is due to internal heat vaporizing from spleen deficiency. The internal ailment manifests externally, so it is advisable to use Baijiesan to disperse and release the exterior; Danggui powder with water, ginger, and jujube boiled together can harmonize the stomach qi and regulate internal heat. Following that, one may use Burdock root soup and Sanjiesan, applying it with Lüpao powder for immediate effect. Drinking Huangjin powder or using Tianzhuhuang powder or Dihuang paste can also help.

    If the ulcer forms at the corners of the mouth, it indicates excessive heat in the spleen, causing dryness and pain upon opening the mouth, making eating and drinking difficult.[71p]

    甚至再有外风吹着，便觉拆裂，微有清血，谓之燕吻疮。治法同前药饵；轻者，用甑盖上炊流汁涂之，亦验。　　有口唇下成小片赤烂，此因饮食腻汁，淋漓不洁。盖以婴儿皮肉脆嫩，浸渍成疮，及有风热乘之，名曰承浆疮，又谓之疳蚀疮，其所因者一也。治法同前证内药剂。　　有无故口臭糜溃而不成疮，或服凉剂，或涂末药，不能疗者，此名元焦。故叔和《脉诀》曰：阴数脾热并口臭，是脾家有虚热上攻于口，宜服回阳散。儿大者用黑锡丹，早食前，新汲水入盐少许调匀送下，与正元气，及参苓白朮散、调元散服之，以立效饮、黄金散、干点溃烂处，或用蜜同熟水调点舌上，令其自化，咽下无妨。仍忌毒物。　　诸疳口疮，因乳哺失节，或母食膏粱积热，或乳母七情郁火所致。[72p]

    If there is an external wind blowing, it may cause tearing and slight bleeding, known as Yanwen sore. The treatment is the same as previously mentioned herbal remedies; in mild cases, apply the steam from boiling liquid using a steamer cover, which is also effective.

    If small red patches appear on the lips, this is due to greasy and unclean foods. Since infants have delicate and tender skin, exposure can lead to sores, especially with the invasion of wind-heat, called Chengjiang sore, also referred to as Gan Shi sore; the cause is the same. The treatment follows the same internal herbal remedies as previously mentioned.

    If there is an unexplained bad breath with decay that does not form sores, or if cooling agents or powdered medicines do not heal it, this is named Yuan Jiao. Therefore, Shu He in "Pulse Treatise" states: when there is a frail heat in the spleen along with bad breath, this indicates that the spleen has empty heat rising to the mouth, so one should take the Hui Yang powder. For older children, use black tin pill before meals with slightly salted water mixed and swallow to restore the original qi, along with Shen Ling Bai Zhu powder and Tiao Yuan powder to achieve immediate effects; apply golden powder to the decayed areas, or mix honey with warm water, place it on the tongue to let it dissolve and swallow without harm. Avoid toxic substances.

    Various types of Gan mouth sores are caused by improper nursing, or excessive heat accumulated by the mother's rich diet, or by the emotional stresses affecting the wet nurse.[72p]

    其证口舌齿龈，如生疮状，若发热作渴饮冷，额间色赤，左寸脉洪数者，此属心经，先用导赤散清心火，次用地黄丸滋肾水。若寒热作渴，左颊青赤，左关脉弦洪者，属肝经，先用柴胡栀子散清肝火，次用六味地黄丸生肝血。若两腮黄赤，牙龈腐烂，大便酸臭，右关脉洪数，按之则缓者，属脾经，用四味肥儿丸治脾火，以五味异功散补脾气。若发热咳嗽，右腮色赤，右寸脉洪数，按之濇者，属肺经，先用清肺饮治肺火，用五味异功散补脾胃。若发热作渴，两颏黧色，左尺脉数者，属肾经不足，先用六味地黄丸以生肾水，次用补中益气汤以生肺气。又有走马疳者，因病后脾胃气血伤损，虚火上炎，或痘疹余毒上攻，其患甚速，急用铜绿散、大芜荑汤。轻则牙龈腐烂，唇吻腮肿；重则牙龈蚀露，颊腮透烂。[73p]

    If the tongue, lips, teeth, and gums appear ulcerated, and if there is thirst for cold drinks with a red hue on the forehead, along with a rapid and strong pulse on the left wrist, this pertains to the heart meridian. First, use Dao Chi San to clear the heart fire, then follow up with Di Huang Wan to nourish kidney water. If there are alternating chills and fever, with a bluish-red left cheek and a wiry and strong pulse on the left guan, this is associated with the liver meridian. First, use Chai Hu Zhi Zi San to clear liver fire, and then apply Liu Wei Di Huang Wan to nourish liver blood. If both cheeks are yellow-red, there is decaying gums, foul-smelling stools, and a rapid pulse on the right guan that feels slack upon pressure, this belongs to the spleen meridian. Treat with Si Wei Fei Er Wan for spleen fire, and supplement spleen qi with Wu Wei Yi Gong San. If there is fever and cough, a red right cheek, and a rapid pulse on the right cun that feels rough upon pressure, this relates to the lung meridian. First, use Qing Fei Yin to treat lung fire, and then use Wu Wei Yi Gong San to supplement spleen and stomach. If there is fever and thirst, with dark coloration on both chins and a rapid left chi pulse, this indicates kidney deficiency. First, apply Liu Wei Di Huang Wan to generate kidney water, and then use Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang to generate lung qi. Additionally, for conditions like "Zou Ma Gan," which arise from injury to spleen and stomach qi and blood due to illness, with deficiency fire rising, or from the residual toxins of pox and rash, treatments should be immediate with Tong Lu San and Da Wu Yi Tang. In mild cases, there may be decaying gums or swelling of the lips and cheeks; in severe cases, the gums may erode, exposing the teeth, and the cheeks may show signs of severe decay.[73p]

    若饮食不入，喘促痰甚，此脾胃虚而肺气败也；腮颊赤腐不知痛者，此胃气虚甚而肉死也，并不治。　　经云：手少阴之经通于舌，足太阳之经通于口，因心脾二经有热，则口舌生疮也。当察面图部位，分经络虚实而药之。若元气无亏，暴病，口生白屑，或重舌者，用乱发缠指蘸井花水揩之；或刺出毒血，以柳花散敷之。上腭肿胀或有泡者，并令刺破，敷前散，或以青黛搽之。刺后又生，又刺。若唇吻坼裂者，用当归调柳花散敷之。[74p]

    If food and drink do not enter, and there is rapid, labored breathing with much phlegm, this indicates deficiency of the spleen and stomach, and failing of lung energy; if the cheeks and jaw are red and rotting with no pain, this indicates extreme deficiency of stomach energy resulting in flesh death, and cannot be treated. The classics say: the hand shaoyin channel connects to the tongue, and the foot taiyang channel connects to the mouth; thus, when there is heat in the heart and spleen channels, sores arise in the mouth and tongue. One should examine the facial features, differentiate between the channels' fullness and emptiness, and prescribe accordingly. If vital energy is not depleted but there is an acute illness, with white flakes forming in the mouth or a heavy tongue, use chaotic hair wrapped around fingers dipped in well water to wipe it; or prick to release toxic blood and apply a willow flower powder. If there is swelling or blisters on the hard palate, one should prick and drain it, apply the front powder, or use indigo to rub on it. If it recurs after pricking, prick again. If the lips and mouth are cracked, apply a combination of angelica and willow flower powder.[74p]

    若元气亏损，或兼服寒凉之药，作呕少食者，此虚热也，用五味异功散加升麻、柴胡。若泄泻作渴者，脾胃虚弱也，用七味白朮散。若腹痛恶寒者，脾胃虚寒也，用六君、姜、桂。若因母食酒面煎煿者，用清胃散。若因母饮食劳役者，用补中益气汤；肝脾血虚者，用加味逍遥散；郁怒内热者，用加味归脾汤，母子并服。若泥用降火，必变慢脾风矣，仍参吐舌弄舌治之。　　口疮服凉药不愈者，此中焦气不足，虚火泛上，宜附子理中汤。[75p]

    If the vital energy is deficient, or if one has taken cold and cooling medicines and experiences nausea and reduced appetite, this is a case of virtual heat. Use the Five-Flavored Different Functional Powder with added Sheng Ma and Chai Hu. If there is diarrhea and thirst, this indicates weak spleen and stomach; use the Seven-Flavored Bai Zhu Powder. If there is abdominal pain and aversion to cold, this suggests a cold deficiency of the spleen and stomach; use the Six Gentlemen Decoction with ginger and cinnamon. If caused by maternal consumption of alcohol and fried foods, use the Clear Stomach Powder. If caused by maternal overexertion in diet and labor, use the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction; for liver and spleen blood deficiency, use the Enhanced Xiao Yao Powder; if there is internal heat due to pent-up anger, use the Enhanced Gui Pi Decoction, taken by both mother and child. Should there be mud-like symptoms indicating a need to reduce heat, it will inevitably transform into a sluggish spleen wind; still, assist by treating the tongue with methods to expel it. For oral ulcers that do not heal with cooling medicines, this indicates insufficient qi in the middle burner, with virtual fire surging upwards; it is advisable to use the Fu Zi Li Zhong Decoction.[75p]

    　　　　　腮痈

    　　腮属足阳明胃经，其生痈者，多因儿食甘甜厚味，脾胃积热所致；亦有乳母郁怒，儿受其患者。若因积热于内，二便不通者，用凉膈散。风邪相搏，二便如常者，用漏芦汤。胃经风热，或兼咽喉肿痛，用升麻防风汤。若禀赋阴虚火动，颏间或两耳内生疮，或脓出不止者，宜用地黄丸。若因乳母肝火乘脾，用加味逍遥散；脾经郁热，用加味归脾汤；膏粱积热，用东垣清胃散。脾胃风热，用清咽利膈汤。仍参口疮治之。[76p]

    Mumps Abscess

    Mumps belongs to the Yangming stomach meridian. The occurrence of abscesses is often due to children consuming sweet, rich foods, leading to heat accumulation in the spleen and stomach. It can also result from a wet nurse's anger affecting the child. If the abscess is caused by internal heat and accompanied by difficulty in urination and defecation, use Qingge San. If a wind pathogen is present and urination is normal, use Loulu Tang. For wind-heat in the stomach meridian, or if there is also swelling and pain in the throat, use Shengma Fangfeng Tang. If there is a constitution with yin deficiency and fire, resulting in sores in the chin area or inside the ears, or persistent pus, use Dihuang Wan. If the wet nurse has liver fire affecting the spleen, use Jiawei Xiaoyao San; for heat stagnation in the spleen meridian, use Jiawei Guipi Tang; if there is heat from excessive rich foods, use Dongyuan Qingwei San. For wind-heat in the spleen and stomach, use Qingyan Lige Tang. Also consider treatment for oral sores.[76p]

    　　　　　臂痈

    　　臂痈之证，当分经络，所属受证之因而治之。上廉属手阳明经，下廉属手太阳经，外廉属手少阳经，内廉属手厥阴经，内之上廉属手太阴经，内之下廉属手少阴经。或经络热郁，风邪外干，气血有乖，即生痈毒。若因心经有热者，导赤散加黄连。心包络有热者，柴胡栀子散。肺经有热者，泻白散。大肠经有热者，大连翘饮。焮肿作痛者，血气凝结也，用仙方活命饮。肿痛不散者，欲作脓也，用托里消毒散。脓熟不出者，气血虚也，用托里消毒散。脓出反痛者，气血虚甚也，肌肉不生者，脾胃气虚也，用五味异功散，不可外敷生肌散，恐反助其邪而肌肉难长也。[77p]

    Arm Abscess

    The signs of an arm abscess should be differentiated by meridians and treated according to the causes underlying the condition. The upper section corresponds to the Hand Yangming meridian, the lower section to the Hand Taiyang meridian, the outer section to the Hand Shaoyang meridian, and the inner section to the Hand Jueyin meridian. The inner upper section corresponds to the Hand Taiyin meridian, and the inner lower section to the Hand Shaoyin meridian. If there is heat stagnation in the meridians, with external wind evils invading, leading to disruption of qi and blood, abscesses and toxins may arise. If there is heat in the Heart meridian, use Duozhisan with Huanglian. If there is heat in the Pericardium, use Chaihu and Zhizi powder. If there is heat in the Lung meridian, use Xiebai powder. If there is heat in the Large Intestine meridian, use Daliangqiao decoction. If there is swelling and pain, it indicates blood and qi stagnation; use Xianfang Huoming decoction. If the swelling and pain do not resolve, indicating the formation of pus, use Tori Xiaodu powder. If pus does not discharge, indicating deficiency of qi and blood, continue with Tori Xiaodu powder. If pus discharges but causes pain, indicating severe deficiency of qi and blood, and if muscles do not regenerate, indicating deficiency of Spleen and Stomach qi, use Wuwei Yigong powder. Do not apply external muscle-regenerating powder, as it may assist the evil and hinder muscle growth.[77p]

    　　　　　腋痈

    　　腋痈属足少阳、手少阴、手厥阴三经，小儿患之，多禀赋肝火所致。初起先用活命饮，次用柴胡栀子散。五七日间，作脓，焮肿作痛者，亦用活命饮，杀其大势，虽溃亦轻而易敛。若脓已成，用托里消毒散。已出，用托里散。如有变证，当随证治之。
    　　　　　胁痈

    　　胁痈者，足厥阴少阳之经，相火之司也，乃木之主。肝胆之气不平，则风火内搏，荣逆血郁，热聚为脓，而痈肿之所由生也。亦有禀赋母气肝胆之热，恚怒之火而致。然初患焮肿作痛者，宜用柴胡栀子散；未消者，用仙方活命饮。其热既杀而肿不消者，则必成脓也，乃用托里消毒散。其脓已成，以代针膏决之，仍用托里散自愈。若脓出而痛止肿消，则不必用药也。[78p]

    Axillary Abscess

    Axillary abscess belongs to the pathways of the Foot Shao Yang, Hand Shao Yin, and Hand Jue Yin. In children, it is often caused by an inherent liver fire. At the initial stage, first use the Huoming Decoction, and then use the Chai Hu and Zhi Zi Powder. Within five to seven days, if pus forms and there is redness, swelling, and pain, continue to use the Huoming Decoction to diminish the major symptoms, making any rupture mild and easily manageable. If pus has already formed, use the Tuo Li Xiao Du Powder. Once it has come out, use the Tuo Li Powder. If symptoms change, treat according to the condition.

    Flank Abscess

    Flank abscess arises from the Foot Jue Yin and Shao Yang channels and is governed by the fire of the kidneys, which is the chief of wood. When the energies of the liver and gallbladder are unbalanced, the internal wind-fire collides, resulting in stagnation of blood and heat accumulation, leading to the formation of pus and swelling. It can also stem from an inherent heat of the liver and gallbladder caused by anger and rage. At the onset of redness, swelling, and pain, it is advisable to use the Chai Hu and Zhi Zi Powder; if it has not resolved, use the Xian Fang Huoming Decoction. If the heat has been diminished but the swelling has not subsided, pus must form, so then use the Tuo Li Xiao Du Powder. If pus has formed, it should be released with a substitutive ointment, while still using the Tuo Li Powder to aid healing. If pus is discharged and pain ceases, there is no need for medication.[78p]

    　　　　　腹痈

    　　腹痈者，患于脐下，或傍二寸许，属脾经；近胁属胆经。盖因脾经阴虚，气滞血凝，或因脾虚，饮食积热所患。若焮肿作痛者泻黄散，坚硬肿痛者清胃散，肿痛便秘者清凉饮。如此而仍痛者，瘀血凝滞也，活命饮。既用此药而不消，则内欲作脓也，用托里消毒散。若脓出而痛不减者，毒未解也，亦用前药。若脓出而反加痛，及脓水清稀者，气血虚也，用参芪托里散。若食少体倦者，脾气虚也，用五味异功散加当归、柴胡、升麻。晡热内热者，脾血虚也，用四君、当归、丹皮。如有他证，当随证治之。[79p]

    Abdominal Abscess

    An abdominal abscess occurs below the navel, usually about two inches from it, associated with the spleen channel; nearby the flank, it pertains to the gallbladder channel. It arises from deficiency of the spleen channel, leading to stagnation of qi and coagulation of blood, or due to spleen deficiency resulting from an accumulation of heat from food and drink. If there is swelling and pain, use the She Huang San (Yellow Powder). For hard, swollen, and painful areas, use the Qing Wei San (Clear the Stomach Powder). If swelling and pain are accompanied by constipation, use the Qing Liang Yin (Cooling Drink). If pain persists, it indicates blood stasis, and the Huo Ming Yin (Revive Life Drink) should be administered. If this medicine does not alleviate the condition, it suggests the formation of pus, for which you should use the Tuo Li Xiao Du San (Wash and Detoxify Powder). If pus is discharged but the pain does not diminish, it indicates that the toxin is not yet resolved; the previous medicine should also be continued. If pus is discharged but the pain increases and the pus is clear and thin, it indicates deficiency of qi and blood; use the Shen Qi Tuo Li San (Ginseng and Astragalus Wash and Detoxify Powder). If there is decreased appetite and fatigue, it indicates spleen qi deficiency; use the Wu Wei Yi Gong San (Five Flavor Beneficial Powder) with added Dang Gui (Angelica) and Chai Hu (Bupleurum). If there is a fever in the afternoon, it suggests spleen blood deficiency; use the Si Jun, Dang Gui, and Dan Pi (Four Gentlemen, Dang Gui, and Moutan). If other symptoms are present, treat according to those specific symptoms.[79p]

    　　　　　臀痈

    　　臀痈属膀胱经湿热，或禀赋阴虚。若肿硬作痛，用内托羌活汤；微肿微痛，用托里消毒散。若初起大痛，或五日之间似消不消，似溃不溃者，先用仙方活命饮，饮后用托里消毒散。若已溃，食少体倦，疮不生肌，脾胃虚弱者，用五味异功散加柴胡、升麻。禀赋阴虚，小便数而不敛者，加减八味丸。气虚，久不生肌收口，用豆豉饼及补中益气汤，培养元气。若用解热攻毒，及敷围寒凉之剂，则气血受伤，必成败证矣。
    　　　　　腿痈

    　　腿痈之证，所主之经不同，而所治之法亦异。发于内侧者，属肝脾二经；发于外侧者，属胆胃二经。漫肿坚硬者，元气虚弱也，用内补黄芪汤。肿势高焮者，元气未虚也，用内托柴胡黄芪汤，外并用隔蒜熨法。若瘀血凝滞而不消，或不作脓者，用活命饮。血气虚弱而不能溃，及不生肌肉者，用托里散。此其梗概云尔。[80p]

    Buttock Abscess

    Buttock abscess is attributed to damp-heat in the bladder meridian, or a yin deficiency constitution. If there is swelling and hardness with pain, use the internal formula Qianghuo Decoction; if there is slight swelling and mild pain, use the Tori Dispersing Detoxification Powder. If there is severe pain at the onset, or if it seems to neither resolve nor rupture within five days, first use the Xianfang Huoming Decoction, followed by the Tori Dispersing Detoxification Powder. If it has already ruptured, with poor appetite, fatigue, and non-healing sores, and if the spleen and stomach are weak, use the Wumei Yigong Powder with added Chaihu and Shengma. For those with a yin deficiency and frequent urination that does not restrain, use the modified Eight Flavor Pill. If there is qi deficiency and it has not healed for a long time, use the Douzhi Cake and the Bu Zhong Yi Qi Decoction to nourish the vital energy. If using heat-clearing and toxin-purging or applying cold agents, the qi and blood will be harmed, and it will definitely lead to a failed outcome.

    Leg Abscess

    The symptoms of leg abscess are associated with different meridians, and thus the treatment methods are also different. Abscesses arising on the inner side belong to the liver and spleen meridians; those on the outer side belong to the gallbladder and stomach meridians. If there is extensive swelling that is hard, it indicates a weakness of vital energy; use the internal formula Huangqi Decoction. If the swelling is intense, it indicates that the vital energy is not yet depleted; use the internal formula Chaihu Huangqi Decoction, combined with the external application of garlic poultice. If there is stagnant blood that does not resolve or form pus, use the Huoming Decoction. If the blood and qi are weak and unable to rupture, leading to non-healing of muscle tissue, use the Tori Powder. This summarizes the main points.[80p]

    　　　　　肺痈

    　　肺痈肺痿，因脾肺气虚，腠理不密，外邪所乘；或母食辛辣厚味，遗热于儿；或儿有病，过于汗下，内亡津液，虚火烁肺；或服克伐之药，亏损脾胃，不能生肺金。其证恶风咳嗽，鼻塞项强，呼吸不利，甚则四肢微肿，咳唾脓血。若吐臭秽，胸中隐痛，脉数而实者，为肺痈。咳嗽涎沫脉数而虚者，为肺痿。恶寒喘嗽者，寒邪内蕴也，小青龙汤。咳唾脓秽者，此肺痈内溃也，桔梗汤。窃谓前证若喘咳短气者，脾肺气虚也，五味异功散。咳唾脓痰，左尺脉数而无力者，肾气虚也，六味地黄丸。咳唾脓痰，右关脉数而无力者，脾气虚也，七味白朮散。若发热喘嗽，唾脓不食者，脾肺虚甚也，难治。大要补脾肺，滋肾水为善，仍审五脏相胜，乳母七情。后证仿此。[81p]

    Lung Abscess

    Lung abscess and lung emaciation arise from the weakness of spleen and lung qi, leading to loose pores that allow external pathogens to invade. It may also occur if the mother consumes spicy and rich foods, passing heat to the child; or if the child is ill and suffers excessive sweating that depletes body fluids, resulting in deficient fire damaging the lungs; or from the administration of harsh medications that impair the spleen and stomach, preventing them from nourishing the lung metal. The symptoms include aversion to wind, coughing, nasal congestion, stiff neck, difficulty breathing, and in severe cases, slight swelling of the limbs, along with coughing up purulent blood. If fetid and foul-smelling vomit occurs, accompanied by hidden pain in the chest and a rapid, strong pulse, it indicates a lung abscess. Coughing up phlegm and saliva with a rapid and weak pulse indicates lung emaciation. An aversion to cold and wheezing reveals an internal retention of cold pathogenic factors, treated with Xiao Qing Long Tang. Coughing up purulent foul matter indicates internal perforation of the lung, treated with Jie Geng Tang. I opine that if there are symptoms of wheezing with shortness of breath, it indicates weakness in spleen and lung qi, requiring Wu Wei Yi Gong San. Coughing up purulent phlegm with a rapid but weak left pulse indicates kidney qi deficiency, treated with Liu Wei Di Huang Wan. Coughing up purulent phlegm with a rapid but weak right pulse suggests spleen qi deficiency, treated with Qi Wei Bai Zhu San. If there is fever, wheezing, and inability to eat while coughing up pus, it signifies severe deficiency of spleen and lung, which is difficult to treat. The primary approach is to tonify the spleen and lung, nourish kidney essence, and observe the interactions among the five organs while considering the emotions of the nursing mother. Follow similar principles for subsequent symptoms.[81p]

    　　　　　肠痈

    　　张仲景云：肠痈之证，因饮食积热，或母食辛热之物所致。小腹按之则痛，小便数似淋，腹急恶寒，身皮甲错，或自汗恶寒。若脉迟紧未有脓者，用仙方活命饮，以解其毒；脉洪数已有脓者，服太乙膏以下其脓；小腹疼痛，小便不利者，脓壅滞也，牡丹皮散主之。窃谓经云：肠痈为病不可惊，惊则肠断而死。故坐卧转侧之间，须令徐缓，时少饮薄粥，及用八珍汤，固其元气，静养调理，庶可保也。[82p]

    Intestinal Abscess

    Zhang Zhongjing said: The symptoms of intestinal abscess arise from dietary heat accumulation, or from a mother’s consumption of spicy and hot foods. When pressing the lower abdomen, there is pain; urination is frequent and resembles dysuria; there is abdominal urgency and a dislike of cold; the skin feels tight, and there may be spontaneous sweating and aversion to cold. If the pulse is slow and tight and there is no pus present, use Xianfang Huoming Decoction to dispel the poison; if the pulse is surging and rapid and pus is present, take Taiyi Ointment to expel the pus. If there is abdominal pain and difficulty urinating, it indicates pus stagnation, which can be addressed by Mudanpi Powder. I secretly believe that the texts state: Intestinal abscess is a disease that should not cause alarm, for fright can lead to rupture of the intestines and death. Therefore, in sitting, lying, or turning, one must move slowly and gently, occasionally drink diluted porridge, and use Eight Treasure Soup to strengthen the vital energy, allowing for calm nurturing and regulation, which may help preserve health.[82p]

    　　　　　便毒

    　　便毒，因肝火肝疳，或禀肝经热毒。若初起肿硬作痛者，先用龙胆泻肝汤一二剂；肿痛不减，用仙方活命饮二剂；五七日不减肿尚硬，亦用前二药各一剂；如不消或更痛，欲成脓也，用活命饮一剂，却用托里消毒散加柴胡、山栀一二剂。若脓已成而不溃者，血气虚也，用托里消毒散一二剂。脓已溃而痛不止者，毒气不解也，用活命饮一剂；若脓已出而反痛者，血气虚也，用内补黄芪汤；脓已溃而发热烦躁者，气虚血脱也，用当归补血汤；脓已溃而恶寒发热者，血气俱虚也，用十全大补汤；脓已溃而恶寒者，元气虚也，用补中益气汤，脓已溃而不生肌者，脾气虚也，用六君子汤。若禀赋怯弱，或因饮食劳倦而为患者，但用补中益气汤加射干自消。设使不分经络，不别虚实，概行攻伐，亏损气血，则轻者难治，重者必变瘵证，甚至不起。[83p]

    Poison from the Bowels

    This poison arises from liver fire or liver damp-heat, or it may be due to heat toxin in the liver channel. If there is initial swelling, hardness, and pain, begin with one or two doses of Longdan Xiegan Decoction; if the swelling and pain do not diminish, use two doses of Xianfang Huo Ming Decoction. If after five to seven days the swelling remains hard and does not reduce, also use each of the previous two medicines once. If it does not resolve or becomes more painful, indicating potential pus formation, use one dose of Huo Ming Decoction and then apply Tuoli Xiaodu San with added Chaihu and Sanzi for one or two doses.

    If pus has formed but is not draining, it's due to blood and qi deficiency; use Tuoli Xiaodu San for one or two doses. If pus has drained but pain persists, it indicates unresolved toxins; administer one dose of Huo Ming Decoction. If pus has emerged but pain recurs, it suggests blood and qi deficiency; use Neibu Huangqi Decoction. For cases where pus has drained and there are symptoms of fever and agitation, indicating qi deficiency and blood loss, use Danggui Bubai Decoction. If pus has drained and there are chills with fever, indicating both blood and qi deficiency, use Shi Quan Da Bu Decoction.

    If there are chills after pus has drained, indicating yuan qi deficiency, use Buzhong Yiqi Decoction. If there is no skin regeneration after the pus has drained, this points to spleen qi deficiency; use Liu Junzi Decoction. If the patient is constitutionally weak, or if they have become ill due to diet and overwork, simply administer Buzhong Yiqi Decoction with added Shegan for self-resolution.

    Failing to differentiate between channels, neglecting the distinctions of deficiency and excess, and broadly attacking may deplete qi and blood; thus, mild cases become hard to treat, while severe cases may develop into chronic conditions, risking significant complications.[83p]

    　　　　　囊痈

    　　囊痈属肝经湿热，或禀胎肝热所致。初起肿痛小便赤濇者，湿热壅滞也，先用龙胆泻肝汤；如不消，用仙方活命饮。若肿痛数日不止，欲成脓也，用托里消毒散；若肿未溃而小便不利者，毒气壅滞也，当分利之。脓已成而小便不利者，毒气未解也，当针泄之；脓出而反痛者，气血虚也，当补益之。若元气无亏，虽阴囊悉溃，睪丸悬露，亦不为害。若乳母恚怒，令儿患此者，加味逍遥散；肝经气血虚者，八珍散、加味柴胡、山栀，俱加漏芦，子母并服。
    　　　　　脚冻疮[84p]

    Abscess of the Sac

    The abscess of the sac is attributed to damp-heat in the liver channel or is caused by inherited liver heat. When it first appears with swelling and pain and bloody urine, it indicates damp-heat obstruction; initially, use Long Dan Xie Gan Decoction. If there is no improvement, use Xian Fang Huo Ming Decoction. If the swelling and pain persist for several days and there is a desire for it to rupture, use Tuo Li Xiao Du San. If the swelling has not yet ruptured and urinary passage is obstructed, this indicates toxic qi stagnation, and one should promote urination. If pus has formed but urination remains obstructed, this indicates that the toxic qi has not been resolved; one should use a needle to relieve it. If pus exits and pain returns, this is due to deficiency of qi and blood, and one should tonify. If the source qi is not deficient, even if the scrotum ruptures and the testicles are exposed, it is not harmful. If a nursing mother is angry and causes her child to suffer from this, use Jia Wei Xiao Yao San; if there is deficiency of qi and blood in the liver channel, use Ba Zhen San, Jia Wei Chai Hu, and Shan Zhi, and add Lou Lu, for both mother and child to take.[84p]

    　　足指冻疮，因受禀虚怯，故寒邪易乘，气血凝滞，久而不愈，则溃烂成疮。治法须壮脾胃，温气血，则死肉自溃，良肉自生。若骨脱筋连者，宜急剪去，否则毒涎脚面而死。盖肢末之处，气血难到，又为外邪遏绝，则气血不能运行。若用汤荡火烘，其内即死而不仁，至春必溃腐脱落。元气无亏，虽患无害。如外敷寒药，内服消毒之剂，则元气受伤，必成败证。凡初冻时，以热手频熨之为妙。北方冻耳，若误以手触之，其耳即落。大寒能裂肤堕指，信然！
    　　　　　汤火疮

    　　汤火之证，若发热作渴，小便赤濇者，内热也，用四物加山栀、连翘、甘草。若肉未死而作痛者，热毒也，用四君加芎归、山栀、连翘。若肉已死而不溃者，气血虚也，用四君加当归、黄芪，外敷当归膏，或柏叶末蜡油调搽，至白色，其肉自生。若因烟熏将死者，以生萝卜汁灌之，即苏。若饮食后被汤火所伤，发热腹胀，恶食发搐变证者，当参食积惊搐门治之。[85p]

    Frostbite on the toes occurs due to a deficiency of vitality and an inability to withstand cold, making it easy for cold pathogens to invade. When the qi and blood stagnate for a long time without healing, it can lead to ulceration and the formation of sores. The treatment must focus on strengthening the spleen and stomach and warming the qi and blood, allowing necrotic tissue to slough off and healthy flesh to regenerate. If there is detachment of bone and tendon, it should be urgently excised; otherwise, toxic secretions could lead to death. Indeed, at the extremities, qi and blood find it difficult to reach, and when obstructed by external pathogens, the flow of qi and blood becomes stagnant. If treated with hot water, it leads to internal death and loss of sensation; by spring, it will surely ulcerate, rot, and fall off. If the vital energy is not depleted, even if ill, there is no harm. However, if cold medications are applied externally and detoxifying agents are ingested, the vital energy may be harmed, leading to failure to heal. In cases of initial frostbite, frequent warm hand compresses are effective. In the north, if one mistakenly touches their frostbitten ear, it may fall off. Extreme cold can indeed crack the skin and cause fingers to fall off, which is true!

    For burns and scalds, if there is fever and thirst along with red and painful urination, it indicates internal heat; use Si Wu Decoction with added Gardenia fruit, Forsythia, and Licorice. If there is pain but the flesh is not necrotic, it indicates heat toxin; apply Si Jun Zi Decoction with added Chuanxiong, Gardenia fruit, and Forsythia. If the flesh is dead but not ulcerating, there is qi and blood deficiency; use Si Jun Zi Decoction with added Angelica and Astragalus, and apply Angelica ointment externally or a mixture of cypress leaf powder and wax oil. If due to smoke it is at risk of death, irrigate with juice from fresh radish, and it will revive. If one suffers burns or scalds post-meal, resulting in fever, abdominal distension, aversion to food, and spasms, one should seek treatment for food accumulation and convulsions.[85p]

    　　　　　翻花疮

    　　翻花疮之证，由疮疡溃后，风寒袭于患处，或肝火血燥生风，或乳母肝火生风，必致疮口努肉，突出如菌，或如指大小，长短不同。如风邪承袭者，先用补中益气汤加防风、天麻。风寒凝滞者，先用十宣散加羌活、天麻。儿肝火生风者，先用加味逍遥散加天麻、羌活。母肝火生风者，先用加味小柴胡汤，次用加味逍遥散加漏芦、天麻。其风邪所乘，外用豆豉饼；风寒所凝，外用熨葱法。更用太乙膏护疮口；突肉不消，更以黎芦膏涂之。如疮口不敛而恶寒发热者，元气虚也，用补中益气汤。晡热内热者，气血俱虚也，用八珍汤，倍加参、芪。食少难化者，脾气虚也，用五味异功散。若饮食少思，大便不调，或肌肉消瘦，小便澄白者，此兼肝脾疳证也，用九味芦荟丸以清肝火，用五味异功散以补脾气，外仍用熨治之法。[86p]

    Translation:

    Flipping Flower Sores

    The condition of flipping flower sores arises after ulcers rupture, when wind and cold invade the affected area, or when liver fire and blood dryness generate wind, or when the milk mother's liver fire generates wind. This will inevitably lead to the ulcer edges becoming protruding like meat, resembling mushrooms, varying in size from that of a finger and differing in length.

    If the wind evil persists, first use the Qi-preserving and Energy-reinforcing Decoction, adding Fangfeng and Tianma. If wind and cold are stagnant, first use the Shixuan Powder, adding Qianghuo and Tianma. If the child's liver fire generates wind, first use the Modified Xiaoyao Powder, adding Tianma and Qianghuo. If the mother's liver fire generates wind, first use the Modified Xiao Chai Hu Decoction, followed by the Modified Xiaoyao Powder with Luoluo and Tianma.

    For wind evil lurking, apply a bean curd paste externally; for wind and cold stagnation, use the scallion compress method externally. Use Taiyi Ointment to protect the ulcer's opening; if the protruding meat does not diminish, apply Li Lu Ointment. If the ulcer edges do not close and there is chilling with fever, this indicates a deficiency of vital energy; use the Qi-preserving and Energy-reinforcing Decoction.

    If there is evening heat and internal heat, indicating both Qi and blood deficiency, use the Eight Treasures Decoction, with double the amount of Ginseng and Astragalus. If appetite is poor and digestion difficult, indicating spleen Qi deficiency, use the Five Flavors Expelling Evil Powder.

    If there is little appetite and thinking about food, irregular bowel movements, or if the muscles are emaciated and urine is clear, this suggests a combined liver and spleen deficiency; use the Nine Flavor Aloe Pills to clear liver fire and the Five Flavors Expelling Evil Powder to tonify spleen Qi, continuing the external treatment methods.[86p]

    　　　　　多骨疽

    　　多骨疽，由疮疡久溃，脾胃损亏，血气不能荣于患处，邪气陷袭，久则筋烂骨腐，故骨脱出，非禀胎所有也。当补脾胃，壮元气，内用大补汤地黄丸，外以附子饼、葱熨法，祛散寒邪，补接元气，则骨自脱，疮自敛。若用克伐之剂，复伤真气，鲜有不危。婴儿患此，当调补乳母，外用葱熨，以岁月除之，尤不可用追蚀之药。
    　　　　　漏疮

    　　漏疮之证，因禀气血不足，或久病血气虚弱，或儿肝脾食积内热，不能生肌，或乳母七情不和。脾气不能收敛，当审其所因，调补元气，佐以如圣饼、葱熨之类为善。若用流气破血追蚀等药，反为败证矣。余当参各门主之。[87p]

    Multiple Bone Ulcer

    Multiple bone ulcer arises from long-standing sores, depleting the spleen and stomach, causing blood and qi to fail to nourish the affected area. Evil qi invades; over time, tendons rot and bones decay, resulting in bones protruding, which is not due to congenital factors. One should nourish the spleen and stomach, strengthen vital qi, using internal remedies such as Dabu soup and Dihuang pills, and for external treatment, apply aconite cakes and onion poultices to dispel cold evil and replenish vital qi, leading to spontaneous separation of the bone and healing of the ulcer. If one uses harsh and destructive remedies, it can further harm the true qi and is rarely without danger. In infants suffering from this condition, one must adjust and supplement the nursing mother's diet and use external onion poultices to gradually alleviate the issue, particularly avoiding any aggressive corrosive drugs.

    Ulcers

    The symptoms of ulcers stem from insufficient innate qi and blood, or prolonged illness resulting in weak qi and blood, or from a child's liver and spleen being burdened by internal heat from food accumulation, which fails to produce muscle. Additionally, if the nursing mother experiences emotional imbalance, it further complicates the condition. If the spleen qi cannot consolidate, one must carefully assess the underlying causes, restore vital qi, and apply supportive remedies like Shengbing and onion poultices. Using draining and corrosive medicines, however, would only worsen the condition. I shall consult various experts on this matter.[87p]

    　　　　方

    　　漏芦汤 【《千金要方》，下同】 　治小儿热毒，痈疽，赤白诸丹毒，疮疖。　　漏芦　连翘一用白薇　白敛　芒硝一用芍药　甘草各六铢　大黄一两　升麻　枳实　麻黄　黄芩各九铢　　右十味(口父)咀，以水一升半，煎取五合，儿生一日至七日取一合，分三服；八日至十五日取一合半，分三服；十六日至二十日取二合，分三服；二十日至三十日取三合，分三服；三十日至四十日取五合，分三服。
    　　五香连翘汤　治小儿风热，毒肿，肿色白，或有恶核瘰疬，附骨痈疸，节解不举，白丹走竟身中，白疹瘙不已。　　青丁香　熏陆香　鸡舌香　沉香　麻黄　黄芩各六铢　大黄二两　麝香三铢　连翘　海藻　射干　升麻　枳实各半两　竹沥三合　　右十四味(口父)咀，以水四升，煮药减半，内竹沥，煮取一升二合，儿生百日至二百日，一服三合；二百日至期岁，一服五合。一方不用麻黄。[88p]

    Leolu Decoction
    Used for treating children with heat toxins, boils, rashes, and various skin eruptions.
    Ingredients: Leolu, Lianqiao, Baiwei, Bailian, Mangxiao (each 6 zhu), Dahuang (1 liang), Shengma, Zhishi, Mahuang, Huangqin (each 9 zhu).
    Prepare these ten ingredients by grinding them, then add 1.5 sheng of water and boil to extract 5 he. For children aged 1 to 7 days, take 1 he divided into three doses; for 8 to 15 days, take 1.5 he divided into three doses; for 16 to 20 days, take 2 he divided into three doses; for 21 to 30 days, take 3 he divided into three doses; for 31 to 40 days, take 5 he divided into three doses.

    Wuxiang Lianqiao Decoction
    Used for treating children with wind-heat, toxic swellings, white swelling, or possible恶核 (hot nodules), bone abscesses, joint swelling without mobility, and persistent white rashes.
    Ingredients: Qingdingxiang, Xunluxiang, Jishexiang, Chenxiang, Mahuang, Huangqin (each 6 zhu), Dahuang (2 liang), Musk (3 zhu), Lianqiao, Haizao, Shegan, Shengma, Zhishi (each 0.5 liang), Zhuli (3 he).
    Prepare these fourteen ingredients by grinding them, then add 4 sheng of water and boil until reduced by half, then add Zhuli and boil to extract 1.2 sheng. For children aged 100 to 200 days, take 3 he once; for 200 days to one year, take 5 he once. One variation of this decoction does not include Mahuang.[88p]

    　　连翘圆　治小儿无故寒热，强健如故，而身体颈项，结核瘰疬，及心腹胁背里有坚核不痛，名为结风气肿。　　连翘　桑白皮　白头翁　丹皮　防风　黄蘗　桂心　香豉　独活　秦艽各一两　海藻半两　　右十一味为末，蜜丸如小豆，三岁儿饮服五丸，加至十丸；五岁已上者，以意加之。
    　　五香枳实汤　治小儿暑风热，(疒咅)(疒畾)坚如麻豆粒，疮痒搔之皮剥汁出，或遍身头面，年年常发者。　　青木香九铢　麝香六铢　鸡舌香　熏陆香　沉香　防风　秦艽　漏芦各半两　升麻　黄芩　白敛　麻黄各一两　枳实一两半　大黄一两十八铢　　右十四味(口父)咀，以水五升，煮取一升八合，儿五六岁者，一服四五合；七八岁者，一服六合；十岁至十四五者，加大黄半两，足水为一斗，煮取二升半，分三服。[89p]

    Lianqiao Yuan: Treats children's unexplained fever and chill, making them as strong as before. If there are hard lumps in the neck, nodules or masses, or firm lumps in the stomach, flanks, or back that are not painful, this is called "Jiefeng Qizhong."

    Ingredients: Lianqiao, Sangbai Pi, Bai Touweng, Dan Pi, Fangfeng, Huangbai, Guixin, Xiangchi, Duhuo, Qinjiao, each one liang; Haizao, half a liang. Mix these eleven ingredients into a powder, then form into small bean-sized pills with honey. For a three-year-old, give five pills, increasing to ten; for those five years and older, adjust the quantity as desired.

    Wuxiang Zhi Shi Tang: Treats children's summer wind heat, with a hard, itchy rash like millet grains that can ooze when scratched, which may occur all over the body and face, recurring every year.

    Ingredients: Qingmuxiang, nine qian; Shexiang, six qian; Jieshexiang, Xunlu Xiang, Chenxiang, Fangfeng, Qinjiao, Loulu, each half a liang; Shengma, Huangqin, Bailian, Mahuang, each one liang; Zhishi, one and a half liang; Dahuang, one liang and eighteen qian.

    Prepare these fourteen ingredients by chewing and mixing with five sheng of water, boil down to one sheng and eight ge. For children aged five to six, give four to five ge; for seven to eight year-olds, give six ge; for those aged ten to fourteen or fifteen, add half a liang of Dahuang, use a dou of water, boil down to two and a half sheng, and divide into three doses.[89p]

    　　苦参汤　治小儿身上下百疮不瘥。
    　　苦参八两　地榆　黄连　王不留行　独活　艾叶各五两　竹叶二升　　右七味(口父)咀，以水三斗，煮取一斗，以浴儿疮上；浴讫，敷黄连散。
    　　枳实圆 【《千金方》】 　治小儿病风瘙，痒痛如疥，搔之汁出，遍身(疒咅)(疒畾)如麻粒，年年喜发，面目虚肥，手足干枯，毛发细黄，及肌肤不光泽，鼻气不利。此则少时热盛，赤体当风，风热相薄所得也。不早治之，成大风疾。　　枳实　菊花　蛇床子　防风　蒺藜子　白薇　浮萍各一两　天雄　麻黄　漏芦各半两　　右十味为末，蜜丸如大豆许，五岁儿饮服十丸，加至二十丸，日二。五岁已上者，随意加之。儿大者，可为散服。[90p]

    Ku Shen Decoction treats children with numerous sores on their bodies that do not heal.

    Ingredients: Ku Shen (bitter root) - 8 taels, Di Yu (ground catalpa) - 5 taels, Huang Lian (coptis) - 5 taels, Wang Bu Liu Xing (splendid sow thistle) - 5 taels, Du Huo (angelica pubescens) - 5 taels, Ai Ye (mugwort) - 5 taels, Zhu Ye (bamboo leaves) - 2 sheng.

    Combine these seven ingredients, grind them, and boil in three dou (units of water) to extract one dou. Use this to bathe the child’s sores; after bathing, apply Huang Lian powder.

    Zhi Shi Yuan treats children suffering from wind itch, characterized by intense itching and pain similar to scabies, with a discharge when scratched, and a body covered in small bumps. This condition recurs annually, with a pale and plump appearance, dry hands and feet, fine yellow hair, dull skin, and nasal congestion. This is caused by excessive heat during childhood, leading to wind-heat exposure. If not treated promptly, it will develop into a severe wind illness.

    Ingredients: Zhi Shi (bitter orange) - 1 tael, Ju Hua (chrysanthemum) - 1 tael, She Chuang Zi (hardy perennial) - 1 tael, Fang Feng (siler) - 1 tael, Ji Zhi Zi (spiny date) - 1 tael, Bai Wei (pokeroot) - 1 tael, Fu Ping (floating duckweed) - 1 tael, Tian Xiong (raspberry) - 0.5 tael, Ma Huang (ephedra) - 0.5 tael, Lou Lu (rush) - 0.5 tael.

    Grind these ten ingredients into a powder, mix with honey to form pills the size of large soybeans. For a five-year-old, administer ten pills, increasing to twenty pills, twice daily. For children older than five, adjust dosage as necessary. For older children, they can be taken as a powder.[90p]

    　　麻黄汤　治小儿丹肿，及风毒风疹。　　麻黄一两半　独活　射干　甘草　桂心　青木香　石膏　黄芩各一两　　右八味(口父)咀，以水四升，煮取一升，三岁儿分为四服，日再。　　又方　治小儿恶毒，丹毒，及风疹。　　麻黄　升麻　葛根各一雨　射干　鸡舌香　甘草各半两　石膏半合　　右七味(口父)咀，以水三升，煮取一升，三岁儿分三服，日三。
