    Ephedra Decoction: For treating children's red swellings, wind poison, and wind rashes.
    Ingredients: 1.5 taels of Ephedra, 1 tael each of Notopterygium, Belamcanda, Licorice, Cinnamon bark, Qinyu (Artemisia), Gypsum, and Huangqin (Scutellaria).
    Preparation: Crush the eight ingredients, add 4 sheng of water, boil down to 1 sheng. For a three-year-old child, divide into four doses, taken twice daily.

    Another Formula: For treating children's malignant toxins, red poison, and wind rashes.
    Ingredients: 1 tael each of Ephedra, Cimicifuga, and Kudzu root; 0.5 tael each of Belamcanda, Agarwood, and Licorice; 0.5 sheng of Gypsum.
    Preparation: Crush the seven ingredients, add 3 sheng of water, boil down to 1 sheng. For a three-year-old child, divide into three doses, taken three times a day.

    Tangent Decoction: For treating dozens of kinds of rashes in children.
    Ingredients: 1 tael each of Rhubarb, Licorice, Angelica, Ligusticum, White Atractylodes, Notopterygium, Huangqin, White Peony, Chuan Cimicifuga, Agarwood, Qinyu (Artemisia), and Magnolia bark; 3 taels of Glauber's salt.
    Preparation: Crush the thirteen ingredients, add 12 sheng of water, boil down to 4 sheng, remove the dregs and add Glauber's salt, soak with cotton in the decoction, warm it to alleviate coldness, and replace when dry, to promote healing.

    Zexlan Decoction: For treating red rashes and itchiness, which can cause harm internally.
    Ingredients: 12 coins each of Zexlan (Lycopus), Ligusticum, Aconite, Wild Atractylodes, Stalk, Manjingzi (Woolly Nightshade), and Asarum.
    Preparation: Crush the seven ingredients, add 3 sheng of water, boil down to 1.5 sheng, and divide into four doses. First administer this, then proceed with other treatments.[91p]

    Divine Efficacy Powder

    For treating sores and painful swellings: apply to those not yet formed to disperse, and to those already ulcerated to heal. Particularly effective for red tumors, though caution for pain from acupuncture should be taken.

    Ingredients: Huangbai (Phellodendron) fried, Cao Wu (Aconite) fried, Xue Jie (Dragon’s Blood), all equal parts.
    Prepare as a powder and apply with a liquid mixture to the affected area.

    Willow Flower Powder

    For treating heat toxins causing mouth sores.
    Ingredients: Huangbai (Phellodendron) fried, Puhuang (Typha), authentic Qingdai (Indigo), and white Caoyuan (Human Middle) calcined, all equal parts.
    Prepare as a powder and apply.

    Immortal's Life-Saving Decoction

    For treating all sores and toxins: internal consumption if not yet formed; once formed, induce drainage. This is the holy medicine for purging toxins, expelling pus, and relieving pain. If pus flows but swelling and pain persist, it indicates a deficiency of vital energy, which should be replenished.

    Ingredients: Pangolin, Bai Zhi (Angelica), Fang Feng (Siler), Myrrh, Licorice, Chi Shao (Red Peony), Gui Wei (Angelica Root), Frankincense, Flower Pollen, and Bei Mu (Fritillaria), each at 1 qian (about 3.3 grams); Jin Yin Hua (Honeysuckle) and Chen Pi (Dried Citrus Peel) at 3 qian (about 10 grams); Zao Jiao Ci (Soapberry Thorn) at 2 qian (about 6.6 grams).
    Take 2-3 qian of the mixture with half a cup each of wine and water, then boil.

    Yue Ju Pill

    For treating the stagnation of lactating mothers affecting children, symptoms may include chest fullness, sour vomiting, tooth pain, sores, and scabies.

    Ingredients: Cang Zhu (Atractylodes), Shēn Qū fried (Fermented Barley), Xiang Fu (Cyperus), Shan Zha (Hawthorn), Shan Zhi fried (Gardenia), Fu Ling (Poria), and Mai Ya (Barley Sprouts), all equal parts.
    Prepare as a powder, mix with water to form pills the size of sycamore seeds, taking 20-30 pills each time downed with white boiling soup, for both mother and child to take together.[92p]

    Divine Efficacy Angelica Ointment
    Treats wounds from falls, burns, etc., regardless of whether they are ruptured or not.
    Ingredients: Angelica, yellow wax, raw rehmannia, each one tael; sesame oil, six taels.
    Preparation: First, fry the angelica and rehmannia in the oil until black, remove residue, and melt in the wax. Allow to cool and stir until even to create the ointment.

    Divine Chuanxiong Pills
    Ingredients: Rhubarb, yellow qin, each two taels; talc, black swallowwort, each four taels; coptis, mint, Chuanxiong, each half tael.
    Preparation: Form into water pills the size of a walnut and take with water.

    Three Yellow Pills
    Ingredients: Rhubarb, yellow qin, coptis, each in equal parts.
    Preparation: Grind into powder, form into water pills, take thirty pills with water. An alternative: exclude yellow qin and use coptis instead.

    Regulating Center Pills
    Ingredients: Ginseng, white atractylodes, dried ginger, honey-fried licorice, prepared aconite, each one tael.
    Preparation: Grind into fine powder, refine with honey into pills, making ten pills for each two taels, the size of a marble. Take one pill with a cup of water, dissolved and boiled to seven tenths, slightly warm, and take on an empty stomach.

    Detoxifying Powder
    Use cold water stone, without measuring, and burn until red.
    Preparation: Grind into powder and mix with fresh water; use a chicken feather to sweep over the painful area.

    Three Sacred Powder
    Treats sores, carbuncles, and various other wounds.
    Ingredients: Green onion whites, amaranth, lime, each one jin.[93p]

    Cool Drink for Children (from The Confucian Family's Care for Parents)
    For treating children with rashes that appear during the month, with skin resembling red cinnabar.
    Ingredients: Dahuang (large yellow) steamed, Chishaoyao (red peony), Danggui (Chinese angelica), and Gancao (licorice) stir-fried, all in equal parts.
    Grind to a powder, take one to two qian (units of weight), boil with one cup of water until reduced to about 70%, strain and take warm after meals, adjusting according to symptoms.

    Dandelion Drink (from “Children's Medicine Explained,” the same below)
    For treating children's red engorgements, rashes with intense heat, urinary blockage, various sores and abscesses, red toxin, and umbilical wind.

    Xionghuang Detox Pill: Treats children's abscesses entering the abdomen, abdominal distension, difficulty in urination, or wheezing and convulsions. Ingredients: 2 qian of Xionghuang (arsenic sulfide), 2 qian of genuine Yujin (curcuma), 2 qian of Dahuang (rhubarb), and 1 qian of Badu (physostigma). Grind thoroughly and form into small bean-sized pills. Take 1-2 pills with warm tea. Note: One version does not include Dahuang.

    Baiduo Powder (from "Qixiao Liangfang"): Treats children's phlegm poison, early onset with wandering symptoms, dryness, distension, and crying. Ingredients: equal parts of Jiegeng (platycodon root), Huafen (pollen), dry Gegeng (pueraria), Chuan Shengma (cimicifuga), Chuan Xiang (ligusticum), Chi Shao (red peony), Duhuo (angelica), Chaihu (bupleurum), and Gan Cao (licorice). Grind and fragment each ingredient. Take 4 qian with 1 cup of water and 2 slices of ginger, decoct until it reduces to six parts, taken at any time.

    Tianwu Powder (from "Infant Hundred Questions"): Ingredients include Tian Nansheng (arum), Chi Xiaodou (red kidney bean), Caowu (aconite), and Huangbo (phellodendron). Grind to powder in equal parts, mix with fresh ginger juice, and apply to affected areas; using rice vinegar for mixing is even better.

    Qingdai Detox Pill: Ingredients include 8 liang each of Hanshuishi (cola stone) and Shigao (gypsum), and 4 liang of Qingdai (indigo). Grind to a fine powder, mix in the Qingdai, and use 7 steamed cakes with water to make pills the size of gorgon nuts. Each dose is one pill, taken after meals with freshly drawn water or chewed and taken with ginger soup. Suitable for all poisons. Also for children with convulsions, tidal fever, phlegm obstruction, restlessness in the chest, flushed cheeks, excessive thirst, and instability in sitting or lying down. For children around three years old, half a pill can be given, adjusting the dosage according to size.[97p]

    　　黑参剂　解诸般热，消疮疖。

    Black Ginseng Powder: This relieves various types of heat and eliminates sores and boils.

    Qinglu Drink: Treats back sores and all types of foul sores, especially those that do not open. Ingredients: Bai Ji (white rhatany), Bai Lian (white lotus), Bai Wei (white peony), Bai Zhi (white angelica), Bai Xian Pi (white lichen skin), (Shi Bu) Nitrate, Qing Dai (indigo), Huang Bo (golden thread), Da Huang (rhubarb), flower pollen, Qing Lu Ye (lotus leaves), Lao Long Pi (old pine bark). All in equal parts. Grind into fine powder, mix with natural juice from fresh ginger for application, leave a small opening; if dry, use fresh ginger juice to moisten again.

    Jing Du Yan Zi: Treats newly appearing sores and swellings; applying this will cause them to recede immediately, and if fully formed, it will quickly burst. Ingredients: Seven scallions with roots, seven Semen Strychni (wood oil), three fragrant Bai Zhi (white angelica), fourteen Ba Dou (horse chestnut), two ounces of Huang Dan (yellow lead), four ounces of oil. First, heat the oil with the first four ingredients over intense heat, stirring with a willow wood stick until the Bai Zhi is charred black. Strain through cotton to remove residue, then transfer to a pan, simmer on low heat, and incorporate Huang Dan until a purple-black paste forms. This treats various kinds of sores and swellings, removes pus, and closes sores.[99p]

    　　龙胆汤[100p]

    Title: Remedies for Various Swellings and Pain

    This section lists ingredients and their uses for treating various swellings and poison-related pain:

    • Ingredients: Puhuang (Cattail Pollen), Dahuang (Rhubarb), Huangbo (Huangbai), Zhenfen (True Powder), Lianqiao (Forsythia), Baizhi (Angelica Dahurica), Baiji (Bletilla), Bailian (White Pollen), Muli (Oyster Shell), Danshen (Salvia), mix these powders and apply them with water to the swollen area.

    Cooling Decoction for Treating Children's Heat Accumulation
    Used for children with excessive internal heat symptoms, such as irritability, thirst, dizziness, dry lips, swollen throat, closed throat, red eyes, nosebleeds, tight jaw and cheeks, mouth sores, phlegm accumulation, thick nasal discharge, restlessness during sleep, incoherent speech, dry and hard bowels, and reddish urine. Effective for all wind-related swellings.

    • Ingredients: Chuan Dahuang (Sichuan Rhubarb), Xiebai (Nitre), honey-fried Licorice (Gan Cao), each one liang; Lianqiao two liang; Guizhi (Gardenia Fruit), Huangqin (Scutellaria), and Bohe (Mint Leaves) after cleaning, each half liang.
    • Directions: Grind these ingredients into powder, take two qian (a small measurement), mix with half a cup of water, add seven slices of bamboo leaves, a little honey, boil down to a quarter, and consume warm after meals, adjusting dosage as needed.

    Cooling Drink

    • Ingredients: Dahuang, Lianqiao, Shaoyao (Peony), Qianghuo (Notopterygium), Danggui (Angelica Sinensis), Fangfeng (Siler), Licorice, and Shanzhizi (Gardenia Fruit) in equal parts.
    • Directions: Prepare this drink using one big qian per dose, half a cup of water, boil down to a third, strain, and consume at any time.

    Longdan Decoction[100p]

    　　龙胆草　钓藤　柴胡　黄芩　桔梗　芍药　茯苓各六铢　蜣螂二枚，去翅足　甘草六铢　大黄二两，煨，《直指》二钱半　　右十味(口父)咀，以水一升，煮取五合为剂也。服之如后节度药者，有虚实药宜足数合水也。儿生一日至七日，分一合为三服；儿生八日至十五日，分一合半为三服。以渐加服，皆得下即止，勿再服也。《直指方》为末，每服一钱，北枣煎服。或加防风、麦门冬以导心热，黄芩减半，去蜣螂亦可。

    Dragonwort, Diao vine, Chaihu, Huangqin, Jiegeng, Shaoyao, and Fuling, each six zhū; two cockroaches, with wings and legs removed; six zhū of licorice; and two taels of rhubarb, cooked; and 2.5 qian of "Zhi Zhi."

    These ten ingredients should be ground into a powder. Use one liter of water and boil down to five déciliters for dosage. If this is taken after the first adjustment period, in cases of deficiency or excess, adjust the water amount as needed. For infants, from day one to seven, divide into three doses from one déciliter; from day eight to fifteen, divide one and a half deciliters into three doses. Gradually increase the dosage and stop once the desired effect is achieved; do not take more. The "Zhi Zhi" powder should be taken in doses of one qian, prepared with boiled northern jujube. Additional ingredients like Fangfeng or Mai Men Dong may be added to guide excess heat to the heart, and reduce Huangqin by half, omitting the cockroach is also fine.

    Da Sheng San treats scrofula, dispels wind toxin swelling, counters internal heat blockage, and is effective against conditions associated with rash and hives, which can arise from poor diet.

    Two taels of oyster shell, calcined to powder; one tael of black ginseng; and half a tael of licorice. Grind these into a powder; for each dose, take two qian, mixed with clear tea.

    Bai Ji Powder: Treats the discharge of pus from scrofula.

    Ge Gen and Ju Pi Decoction: Treats winter warm disease not fully developed, spring cold accumulation causing obstruction, unable to vent. When the weather becomes warm, the warmth and toxicity begin to rise, leading to mottled rashes and itching on the skin, coughing with a feeling of oppression, and vomiting clear fluid. Taking this medicine will alleviate symptoms. Also treats children's measles.
    Ge Gen, Chen Pi, peeled Xinning (apricot) kernels, Ma Huang (without root segments), Zhi Mu, Huang Qin, and Gan Cao, each half a tael. Grind and prepare decoction with plain water. If there is heat and no vomiting, remove Chen Pi. For cold symptoms, omit Huang Qin and Zhi Mu.

    Huang Lian and Ju Pi Decoction: Treats warm toxin rashes, also addresses urinary conditions and diarrhea, including blood issues.
    Huang Lian one tael; Chen Pi, peeled Xinning kernels, Zhi Shi (fried), Ma Huang (fried and root segments removed), and dry Ge Gen each half a tael; Hou Po and roasted Gan Cao each one and a half coins. Grind into powder, take two coins per dose, decoct with plain water. Also treats thirst. Can omit Hou Po and Gan Cao.

    Yuan Shen and Sheng Ma Decoction: Treats febrile diseases after sweating, vomiting, and purging, where toxic substances do not dissipate, with surface deficiency and internal excess. Heat manifests externally, resulting in mottled skin, and if severe, leads to agitation and delirium, also treating throat swelling and pain.
    Yuan Shen, Sheng Ma, and roasted Gan Cao, each half a tael.[102p]

    Hua Ban decoction:
    Ginseng, gypsum, wilted herb, anemarrhena, and licorice, each two and a half qian. Grind into a powder, take two qian with one bowl of water, adding half a cup of glutinous rice, simmer to six parts, until the rice is cooked, then take warm.

    Ge Gen Bai Zhu powder: Treats chapped skin and toxic swelling.
    Bai zhu, two and a half qian; Fu ling, two qian; Mu xiang and licorice, each two qian; Shao yao and Ge gen, each three qian; Zhi ke, stir-fried, two and a half qian. Grind into a powder, take three qian with one bowl of water, simmer to seven parts, strain and take hot.

    Xin Xiong powder: Treats red swelling, do not take cold medicine.
    Fu ling, Bai zhu, ginseng, licorice, Zhi ke, Xi xin, and Chuan xiong, each in equal parts. Grind into a powder, take three qian with one bowl of water, simmer to seven parts, strain and take hot.

Grind into a powder, take two qian, simmer with fresh ginger and mint. Add Di gu pi and Tian ma; or, if needed, add cicada molting and Fang feng. For treating shock fever, add Shao yao, Gan ge, and Huang qin. If there is no sweating, add Ma huang.[103p]

    Fangji San treats the symptoms of dan toxin. It is caused by the heat toxin that clashes with the blood, and the wind energy takes advantage of this, resulting in redness, swelling, and a wandering rash all over the body, also known as "red wandering wind." If it enters the abdomen or kidneys, it can be fatal.
    Ingredients:

    • Han Fangji: 5 grams
    • (Shibu) Nitre
    • Rhino Horn
    • Huangqin (Scutellaria)
    • Huangqi (Astragalus)
    • Chuan Shengma: 5 grams each
      Grind these into a powder, brew with bamboo leaves, and adjust the quantity according to the severity of the illness. In one recipe, remove (Shibu) nitre and add Ze Xie.

    Baiyu San treats red wandering dan toxin.
    Ingredients:

    • Talc: 30 grams
    • Cold Water Stone: 30 grams
      Grind into a powder, mix with rice vinegar and apply to the affected area; if the swelling extends to the outer kidney and has ruptured, use only water for mixing.

    Xiao Du Yin treats the dan toxin after pox has broken out, with toxic qi causing blockage, resulting in severe heat and agitation, disturbed sleep, constipation with hard stools, sore throat, and chest oppression. After the rashes have burst, this can be taken.
    Ingredients:

    • Roasted Burdock Seed: 60 grams
    • Jin Jie (Schizonepeta) spikes: 15 grams
    • Roasted Licorice: 15 grams
      Grind these into a powder, boil with water, and this can help with constipation and unbroken pox, but should not be taken lightly. Alternatively, add Fangfeng (Siler), Lianqiao (Forsythia), Shengma (Cimicifuga), Chen Tui (Cicada Slough), and Chi Shaoyao (Red Peony). If there is heat, add Huangqin and Fangfeng along with Rhino Horn for the detoxifying drink.[104p]

    Jinhua San: For treating dry and wet sores and ringworm.
    One tael of yellow lead calcined, one qian of fine powder, half a tael each of goldthread and coptis, a small amount of musk. Grind these into a powder. First, wash the affected area, then apply the powder. For dry ringworm, mix with pork fat from the twelfth month; if unavailable, use sesame oil. You may also add scutellaria and rhubarb.

    Mofen Gao: For treating generalized scabies and itching in children.
    One qian each of bitter sophora, pitch, crow's foot, and yellow wax; three grains of hemp seed; five fen of fine powder; two whole scorpions; half a tael of pure sesame oil. Cook the ingredients in sesame oil until the hemp seed is charred, then filter out the solids, mix with fine powder, and apply to the sores. For severe ringworm, using the root of purple bellflower and a little raw alum, pound them to a paste and apply to the affected area, which can resolve the issue in two applications. Another method is to use a small amount of arsenic, mix with vinegar and simmer into a paste and apply. Additionally, take a spotted cat, remove its head and feet, fry glutinous rice until golden, boil it with Chinese jujube, remove the skin and form the meat into pills, and apply with saliva for especially good results.[105p]

    　　羌活散

    Taiyi Purple Gold Elixir

Only the superior form is chosen, with the root removed and thoroughly cleaned and dried into a powder, one tael and five qian.     小儿急慢惊风，五疳五痢，脾病黄肿，瘾疹疮瘤，牙关紧闭，并用薄荷浸水磨浓，加蜜服之，仍搽肿上。年岁幼者，每锭分作数服。牙痛者磨涂痛上，仍含少许，良久咽下。小儿父母遗毒，生下百日内皮塌烂斑，谷道眼眶损烂者，俱用清水磨涂。打扑伤损，松节无灰酒研服。年深月近头胀头疼，太阳痛，作偏头风，及时疮愈后，毒气攻注，脑门作胀者，俱用葱酒研服一锭，仍磨涂太阳穴上。妇女经水不通，红花汤下。凡遇天行疫证，延街及巷，相传遍染者，用桃根汤磨浓，擦入鼻孔，次服少许，任入病家，再不传染。又治传尸劳瘵，诸药不能禁忌，一方士指教服此，每早磨服一锭，至三次后，逐下恶物尸虫异形怪类，后得脱利，以此相传，活人不计其数。一女子久患劳瘵，为尸虫所噬，磨服一锭，片时吐下小虫十余条，后服苏合香丸，其病顿失，调理月余而愈。真济世卫身之宝药也！[115p]

    For children suffering from acute or chronic convulsions, five types of sores and dysentery, spleen disease with yellow swelling, rashes, and tumors, and when teeth are clenched, use peppermint soaked in water, ground to a paste, mixed with honey, and take it. For toothache, grind it and apply it to the painful area, and hold a little in the mouth for a while before swallowing. If an infant shows signs of inherited toxins, with skin peeling and spots within a hundred days of birth, or if the mouth or eyes are damaged, use clear water to grind and apply. For injuries from falls, use turpentine mixed with ashless wine to take. Those suffering from prolonged headaches or discomfort at the temples due to lingering toxicity after a rash should take a ground dose and apply it to the temples. For women with menstrual blockages, use safflower soup. In the case of widespread infectious diseases, where an epidemic has spread through streets and alleys, use peach root soup, ground to a paste, and rub it into the nostrils, also taking a small amount to ensure it reaches the sick without spreading further. This also treats wasting diseases when other medicines fail. A certain healer recommended it; take one dose every morning, and after three doses, expel harmful substances and irregular forms from the body, thus achieving relief and restoring health—countless lives have been saved this way. One woman, suffering for a long time from a wasting disease caused by parasitic worms, took a dose, and shortly afterward expelled over ten small worms.     Golden Key
    In the golden key, use fire nitrate, with pieces of silkworm, real musk, and realgar added. Borax enhances its effect, instantly relieving throat swelling and pain. It treats throat obstructions, wind in the throat, phlegm and saliva blockage, and difficulty swallowing.
    Ingredients:

    • Fire nitrate: 1.5 taels
    • Borax: 0.5 taels
    • Real musk: 0.1 taels
    • White silkworm: 0.1 taels
    • Realgar: 0.2 taels
      Grind each separately into a powder and mix. Use a bamboo tube to blow the mixture into the affected area; phlegm and saliva will be expelled. If phlegm is expelled but swelling and pain persist, apply a needle to the affected area to remove bad blood and take decoction.

    Human Yellow
    Treats various poisons in children, black pit caused by smallpox, dry lips and mouth, wind-heat rash, and redness; it is effective in all cases. For the preparation: take a section of bamboo with nodes on both ends; drill a small hole on one end. Grind powdered grass into fine powder, fill the hole, then seal it tightly with a wooden strip and weigh it down with a brick. Submerge it in a latrine for half a year. Afterward, take it out and soak it in running water for one day, then dry it with bamboo and store it in a magnetic jar. Take three to four fen mixed with cool water. For poisonous rashes, mix with Earth Poria Soup. For regular heat illnesses, incorporate it into the relevant medicinal decoction for immediate effect.[117p]

    Barley Powder

    Barley powder treats smallpox and wind sores; sulfur and human trust must be balanced. Sichuan pepper, whether fresh or dry alum, mix with sesame oil for natural application. It treats itching from children's smallpox, which clusters in patches, and can lead to insensitivity to pain.

    One sheng of wheat, toasted until yellow, is placed in a bowl while hot.

    Four liang of sulfur; one liang of white arsenic.

    First, grind the sulfur and arsenic into a fine powder, mixing them with the hot wheat in the bowl until even. Allow to cool, then add half a jin of gum, three liang of Sichuan pepper, and two liang each of fresh and dry alum, and grind to a fine powder. When used, wash with scallion soup and mix with sesame oil for application, cover with oiled paper, and change every three days; three applications lead to recovery.

    Purple Snow
    Purple Snow consists of rhinoceros horn and antelope horn with Shengma (Cimicifuga), cold water, and gypsum, along with Yuanshen (Scrophularia), sandalwood, and licorice. For children with severe red measles, especially when the poison penetrates inward, causing an enlarged abdomen and difficulty breathing or nursing, this remedy is essential. It also treats typhoid fever, irritability, mania, and all kinds of internal poison, with symptoms like restlessness, dry mouth, and confusion.
    Ingredients: Shengma, cold water stone, gypsum, rhinoceros horn, antelope horn - each 1 liang; Yuanshen - 2 liang; sandalwood, wood fragrance - each 5 qian; Licorice - 8 qian; Water - 5 bowls.
    Preparation: Boil the ingredients until reduced to 1 bowl, filter and boil again, then add 3 liang of large qian (niter). Simmer on low heat until the moisture is nearly gone, when it begins to thicken, pour into a bowl, add 2 qian of cinnabar, 2 qian of borneol, and 100 pieces of gold leaf, thoroughly mixing them. Let it cool in water until it solidifies like snow. Adults take 1 qian, children 2 fen, those around 10 years take 5 fen; swallow slowly for effect. For severe cases, an additional qian may be added. Alternatively, dissolve in light bamboo leaf lantern wick soup.[119p]

    Medicinal powder "Five Spirits Powder" treats widespread sores in children. Generally, if parents have a history of sores, their children rarely escape; from head to heel, there is almost no intact skin. Real zinc sulfate treats tendons and nourishes the liver, its color green, corresponding to the East (wood). True cinnabar nourishes blood and benefits the heart, its color red, corresponding to the South (fire). Real orpiment promotes flesh growth and nourishes the spleen, its color yellow, corresponding to the Center (earth). Real alum regulates fat and assists the lungs, its color white, corresponding to the West (metal). Real magnetite nourishes bones and strengthens the kidneys, its color black, corresponding to the North (water).

    This formula is found in "Jiao's Notes," regrettably using mercury only as a last resort, inefficiently without water. Therefore, add one tael of mercury, equal parts of the five flavors, mix into Yangcheng clay, burn thrice, then remove, adding it into the medicinal application, and the efficacy is miraculous.[126p]

    Effective Medicinal Formula

    Ingredients:

    • 5 qian of pearl
    • 1 qian of ice flakes
    • Dried white night-blooming flowers
    • Elephant skin roasted with yellow sand, wait until soft and slice, then roast again until crisp, grind
    • Blood myrrh, fragrant wood, roasted and ground
    • Frankincense, myrrh, each with oil removed
    • Flower stamen stone
    • Child tea steamed
    • Red galls, half-baked, each weighing 1 liang

    Preparation:
    All the above ingredients should be finely powdered. Mix with 8 qian of white that has been ground evenly, finally adding ice flakes.

    Usage:

    • For removing corruption, add 2 qian of Wuling powder for every 2 liang.
    • To promote skin regeneration, add 3 or 5 fen of the previous powder for every 2 liang; for conditions like post-pox fluid discharge or ulcers, just add 2 or 3 fen.
    • For treating burns from hot water or fire, add 2 qian of finely ground cotton ash for every 2 liang, and use Liang’s powder and yellow ashes each about 5 or 6 qian; this can be mixed dry or with fragrant oil for application.[127p]

    　　四黄散 【《证治准绳》，下同】 　治小儿身上一切热毒疮疾燥痒，抓破有汁不干。　　净黄连　黄蘗　黄芩　大黄　滑石各半两　五倍子去虫屑，二钱半　　右銼晒为末，用清油和调二钱至三钱，涂搽患处，仍服四顺散消毒饮。

    Si Huang San
    For treating all heat and toxin sores and itchy skin conditions on children, that exude juices and do not dry when scratched:

    Yi Mo Jin
    For treating children with sores all over the body that are ulcerated and painful, with pus that does not dry:
    Lilu, washed and roasted; Shechuangzi; Hongdan, water-floated, each five qian; Sulfur; Chishizhi; Mingfan, fire-floated; Wubeizi, prepared and cleaned; Huangbo, cleaned of rough skin, each two and a half qian; Qingfen, fifty shan.
    The first eight ingredients can be either sun-dried or roasted into a powder. Then mix with the Qingfen in a mortar, combine with fresh fat from a pig, and pound it all together. Apply to the affected area, or use clear oil for mixing and applying if preferred.[128p]

    　　解表消毒饮　治小儿疮疡，肿高焮痛，便利调和，脉浮而洪，有表证者，用之。　　黄芪上部酒炒，中部泔炒，下部盐水炒，一钱半　葛根　升麻　赤芍药　元参　牛蒡子炒　麻黄去根节　甘草各五分　连翘一钱更看是何经分野，加引经药；手少阴加细幸三分，足少阴加独活七分，手太阴加桔梗、白芷各五分，足太阴加苍朮七分，手厥阴加柴胡七分，足厥阴加柴胡、青皮各五分，手太阳加槁本五分，足太阳加羌活七分，手阳明加白芷五分，足阳明加升麻、葛根各七分，手足少阳加柴胡七分。　　水一锺，生姜三片，葱白一根，煎七分，温服，不拘时。[129p]

    Jie Biao Xiao Du Yin treats children's sores and swellings, which are elevated and painful. It is suitable for regulating and harmonizing when the pulse is floating and large, and there are exterior symptoms.

    Disinfecting Drink for Internal Attacks
    To treat children with severe abscesses, swelling, hardness, and pain, who have constipation, with a deep and solid pulse indicating internal symptoms, use the following:

    • Scrape and finely chop three qian of the whole fruit of the gourd
    • One qian each of forsythia, burdock seed, angelica, and white peony
    • One and a half qian of rhubarb
    • Five fen of mirabilite
    • Seven fen of licorice

    Combine these with one zhong of water and decoct until reduced to seven parts. Take warm; if no effect, take again.

    Forsythia Powder
    For treating boils and sores:

    • One qian of forsythia
    • Half a liang each of agarwood and astragalus
    • One fen each of white lead and (stone) nitre
    • Prepared rhubarb and licorice

    Crush into a coarse powder. Each dose is one qian mixed with one sheng of water, add one qian of musk, decoct for five minutes, strain, cool, and take after meals.

    Parasitic Powder
    For severe toxic swellings:

    • One liang each of mulberry parasite, angelica, and rhubarb
    • Half a liang each of rhinoceros horn shavings, (stone) nitre, and licorice

    Crush and sift into a fine powder. Each dose is one qian mixed with one sheng of water, decoct for five minutes, strain, cool, and take according to the child's size.

    The above remedies for dispersing exterior symptoms and addressing internal issues are designed for swellings and abscesses accompanied by internal conditions; do not rigidly adhere to these for ulcers.[130p]

    Shenxiaojiedu San treats all initial sore toxins; swelling will dissipate, and if already ulcerated yet still swollen, it will disperse; if the ulcer is present but the toxin not resolved, it will heal.

    　　发背痈疖方　治阴疮头平向内者，服之即突出，其功效不可尽述。若小儿痘疮黑陷者，止一服而起，万不失一。　　羌活一两　穿山甲炒焦，半两　麝香少许　生人骨煅存性，半两　　右末，煎麻黄薄荷酒调。

    Prescription for Furuncle and Boils:

    For treating inward-turned heads of yin sores, take this remedy, and it will immediately protrude; its efficacy cannot be fully described. If a child has smallpox with black depressions, one dose alone will suffice, with success guaranteed.

    Ingredients:

    • Qianghuo (1 tael)
    • Fried pangolin (1/2 tael)
    • A small amount of musk
    • Calcinated human bone (1/2 tael)

    Grind these finely and decoct with a mixture of ephedra and mint wine.

    Rhinoceros Horn Disinfecting Pill:

    For treating accumulated heat and sores that arise after smallpox, due to residual toxins. Ingredients:

    • Raw Rehmannia
    • Siler
    • Angelica sinensis
    • Shavings of rhinoceros horn (each 1 tael)
    • Stir-fried burdock
    • Red peony
    • Forsythia
    • Platycodon (each 7 qian)
    • Mint
    • Yellow bore (root)
    • Licorice (each 5 qian)

    Grind these into a powder and refine with honey into pills the size of a gourd seed. Take one pill with mint tea to digest.

    Note: The above formula may deplete the middle qi and harm yin blood. If the patient is robust, with strong spleen and stomach, it may be used cautiously. However, children, due to their tender and delicate constitution, may not withstand this. As the classics say: "Qi governs the expulsion, blood governs nourishment." Qi is the fundamental energy that harmonizes the stomach. If the stomach qi is compromised, it cannot dispel or dissipate. If pus has formed, it may not rupture; if it has ruptured, it may not regenerate flesh or converge. Therefore, it is hard to treat and may even lead to serious consequences, so caution is essential![132p]

    　　托里消毒散　治胃经虚弱，或因克伐，致疮不能溃散，疮未成即消，已成即溃，腐肉自去，新肉自生。　　人参　黄芪　当归酒拌　川芎　芍药炒　白朮炒　茯苓各一钱　金银花　香白芷　甘草炙　连翘各五分　　右作二剂，水煎，徐徐服。

    Grind the above into powder and mix with water for topical application around the area. The previous formula is a cold, heat-clearing and astringent remedy. There are also those using white astringent, smartweed root, cold water silicate, star flower powder, cocklebur, honeysuckle, banana plant, red adzuki bean, as well as those using black and white angelica and similar herbs, all regardless of their cold, hot, warm, or cool nature. The Inner Canon states: If swelling comes first and then pain, this is caused by an injury to qi; if pain comes first and then swelling, this is due to an injury to the body. It also states: Disharmony among the five organs leads to obstruction of the nine orifices, and disharmony in the six directions leads to the formation of abscesses. The Essentials of Surgery states that sores that are high and soft arise from the blood vessels; swelling that is low and hard arises from the sinews; if the flesh color does not change, it arises from the bone marrow.[134p]

    盖必有诸中而形诸外，故受证之经，与所患之位，各有不同，竟宜一概外敷凉药？惟脾胃无亏，血气不和者，庶几有效。若服化毒之类，脾胃复伤，血气凝滞，亦不能消矣。至如疔疮之类，正欲宣拔其毒，若复用前药，肌肉受寒，血气凝滞，必致毒气入内而不救，治法必察其肿之高漫、色之赤白、痛之微甚、作脓之难易、出脓之稠薄、生肌之迟速，以别其属阴属阳，或半阴半阳，或纯阴纯阳，而用相宜之药以凉之、热之、和之；又当审受证之传变，五脏之相胜，而以调补脾胃为主，庶不致变恶证也。

    There must be an internal aspect that manifests externally; hence, the sutras concerning what is experienced and the location of affliction are distinct, making it improper to universally apply external cooling medicines. Only when the spleen and stomach are intact, and blood and qi are harmonious, might they be effective. If one takes detoxifying medicines that injure the spleen and stomach, causing stagnation of blood and qi, they cannot dispel toxins. For conditions like abscesses, the intent is to expel the poison; however, if previous medicines are used again, cold will damage the muscles, and blood and qi will stagnate, leading to internal poison that is beyond remedy. The treatment must carefully consider the height and extent of swelling, color (whether red or white), the severity of pain, the ease or difficulty of pus formation, the thickness of pus output, and the speed of new tissue growth to determine its nature as yin or yang, or a mix of both. Appropriate medicines should be used to cool, heat, or harmonize as needed. One should also examine the transmission of symptoms and the interactions of the five organs, with a focus on nourishing the spleen and stomach to avoid worsening the condition.

    Red Root Powder
    Used to treat eruptions and itching all over the body due to the conflict of blood heat and wind heat, which do not subside over time.
    Two taels of red root, three qian of licorice; crush these. For each dose, take two qian with a cup of rice wine, simmer until reduced to seven parts, take warm at any time. If not drinking wine, replace it with a bowl of water, adding one large spoon of wine, and simmer together to take.

    Guaranteed Effective Prescription
    This is the prescribed formula from the eminent Zen Master Wen You of Quanzhou. It treats children's skin on the head and face, which suddenly develops sores, burns, or red rashes, appearing as raised red swellings with tiny sores, and red halos with sores that begin like coins and gradually expand one or two feet, spreading over the body for a long time. When it reaches the internal organs, it becomes critical. This condition is to be feared; treat it swiftly, as it arises from accumulated heat.
    One to half a tael of licorice; crush it and put it in one or half a cup of water, simmer to make a warm decoction. Let the nursing mother take it into her mouth, swish, and slowly spit it out, applying it to the diseased area with the palm of the hand, avoiding the fingernails. Also, give the child licorice decoction to drink. Within a week, it should not expand any further; if needed, reapply, and it will heal with three applications.[140p]

    The text describes various medicinal preparations for treating infants with skin issues characterized by redness, heat, and swelling.

    1. Dan Shen Powder - Used for treating red patches on the skin of infants, especially on the cheeks, around the mouth, or under the eyes, which resemble rouge and have starting skin peeling. This condition is attributed to the condensing of blood due to excess heart heat. The method involves using a small knife to lightly puncture the skin to release blood, followed by administering the herbal remedy. The ingredients are:

      • Dan Shen (Salvia miltiorrhiza)
      • Huang Qin (Scutellaria baicalensis)
      • Zhi Ke (bitter orange) fried
      • Ge Gen (Pueraria lobata)
      • Xi Jiao (horn powder)
        Each ingredient is one part, with half a liang of Ma Huang (ephedra) after removing roots and joints.
        Grind these into a fine powder. For each dose of one qian, mix with a small cup of water, add ten bamboo leaves, and half a qian of bamboo shavings, boil for five minutes, strain, let it cool, and adjust the dosage according to the child's needs. Administer at any time.

    2. Mai Men Dong Powder - For treating infants with red spots on the skin, accompanied by restlessness and heat. The ingredients are:

      • Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon japonicus)
      • Lu Gen (Phragmites communis) shredded
      • Ge Gen (Pueraria lobata) shredded
      • Xi Jiao (horn powder)
      • Lou Lu (a type of firewort)
      • Gan Cao (licorice) lightly roasted until red, each of half a liang.
        Grind these into a fine powder. For each dose of one qian, mix with a cup of water, add ten bamboo leaves, strain, let it cool, and adjust the dosage according to the child's needs. Administer at any time.

    3. Lead Frost Powder - For treating infants with redness on the skin, possible swelling or fiery lesions, accompanied by thirst and general heat. The ingredients are:

      • Lead frost powder
      • Mung bean powder, each half a liang.
        Mix these with natural juice from rapeseed (canola) for topical application.[147p]

    Rhinoceros horn powder for treating children's red rashes with red, swollen patches of skin, caused by wind and heat, is recommended:

    Shengma Ointment is used to treat red toxins that swell and form patches on the heads, faces, and bodies of children. The prescription is as follows:

    • 1 tael of Shengma
    • Half tael each of rhinoceros horn shavings, bulbus, red peony, radix ginseng, yellow root, gardenia seeds, rhubarb, pure indigo, and blue cohosh
    • 2 taels of raw rehmannia

    Grind the above ingredients together. Using 1.5 jin of pig fat, slowly cook in a pan over low heat, stirring continuously until the color changes and a thick ointment forms. Strain out the residue and store it in a ceramic box. Apply frequently to the swollen areas.

    Another prescription:

    • Half tael each of berberine powder, powdered rhubarb, and powdered ammonium (cooked alum)
    • 1 fen each of herbaceous peony and mercury

    Grind the mercury in the palm until it becomes fine. Take three eggs, shell removed. Grind everything together to form an ointment, first puncturing it with a beryllium needle, and then apply the ointment.

    Another prescription:

    • Half tael each of cock's comb flower, persimmon vine, purple gromwell, and powdered rhubarb

    Grind these into a fine powder, then mix with egg white and raw oil in equal parts to create an ointment. Apply, allow to dry, and then apply again.

    Another prescription:

    • Half tael of peeled and navel-less aconite
    • Half tael of Sichuan pepper, with seeds removed
    • 3 fen of rock salt

    Grind these into a fine powder and mix with 4 taels of rendered pig fat. Cook slowly over low heat to form an ointment, store it in a ceramic box, and apply frequently until healed.[149p]

    Yujin Powder treats游肿 (edema) and head and face conditions with swelling, redness, heat, and pain. It is advisable to use this.

    Ingredients:

    • 0.25 taels of Sichuan yujin
    • 1 he (about 0.1 liter) of red bean
    • 0.25 taels of sweet tianli
    • 2 taels of fulong liver
    • 0.25 taels of Sichuan mangxiao
    • 0.25 taels of raw Sichuan da huang

    Grind these into a powder, mix with raw egg white and a small amount of honey to achieve the desired consistency, apply it, and dry before reapplying.

    Another formula for treating red edema:

    • 2 taels of Sichuan da huang powder
    • 5 taels of huohua grass

    Combine and pound them together, apply, and dry easily.

    Another formula for treating both red and white edema:

    • 0.5 he of mustard seed
    • 1 qian of salt
    • 1 eggshell of rice vinegar

    Pound into a paste, apply on paper, and stick it where necessary. If swelling occurs, apply as needed, with effects noticeable within three days.

    Another formula for treating green, white, and red edema with slight pain in the hands:

    • 2 taels each of raw Sichuan da huang, puluang, and fulong liver

    Grind into a fine powder, mix with water to a thin paste, apply, and dry before reusing.

    Another formula:

    • 1 tael of Sichuan da huang
    • 1 he of fermented soybeans
    • 1 tael of purple sandalwood

    Grind into powder, mix with vinegar for application, and dry before reusing.

    Another formula for treating extensive edema with a reddish appearance, which can lead to death if it invades the abdomen, is to apply raw pig meat to the affected area, changing it frequently, as the meat will not be eaten by pests due to its strong odor.

    For this treatment:

    • 2 taels of purple sandalwood

    Grind into a powder, mix with water for application.[150p]

    Translation:

    Infants and young children with red and swollen bellies caused by the intake of poisonous substances should not be treated. For this condition, mix three parts each of roasted Ephedra and Cimicifuga, and four parts of nitre. Grind into a fine powder, and take one small spoonful with well water three times a day. If necessary, add half a part of rhubarb.

    The Liu family’s prescription treats the ill effects of a runaway horse, causing redness and swelling; if it enters the heart and abdomen, it is not recoverable. Take a handful of fresh Sophora japonica leaves, mash them with the skin removed from fresh Trichosanthes fruit, and add three parts of ground red beans. Mix together and apply to the affected area for miraculous results.

    Dragon Flight Life-Saving Pill: This treats sores, toxins, back sores, and brain abscesses. Use dry toad venom, alcohol-soluble powder, burnt white alum, cold water rock, blue copper carbonate, frankincense, myrrh, musk, and vermilion, each six coins. Use forty snails, ground separately, if available. Grind all ingredients, mix with toad venom and snails, and optionally add a little alcohol. Form into round pills about the size of mung beans, taking one or two with warm wine or scallion soup. For severe cases, apply externally using garlic moxibustion.

    Ventilating Powder: This treats toxic heat pain, and throat discomfort, and aims to release the toxins through sneezing. Use one part each of Corydalis, Glycyrrhiza uralensis (licorice), and Ligusticum chuanxiong, and five parts of Rhizoma Veratri (false hellebore), and three parts of Rhododendron flowers. Grind into a fine powder, dip a piece of paper in a little, and apply it to the nose to induce sneezing for effect.[151p]

    Here is the translated text:

    For the treatment, grind the burnt ash finely and mix it with water from beneath the rice stalks for application.

    Huanglian Powder: Treats children's flesh-eating sores. Initially, on the first day, the affected area changes color; by the second day, blisters and pus appear. If they expand and turn red, especially if the blisters spread all over the body, it becomes untreatable, resembling burns from fire. This should be used promptly.
    Ingredients: Huanglian powder and Hu powder, each one tael.
    Grind them thoroughly and mix with raw oil for application.

    Jin Yin Sores Decoction: Treats small sores on children's bodies that begin very small but produce pus and continue to grow—known as Jin Yin sores. If these start from the limbs and progress towards the head and face, they are difficult to treat.
    Ingredients: One three-inch long crucian carp and one cup of fermented soybeans.
    Pound them together to a paste for application. Can also be used for saddle sores.

    Another formula:
    Ingredients: One tael of bitter melon; half a tael of snake shed; half a tael of slightly roasted wasp nest; and dust from the beams.
    Grind into a powder and mix with oil for application.

    Another formula:
    Ingredients: Three parts of dried dragon liver and three parts of scattered hair, burned.
    Grind into powder and mix with pig fat for application.

    Yuan Shen Decoction: Treats scrofula and painful lumps on the head.
    Ingredients: Five qian of Yuan Shen and Chuan Sheng Ma; Chuan Wu, roasted, skins and navel removed; Cao Wu, roasted, skins removed; Dang Gui, washed with wine; Chuan Xiong; Chi Ge; raw dried Di Huang; Chi Shao Yao, each two and a half qian; three qian of Gan Cao; and four qian of Da Huang, half raw and half roasted.
    Grind, and take two qian each time with one cup of water, add two slices of ginger, and decoct until reduced by a third. Take warm, without specific timing.[155p]

    Yin Zhen Fang: For treating adult and child rash that can be fatal when it enters the abdomen.

    • Radish seeds, powdered
    • Mix with wine, 9 grams for adults, adjust for children.

    Lian Qiao Fang Feng Decoction: Treats children's liver and spleen, for wind-heat toxin with sores on the head and face.     He Gan Bu Pi Decoction: Treats wind-heat rashes, with spleen deficiency and excessive liver.     San Huang San: Treats wind-heat dysentery leading to sores, with soaked, oozing, and rotten areas.     Yangxin Decoction: This treats insufficient heart qi, with internal heat rising and causing sores and ulcers. Ingredients include: 3 qian each of fried Astragalus, white Poria, Banxia, Angelica, Chuanxiong, dried ginger, Baihei, fried jujube seed, five-flavor crushed herb, and ginseng; 4 qian of fried Licorice.     Niu Huang Jie Du San: This treats congenital toxins causing skin lesions on the head and face, or extending throughout the body, with itching pain and unhealed sores. Ingredients include: 1 liang of raw Licorice, 5 qian of Niu Huang (cattle bile), essential for those with rich diets; 1 liang of honeysuckle. Grind into powder, and take 2 to 3 fen mixed with milk; or prepare into pills with Licorice syrup, the size of a fox nut, to be taken in warm water. External application of Qingjin powder is also viable.

    Bo Du San: This treats similar conditions, along with scabies, leprosy, and ringworm. Ingredients include: Huangqin, Huanglian, and white alum, each 5 qian; pine resin and realgar, each 5 qian; copper green, 2 qian, adding more if itching is severe. Grind them separately, and dust the affected area, or mix with oil for application. For scabies, add 3 qian of dried alum.

    Another formula: 5 qian each of Chuanxiong, wine-prepared Huangqin, wine-prepared Shaoyao, and Chenpi; 1 liang each of wine-prepared Baizhu and wine-prepared Danggui; 7.5 qian each of wine-prepared Tianma and Cang'erzi; 3 qian each of wine-prepared Huanglian, Fangfeng, and wine-prepared Fencha. Chop these ingredients and decoct, taking 4 or 5 doses, ideally before sleeping.[166p]

    Head Sore Powder
    Pig oil one qian, half raw and half cooked; realgar and mercury each two and a half qian. Grind and mix evenly, then apply to the sore.

    Treatment for Scalp Leprosy
    Mastic one liang, dry and melted, placed on a stone, wait for it to cool and then lift, gently grind fine. Black hairs that hang like dust from the roof; yellow earth, both three qian; white angelica half a liang; pine bark ash preserved; mercury, realgar, and white alum each two qian. Grind into a powder, mix with blood and cook in fragrant oil until soft, then apply to the affected area.
    Qingjin Powder
    For treating children's scabies and skin eruptions, which may spread all over, causing itching and oozing, unhealed for years.
    Mastic two liang, real clam powder five qian, indigo two qian and five fen. Grind into a powder, use candle oil to mix and apply, or apply dry. Alternatively, add light powder and dried alum each three qian, particularly effective for the previous condition and maternal toxicity scabies.

    Mercury Ointment
    For treating lunar sores on both ears and nearby openings, corresponding to the phases of the moon.
    Mercury two and a half qian, white powder, mastic, and coptis each half a liang; pig fat four liang. First, render the pig fat until boiling, add the mastic and other powdered medicines, and mix with mercury. Store in a ceramic box, first wash the sore with salty broth, then apply three to five times.

    Viburnum fruit decoction treats internal heat and purulent discharge from the ears.
    Ingredients: Ashwagandha, houttuynia, ophiopogon, red peony root, raw rhubarb, flowering wild licorice, white mulberry bark, red poria, and viburnum fruit, all in equal parts. Steep the above in ginger and jujube water, and take after meals.

    Shangqing powder treats wind-heat in the upper jiao, purulent discharge from the ears, sores and boils on the face; also treats fetal heat with swollen red eyes, loose yellow stool, crying due to abdominal heat, and red swelling on the body.
    Ingredients: Sichuan ligusticum, licorice, northern platycodon, tianhua fen (flower powder), dry kudzu, mint leaves, all in equal parts. Grind into powder, mix with honey, and take with warm white soup in doses of three, five, or seven fen or one qian; also use moxa leaves to brew a concentrated soup and warm-immerse the soles of the feet to guide the heat downwards.

    Angelica Longwei pill treats liver and gallbladder wind-heat, ear ringing, green pus discharge known as "thundering ears," constipation with yellow urine. Regular use promotes blood circulation, harmonizes yin and yang.
    Ingredients: Angelica, gentian, and bupleurum each one liang; indigo, gall bladder thick, rhubarb, aloe each five qian; musk five fen, gardenia seed, liquorice, wine prepared for both echinacea and phellodendron each one liang; and costus root two qian five fen.     Yuyu Liang Wan treats ear discharge of pus. Yuyu Liang is calcined and quenched seven times, with Hai Piao Xiao's hard shell removed, along with Baicao Shuang and Fu Long Gan, each two and a half qian, and one piece of raw Fu, skin and navel removed. The right ingredients are ground and wrapped in cotton the size of a round eye nut, placed inside; change it twice daily. If it does not heal, then there are worms.

    Long Gu San treats various pus-filled ears.

    Ku Fan, Long Gu, and Yan Zhi Pei, each one qian, with a little musk, are finely ground. Wrap it in cotton on a rod, wipe away the ear pus, and then blow in a character; do this twice daily. Adding one qian of Hai Piao Xiao is especially wonderful.

    Yang Jiao San treats ear pus that does not dry.

    Burn the goat horn to a powder and use it as follows: blow in two or three fen at a time, twice daily, and heal completely in three days.

Grind these together, refine into honey pills the size of a walnut, taking three to fifty pills per dose.

    Here is the translation of the provided Classical Chinese text into English:

    The above is the final prescription. First, wash the wounds with decoction, then apply the raw oil mixed for treatment.

    Flower Pollen Decoction: Resolves wind-heat toxic qi that rises and causes swelling and pain in the head and neck, and also treats skin spots. Ingredients: 1 liang of coarse Tianhuafen (flower pollen) peeled, 1 liang of raw Rehmannia, cleaned, 1/2 liang of Bai Zhi, washed with wine, 1/2 liang of Gui Wei, 1/2 liang of honey-water fried Jing Jie (Platycodon), and 1/2 liang of licorice. Prepare by grinding each to a fine powder; take 2 qian each time, with 1 cup of water, decoct to 7 parts, and take warm at any time.

    Immediate Effect Decoction: Addresses sores and pain inside the mouth, under the teeth and tongue, causing difficulty in speech and eating. Ingredients: 1 liang of cleaned Huang Lian, 2.5 qian of North Xixin (Chinese wild ginger) without leaves, 2 qian of Yuanming powder. Grind the above finely; it can be sun-dried or baked into powder. Combine with the Yuanming powder in a mortar, mixing well. For application, take a word's worth, apply dry to the affected area, or use 1 qian mixed with freshly drawn well water to apply to the sores. For young children who fear bitterness and won't imbibe, mix with honey water to apply to the affected area, allowing it to dissolve on its own, and use a clear tea for throat pain.

    Golden Powder: Relieves sores and toxins on the tongue and treats post-pox eye membranes. Ingredients: Huangbai (Coptis) with coarse skin removed, moistened with raw honey, dried in the sun and reapplied for a total of about ten times; 1 liang each of powdered Coptis and another herb. Grind to a fine powder. For oral sores, apply the powdered medicine dry to the affected area, or use cooked Mai Men Dong (Ophiopogon) water for tongue application, allowing it to dissolve on its own. For post-pox eye membranes, soak in clear soup for frequent washing; it is advisable to use Tang Jiao San (sugar decoction) and Shi Jiao San (persimmon decoction) as medications.[171p]

    　　天竺黄散　主上焦风热，口鼻生疮，两目赤肿，咽膈不利，涎壅滞气不通畅，惊搐烦闷，神思昏迷。　　天竺黄　郁金无，山栀仁代　茯神去皮根　甘草四味，各半两　硼砂　牙硝　香白芷　川芎　僵蚕去丝　枳壳麸炒微黄，各二钱半　朱砂水飞，二钱　蝉壳十五枚，去泥土嘴足　麝香一字　　右除硼砂、牙硝、朱砂、麝香四味乳钵细研，余九味焙干为末，同入乳钵内再研匀，每服半钱或一钱，温薄荷汤无时调服，或麦门冬汤。
    　　地黄膏　治口内舌上生疮作痛，饮食难进，昼夜烦啼。　　山栀仁　菉豆粉各一两半　粉草六钱　　右或晒或焙为末，用生地黄杵烂，取汁一两半，好蜜一两半，以薄瓦器盛，在铜铫中，水煮成膏，稠糊相似，候冷停分，入前药末，同在乳钵内再杵匀，丸芡实大，每以一丸至二丸，麦门冬熟水无时化服。儿大者，每用一丸，纳口内含化，或以新汲水调点舌上。[172p]

    Tian Zhu Huang San
    This is effective for treating wind heat in the upper body, sores in the mouth and nose, redness and swelling of the eyes, difficulty in swallowing, accumulation of phlegm, and obstruction of qi, as well as symptoms of shock, anxiety, and confusion of mind.
    Ingredients:

    • Tian Zhu Huang
    • No Yujin
    • Mountain Gardenia seeds as a substitute
    • Poria without skin and root
    • Licorice, each half a tael
    • Borax
    • Tooth ash
    • Fragrant Bai Zhi
    • Chuan Xiong
    • Silkworm without silk
    • Bitter orange peel, lightly roasted until yellow, each two and a half qian
    • Cinnabar, water-fined, two qian
    • Cicada shells, fifteen pieces, cleaned
    • Musk, a word

    Preparation: Exclude borax, tooth ash, cinnabar, and musk. Grind these four ingredients finely in a mortar, and roast the remaining nine ingredients until dry, then grind them together. Each dose is half a qian or one qian, mixed with warm mint tea or Mai Men Dong decoction.

    Di Huang Gao
    This is used for treating sores on the tongue that cause pain, making it difficult to eat, leading to constant crying day and night.
    Ingredients:

    • Mountain Gardenia seeds
    • Mung bean flour, each one and a half taels
    • Powdered herb (Lian Cao) six qian

    Preparation: Either sun-dry or roast until powdered. Use fresh Rehmannia to grind to paste, extract one and a half taels of juice, and mix with one and a half taels of honey. Place in a thin tile container, and cook in a copper pot until it becomes a thick paste, similar to a gooey consistency. Once cooled, combine with the powdered drugs, grind together thoroughly in a mortar, and form balls the size of a lotus seed. Each time, take one to two balls, dissolve in cooked Mai Men Dong water at any time. For larger children, take one ball, place it in the mouth to dissolve, or mix with freshly drawn water to apply on the tongue.[172p]

    • For treating children's mouth ulcers: Roast oysters until red, let them cool and grind finely, wrap them in paper and bury them in the ground for seven days to release toxins. Combine with three qian of licorice powder and one qian of roasted licorice powder. Mix well and occasionally sprinkle a small amount in the mouth; if spit out, it is harmless.

    Job's Tears Decoction: Treats intestinal abscess with abdominal pain, agitation, fullness with no appetite, and difficult urination.     Peach Kernel Decoction: Treats intestinal abscess with abdominal pain, agitation, obstructive pain, constipation, and also for abdominal ulcers around the navel. Ingredients include two qian each of Peach Kernel, stir-fried Rhubarb, Peony Root, Glauber's Salt, powdered Rhinoceros Horn, and ground Winter Melon Seeds. Decoct in water and add the powdered Rhinoceros Horn for consumption.

    Peony Root Powder: Treats intestinal abscess with moist abdominal pain, intermittent discharge of pus, or blood. Ingredients include five fen each of Peony Root, Ginseng, Gastrodia Elata, white Poria, stir-fried Astragalus, Job's Tears, Peach Kernel, stir-fried Angelica Dahurica, Angelica Sinensis, Ligusticum Wallichii, and Glycyrrhiza; with two fen of Wood Incense. Take three to five qian each time, decoct in water.

    Inner Nourishing Astragalus Decoction: Treats excessive discharge of pus from ulcers, or excessive intake of toxic remedies that lead to qi deficiency and blood weakness, fever with insomnia, possible night sweats and internal heat, or lack of flesh regeneration. Ingredients include two qian of stir-fried Astragalus, one qian and five fen each of Ginseng, stir-fried Atractylodes, Poria, dried Tangerine Peel, and Angelica Sinensis; one qian of stir-fried Sour Jujube Seed, five fen of powdered Schisandra, and roasted Glycyrrhiza. Decoct in water and consume slowly.[179p]

    　　托里清肝散
    　　人参　黄芪炒　当归　川芎　芍药炒　白朮　茯苓　金银花　白芷炒　甘草炒　连翘　柴胡各七分　山栀四分　　右，每服二三钱，水煎服。

    　　神效当归膏　治汤火等疮，不问已溃未溃，肉虽伤而未坏者用之自愈，肉已死者用之自溃，新肉易生。搽至肉色渐白，其毒始尽，生肌最速。盖当归、生地黄、麻油、二蜡，皆主生肌止痛，补血续筋，与新肉相宜。　　当归　生地黄各一两　黄蜡一两，白者止用半两　　右先将当归、地黄，入麻油四两煎枯去滓，将蜡熔化，候冷搅匀，即成膏矣。用涂患处，将油纸盖之，发背痈疽，杖疮溃烂，用之尤效。凡死肉溃烂将脱，止有些须相连者，宜用利刀剪去。盖死肉有毒，去迟则伤新肉，死肉去尽，尤宜速贴，盖新肉最畏风寒，不可忽也。[180p]

    Tori Qing Gan Powder

    Ingredients: Ginseng, fried Astragalus, Angelica Sinensis, Chuanxiong, fried Peony, Atractylodes, Poria, Honeysuckle, fried Angelica dings, fried Licorice, Lonicera, and Chaihu, each seven parts; Gardenia, four parts. Take two to three qian (a unit of measure) per dose, decoct in water for consumption.

    Shenxiao Angelica Ointment

    Used to treat sores from burns and scalds, regardless of whether they have broken or not. It can heal for injuries wherein the flesh is wounded but not rotten, and for those where the flesh has already died, it can induce suppuration and promote new flesh growth. Apply until the flesh gradually turns white, indicating the poison has dissipated, and it promotes muscle regrowth swiftly. This ointment consists of Angelica Sinensis, raw Rehmannia, sesame oil, and beeswax, all known for promoting flesh regrowth, relieving pain, nourishing blood, and replenishing sinews, and is especially suitable for new flesh.

    Ingredients: Angelica Sinensis and raw Rehmannia, each one tael; yellow beeswax, one tael; only half a tael if white beeswax is used. First, take Angelica and Rehmannia, and decoct in four taels of sesame oil until dry and residue is removed. Then melt the wax, let it cool, and mix evenly; this completes the ointment. Apply it to the affected area and cover with oil paper. Particularly effective for carbuncles and severe ulcers; when dead flesh is undergoing decay and is about to detach, only a few connections remain, use a sharp knife to cut them away. This is because dead flesh is toxic, and slow removal can damage new flesh. After all dead flesh is removed, prompt application is especially important, as new flesh is most vulnerable to wind and cold, and should not be neglected.[180p]

    　　乳香定痛散　治伤损一切疮疡溃烂疼痛。　　乳香　没药各五分　滑石一两　冰片一钱　　右为细末，搽患处痛即止。

    　　猪蹄汤　治一切痈疽，杖疮溃烂，消肿毒，去恶肉，润疮口。　　白芷　黄芩　当归　蜂房蜂儿多者为佳　羌活　赤芍药　甘草各五钱　　右用猪蹄一只，水四五碗，煮熟去油滓，取清汤，入前药煎，数沸，去滓温洗，随用膏药贴之。

    小儿疮疡门

    　　　　单方[181p]

    Frankincense Pain-Relieving Powder: Treats all wounds, ulcers, and painful sores from injuries. Ingredients: Frankincense and Myrrh, each 5 grams; Talc, 50 grams; Borneol, 3 grams. Grind into a fine powder and apply to the affected area to relieve pain immediately.

    Pig's Hoof Soup: Treats all abscesses, sores from injuries, reduces swelling and toxins, removes necrotic flesh, and moistens the wound. Ingredients: Angelica, Scutellaria, Chinese Angelica, honeycomb with bees if plentiful, Notopterygium, Red Peony, and Licorice, each 15 grams. Use one pig's hoof, four to five bowls of water, cook until tender and remove the fat, take the clear broth, add the previous herbs, boil a few times, strain, and use warm for washing. Apply a medicinal patch as needed.

    　　小儿丹毒：多年灶下黄土末和屋漏水敷之，新汲水亦可，鸡子白或油亦可，干即易。 【《肘后方》，下同】

    Childhood Erysipelas: For many years, apply yellow earth powder from the hearth and water from a leaky roof; fresh drawn water can also be used, or egg white or oil can be applied. When it dries, it becomes easier. [From "The Formula After Elbow," similarly below]
    Five-Color Erysipelas: Mix honey with dried ginger powder and apply.

    To treat children's red swelling, which, if spread throughout the body to the heart, can kill: grind伏龙肝 into powder and mix with egg white to apply, allowing it to dry. [From "Thousand Golden Prescriptions," similarly below] Furthermore: use powdered white beans mixed with water to apply, and do not let it dry.

    To treat a child's entire side turning red, gradually enlarging, or with sores: use cow's knee and licorice, chewed together to yield five sheng, boil with eight sheng of water for three boils, strain, then mix with the powdered伏龙肝 for application.
    To treat a child's body with red swelling: scorch rice flour until black, and mix with saliva to apply.
    To treat severe erysipelas with intense redness and swelling, along with high fever that does not respond to a hundred treatments: use sixteen ounces of cold water stone, twelve ounces of gypsum, eleven ounces of blue green, and for the dry ingredients: eight ounces each of rhinoceros horn, bupleurum, and apricot kernel; ten ounces of anemarrhena; five ounces of licorice; six ounces of antelope horn; seven ounces each of peony and scutellaria; eleven ounces of gardenia; one sheng of bamboo juice; four he of fresh kudzu juice; and two taels of clarified honey. Combine these fifteen ingredients, chewed, with five sheng of water, and boil with bamboo juice to extract three sheng and three he; strain, then mix in apricot kernel paste, kudzu juice, and honey, and simmer on low heat to reduce to two sheng. For a child of one or two years, give two he, increasing the dosage for older individuals.[182p]

    Children's Red Rash: One pound of willow leaves, one dou of water, boil to extract three sheng of juice, and wash the red areas with it warmed, daily seven or eight times.

    Children's Scarlet Fever: One liang of cold water stone powder, mixed with water and applied.

    Children's Widespread Red Rash: Use burnt antelope horn ash mixed with egg white to apply, highly effective.

    Children's Red Fire Rash: Squeeze juice from sow dung to ingest and apply.

    Children's Red Rash: Apply coriander juice.

    Children's Red Tumors: Five peeled hemp seeds ground into a spoon of flour, mix with water and apply, very effective.

    Children's Ten Types of Scarlet Fever: Use tile flowers to extract juice, mix with water to obtain juice, and apply with powdered Fulong liver.

    Children's Severe Skin Fire Rash: Use burnt lotus seed pods, flour, Fulong liver, and cedar wood chips in equal parts, ground together and mixed thoroughly for application.

    Children's Red Tumors: Mix egg white with herbal frost for application.

    Children's Red Rash that Moves Up and Down, Leading to Immediate Death: Crush cabbage and apply, which will stop it.[185p]

    In treating children with red rashes, they may present with spots that cover the body and seem lifeless: wash with a decoction of herbal ingredients.

    For treating children's five-colored rash: use equal parts of rhubarb, mirabilite, gardenia seeds, scutellaria, indigo leaves, and mulberry; grind to a fine powder and mix with water for application. Take four taels of jujube tree roots, three taels of salvia, and one and a half taels of chrysanthemum; grind finely and, for every two taels, boil with five liters of water until three liters remain, then give the child a warm bath away from the wind in a comfortable temperature.

    Additionally: use one pound of ramie roots and leaves, three cups of red beans; boil with five liters of water until three liters remain, then bathe the child in a sheltered place.

    Another method: crush the prickly chestnut balls and boil them for bathing the child.

    Also: use ash from reed mats mixed with white egg for application.

    Another method: apply cow dung and replace it when dry.

    Another method: apply mud from a pigsty and replace it when dry; it can also be treated with black powder.

    For treating children's white rashes: use five taels each of sour mother grass and cinquefoil, squeeze the juice for application.

    Another method: grind rhubarb to powder and mix with the natural juice of purslane for application.

    Another method: use mashed smartweed leaves for application.

    Yet another: apply mashed fragrant orchid leaves.

    Another option: mix vinegar with dust from above beams for application.

    Another method: mix pig bile with deer horn ash for application.

    Also: burn pig dung to ash, mix with egg white for application.

    Generally, children's rashes begin on the back, spread like fine dust over the body, and can turn into sores by the next morning; this condition is called "zhuyudan." If it's not fully developed into sores, treat it with egg white mixed for application.[186p]

    　　治小儿赤丹：酢和荞麦面涂之。
    　　又：赤足蜈蚣为末，入硫黄研匀，水调，翎扫头焦即止。　　又：天茄儿叶，俗名老鸦眼睛，取叶和酢擂敷。　　又：以蓼子，盐汤洗了，挼蓼涂之。
    　　治小儿火丹色如朱，皮中走：酢研豉成膏敷。　　又：鲤鱼血频频涂。

    To treat children's red rash: Mix vinegar with buckwheat flour and apply it.

    Also: Grind red centipede into powder, mix with sulfur, and adjust with water; when the comb of a feather is burnt, it can be stopped.

    Also: Take the leaves of the plant commonly known as "old crow's eyes," mix with vinegar and pound into a paste.

    Also: Use smartweed seeds, wash them with saltwater, crush, and apply.

    To treat children's fiery rash that appears red and moves under the skin: Grind vinegar and fermented soybean into a paste and apply.

    Also: Frequently apply carp blood.

    To treat children's dark rash: Use two liang of quicklime and three liang of straw from the corners of the house, burn them to ash and grind into powder, then mix with chicken broth for application.

    Also: Grind two liang each of bugloss seeds, snake's head grass, and fire guard grass; mix with chicken white for application.

    Also: Rub cooked pig fat on the affected area three to five times a day; if pig fat is unavailable, sheep fat may also be used, but it's less effective.

    Also: Use a heated pig trough ladle to press against the rash.

    To treat children's heavenly fiery rash that starts with red spots on the back: Use five he of sesame oil and half a jin of live crucian carp, pound them into a paste, apply to the rash, and replace when dry.

    Also: Mix two liang of tiger fat and one liang of yellow lead into a paste for application.

    Also: Use two liang of white mulberry root bark, one and a half liang of sweet chrysanthemum flowers, and one liang each of salvia and mangrove grass; grind evenly, using two liang each time, boil in three sheng of water to warm the child after straining, shielding from the wind.

    Also: Use one or two he of water from a bottle containing a child's placenta; give it to the child regularly to drink and apply to toxic areas of the body.[187p]

    　　治诸火丹：天火龙火着肉作疮，急以盐汤喷；次以山药涂。如无生者，以干者为末，水调涂。　　又：以羊脂调赤石脂末涂之。

    　　治小儿丹发两臂，赤起如李子，名鬼火丹。用景天草五两，蛇衔草三两，杵如泥，以鸡血调涂。　　又：戎盐一两，附子一枚，烧灰为末，雄鸡血调涂。
    　　小儿丹发赤斑，斑如梅子，遍背腹，名野火丹。用雄黄、戎盐各半两为末，鸡白调频涂，以瘥为度。　　又：灶中黄土一两，青竹叶二两，烧灰为末，鸡白调涂。　　又：白僵蚕二七个，护火草一两，杵烂涂之。　　又：酒涂油涂亦可。

    　　小儿丹初发，着两颊两膀上、两腋下，名家火丹。用梓木、白皮、蓼叶各三两烧灰，鸡白调频频涂之，以瘥为度。[188p]

    Treatment for Varieties of Fire Toxicity: Heavenly Fire and Dragon Fire result in sores on the flesh. Quickly spray with a salt solution, then apply yam paste. If no fresh yam is available, use dried yam powder mixed with water for application. Additionally, mix sheep fat with the powdered red resin for topical application.

    For children with red spots on both arms, resembling plums, known as Ghost Fire Toxicity: Use five taels of Houttuynia cordata, three taels of Snake Tongue Herb, pound until pasty, and mix with chicken blood for application. Alternatively, mix one tael of Rongyan salt and one piece of Aconite, burn to ash and powder, and mix with rooster blood for application.

    For children with red spots resembling plums, spreading across the back and abdomen, known as Wild Fire Toxicity: Mix half-tael each of realgar and Rongyan salt into powder, apply frequently with mixed chicken white for effect. Alternatively, mix one tael of yellow earth from the stove with two taels of bamboo leaves into ash and powder, and apply with chicken white. Another option: use two or seven white silkworms and one tael of Fire Protective Herb, pound and apply. Also, applying wine or oil may be effective.

    For initial manifestation of Fire Toxicity in children, appearing on both cheeks, both arms, and under the armpits, known as Household Fire Toxicity: Use three taels each of Catalpa tree wood, white bark, and Polygonum leaves burned to ash, mixed with chicken white for frequent application until healing is achieved.[188p]

    　　治家火丹攻喉入腹，大便不利：用硝石、凝水石，铜器中熬干，研服方寸匕。　　又：用乌头一分，赤石脂三分，研细，鸡清调涂，神良。
    　　小儿丹初发，两胁及腋下腿上，谓之殃火丹。用川(石卜)硝为末，每服以竹沥调下半钱，更量儿大小加减。　　又：浮萍杵汁，时时服之。
    　　又：川(石卜)硝一两、栀子仁半两为末，酢调涂。　　又：山栀子仁四两，生鲫鱼半斤，同杵如泥，每以酢化少许，涂丹上，兼治神火丹。
    　　小儿丹发两膀，不过一日，便赤黑，谓之神火丹。用景天草花绞汁，先微揩丹上，后涂之，以瘥为度。　　又：鲫鱼半斤，杵如泥，涂之，频涂为良。　　又：酢调栀子仁末涂。

    　　小儿丹发如灼，在胁下正赤，初从额起，或从耳起而多痛，名荧火丹。用赤小豆一台，硝石半两，寒水石一分为末，每以冷水调半钱，日三服，量儿加减。张氏用冷水调涂。　　又：景天草杵烂，以酢调涂。[189p]

    To treat household fire poison that attacks the throat and enters the abdomen, causing difficulties in defecation: use saltpeter and alum stone, dry them in a copper vessel, grind them into a powder and take a small amount.

    Also: take one part of Aconite and three parts of red resin, grind finely, mix with chicken broth for application, it is effective.

    When a child first develops fire poison, it appears on the sides, under the armpits, and on the legs, known as calamity fire poison. Use Sichuan saltpeter ground into a powder, each time mix with bamboo juice and take half a penny worth, adjusting the dosage based on the child's size.

    Additionally: take the juice of floating duckweed and drink it regularly.

    Also: one tael of Sichuan saltpeter and half a tael of gardenia seeds ground into a powder, mix with vinegar for application.

    Moreover: take four taels of gardenia seeds and half a pound of live crucian carp, pound them into a paste, then mix with a little vinegar to apply to the fire poison, also treating divine fire poison.

    When the child's fire poison manifests, it turns red and black within a day, known as divine fire poison. Use the juice of the flowers of the Sedum to gently wipe it off first, then apply it for healing.

    Also: a half pound of crucian carp, pounded into a paste, applied frequently is beneficial.

    Furthermore: ground gardenia seeds mixed with vinegar for application.

    If the child's fire poison feels like it is burning and is bright red under the ribs, initially arising from the forehead or ears causing much pain, it is called luminous fire poison. Use one tael of red adzuki beans, half a tael of saltpeter, one part of alum stone ground to powder, each time mix with cold water and take half a penny worth, three times daily, adjusting for the child’s size. The Zhang family uses cold water for application.

    Additionally: pound Sedum and mix with vinegar for application.[189p]

    　　小儿丹先发于背遍身，一日一夜而成疮，名朱田火丹。蓝靛涂，鸡清涂亦可。
    　　小儿丹发，两膀里尻间正赤，流至阴头，赤肿血出是也。治之用荠叶三两，赤小豆一合，煅垆门上灰一两，青羊脂三两，葱白二茎切，相和杵如膏摩之，燥，再加水摩之。　　又：细辛一两，糯米一合，景天草三两，杵如泥，涂丹上差。　　又：伏龙肝、赤小豆等分为末，鸡子白调涂。　　又：车前子为末，水调涂。
    　　又：姜沙一升，水煮，去滓洗。
    　　又：杵生浮萍傅。

    　　小儿废灶火丹，丹发从足趺起正赤者是也。治之用寒水石、硝石各半两，莽草一两，为末，每以新汲水调下半钱，更量儿大小加减。张氏用水调涂。　　又：赤小豆一两，牛角二钱，烧灰为末，鸡白调涂。　　又：五加皮叶根五两烧灰，以煅铁槽中水调涂。　　又：枣树根水煮汁，浴三五次。[190p]

    Little children's fire sores first appear on the back and spread across the body; within a day and night, sores form, known as "Red Field Fire Sores." Indigo and chicken fat can also be applied.

    When fire sores appear on children, they manifest as bright red areas between the shoulders and buttocks, flowing to the genitals, causing redness, swelling, and blood discharge. To treat, use three to two liang of shepherd's purse leaves, one he of red adzuki beans, one liang of ashes from a clay oven, three liang of goat's fat, and two stalks of green onion chopped and pounded into a paste, then dry, adding water to mix again. Alternatively: one liang of asarum, one he of glutinous rice, and three liang of sedum, pounded into mud, and applied to the sore. Another option: equal parts of buffalo gall and red adzuki beans ground into powder, mixed with egg white for application. Another: ground plantain seeds mixed with water for application.

    Another remedy: one sheng of ginger sand boiled in water, strained, and used for washing.

    For fire sores turning waste, those beginning at the feet and appearing bright red are treated with equal parts of cold water stone and saltpeter, and one liang of a herb, ground to powder, mixed with half a qian of freshly drawn water, adjusting the amount based on the child's size. Zhang's method involves mixing with water for application. Another: one liang of red adzuki beans, two qian of cow horn, burned to ash, mixed with egg white for application. Another: five liang of leaves and roots of the five-leaved akebia burned to ash, mixed with water from an iron trough for application. Another: boiled juice from jujube roots, used for bathing three to five times.[190p]

    　　小儿尿灶火丹，发膝上，从两股起及脐间走阴头者是也。治之用李树根半斤，烧灰为末，取田流水调涂。　　又：以屋四角茅草烧灰为末，鸡白调涂。　　又：以桑白皮李根同銼，煎汤洗之。
    　　治赤流丹肿赤：杵小豆五合，水和取汁，饮之一合，良；滓以敷五心。　　又：服黄龙汤二合，并敷患上。小柴胡汤去半夏，名黄龙汤。
    　　小儿赤流：取摩罗叶汁涂赤处，随手便瘥。

    　　小儿骨火丹，其疮见骨着足踝者是也。杵大小蒜厚封之。　　又：刺肿上入二分，以牛胆汁调大黄末涂之。[191p]

    For treating children's urine fire rash, which appears on the knee and spreads from the thighs to the navel: Use half a pound of mulberry tree roots, burn them to ash, and mix with field water for application. Alternatively, burn ash from reeds in the four corners of the house, mix with chicken egg whites for application. Another method is to pound white mulberry bark and the mulberry roots together, boil to make a wash.

    For treating red effusion and swelling: Pound five heaping servings of small beans, mix with water to extract the juice, drink one serving, which is effective; the residue can be applied to the palms of the hands and feet. Alternatively, take two servings of Yellow Dragon Decoction and apply it to the affected area. Xiaochaihu Decoction with half of the pinellia omitted is known as Yellow Dragon Decoction.

    For treating children's red effusion: Use the juice of moringa leaves to apply to the red areas, and it will heal promptly.

    For treating red spots on children's bodies: Use peeled peach kernels, grind them to a paste, and mix with face cream for application. Alternatively, boil the juice of yellow mugwort spikes in water, add a little salt, and take it warm. Another method is to finely grind alum powder and mix with cold oil for application. Also, pound banana root juice for application. Pound moss from the water, mix with water for application. Mix and apply the powder of natron with water. Use fresh snakehead herb, pound and then apply.

    For treating snake wrapping rash which can be fatal if encircling the waist: Pound lettuce to a pulp and apply, or grind lettuce seeds to extract the juice for application. Alternatively, use ash from ropes made of reed and burn together, mixed with raw oil for application.

    For children's bone fire rash, where the sores reach the bone and touch the ankles: Pound garlic well and seal it over the affected area. Alternatively, pierce the swollen area and apply two fen of cow bile mixed with rhubarb powder.[191p]

    To treat early stages of children's sores, which resemble fire sores and are called "blister sores" or "ulcer sores," use crushed ripe peach kernels mixed with flour for application. This also treats widespread redness and swelling.

    Additionally, apply burnt horse bones as a poultice.

    For children's ulcer sores, use burnt cow dung ash to seal and reduce scarring.

    Children's burn sores, also known as fire blister sores or fire ulcer sores, can be treated by wiping with a decoction of evodia in wine, which is effective.

    Children's dry sores, also called ulcer sores, can be treated by soaking hot iron in water for 27 times, then bathing the area after creating a paste.

    For children's severe ulcer sores, which start with blister-like fluid resembling burns, it is advisable to use a mixture of butter and red earth powder for application.

    For children's facial ulcer sores, finely pound wood fungus and mix it with honey for a poultice; alternatively, mix with cold water and apply a flat stomach powder, changing it when dry.

    To treat children's wind-itching rashes, use equal parts of the following: ephedra, saposhnikovia, hawthorn, stone heather, qin jiao, schisandra, bitter fortune, wormwood, mustard flower, caltrop, and bitter orange, one tael each. Grind them and boil with three dou of water until one dou remains, strain and add alum. Allow to simmer for bathing.

    Furthermore, powdered achyranthes in wine taken with a spoonful may help with longstanding sores. It is also effective for bone fistulas, epilepsy, and scrofula, yielding excellent results.[195p]
