    　　治小儿白屑满口，因名曰鹅口疮，不能吮乳：用发缠指上，蘸井水拭舌；如屑不脱，脓煮栗木汁，以绵缠箸头拭洗，却用飞过黄丹搽上。【《外科经验方》】
    　　治小儿口下黄肌疮：取羖羊髭烧作灰，和腊猪脂敷之。角亦可用。
    　　治口傍恶疮：用乱发灰、胡絮灰、黄连、干姜，四味等分为散，以粉疮上，不过三遍。
    　　治小儿瘘疮：用冢中石灰厚着之良。 【《千金方》，下同】　　又：烧桑根灰傅，并烧乌羊角作灰，相和敷之。
    　　治小儿疽瘘：用丹砂、大黄各三十铢，雄黄(艹闾)茹漆头者、雌黄各二十四铢，矾石马齿者、莽草各十八铢，黄连三十六铢，(口父)咀，以猪脂一升三合，微火煎三上三下，膏成，去滓，下诸色末，搅凝敷之。[204p]

    For infant mouth ulcers: Use water chestnut burned until its essence remains, grind it into powder and apply it.

    For infant mouth ulcers that have white patches resembling thrush: There is no need for medication. Use raw Tian Nan Xing (Arisaema) with the skin removed, grind it into powder, mix with vinegar, and apply to the soles of the feet, with males on the left and females on the right.

    To treat oral thrush in infants that prevents them from suckling: Wrap hair around a finger, dip it in well water, and wipe the tongue. If the patches do not come off, boil chestnut wood juice and use cotton wrapped around a chopstick to wipe and wash the mouth, then apply powdered yellow lead (Huang Dan).

    To treat yellow skin ulcers in infants: Take goat beard, burn it to ash, and mix it with lard to apply. Horn can also be used.

    To treat ulcers around the mouth: Combine ashes from tangled hair, cotton, Coptis root, and dried ginger in equal parts, and dust the powder over the sores, no more than three times.

    To treat anal fistulas in infants: Apply lime thickly from a tomb.

    Additionally: Burn mulberry root to ash, and mix with ash from black goat horns, and apply together.

    To treat suppurative fistulas in infants: Use 30 grams each of realgar and rhubarb, 24 grams each of male and female realgar (referring to varieties), 18 grams each of alum, honeysuckle, and wild grass, 36 grams of Coptis root. Grind them, mix with 1.5 liters of lard, simmer gently three times until a paste forms, remove residue, and mix with various powders for application.[204p]

    　　治小儿核肿，壮热有实：用青木香、甘草、石膏、甘遂各十八铢，麝香三铢[三铢　原作「三对」，据《千金》卷五改。]，大黄、前胡各一两，黄芩半两，共(口父)咀，以水七升煮取一升九合，每服三合，日四夜二。
    　　小儿瘰疬：槲树皮去粗皮切，煎汤洗之。 【《圣惠方》】

    　　小儿结核：用五倍子研为细末，醋调服之。
    　　小儿诸疮：恶疮、秃疮、蠼螋疮，浸淫疮，并宜楝树皮或枝，烧灰傅之，干者猪脂调。【《千金方》，下同】
    　　治小儿恶疮：熬豉令黄为末，搏疮上，不过三搏愈。

    To treat a child's abscess with severe heat and tangible symptoms: use 18 drachmas each of Qingmuxiang, licorice, gypsum, and Gansui; 3 drachmas of musk; 1 tael each of rhubarb and Chuanhu; and half a tael of Huangqin. Grind these ingredients together and boil in 7 sheng of water until 1 sheng and 9 guo is obtained. Take 3 guo each time, four times during the day and twice at night.

    For children's lymphadenitis: remove the rough bark of the elm and chop it, then boil to wash the affected area.

    For children's lymphadenitis: crush the white bark of the elm into a paste and apply it frequently.

    For children's lymphadenitis: grind equal parts of sesame oil and Forsythia into a powder and consume frequently.

    For children's tuberculosis: grind gall into a fine powder and mix it with vinegar to take.

    For children's various sores: for malignant sores, bald sores, and insect bites—soak these sores and apply either the bark or branches of the chinaberry tree, burnt to ash, or mix the dry ash with pig fat.

    To treat children's malignant sores: boil fermented soybeans until they turn yellow, then apply to the sores, no more than three applications for healing.

    To treat children's severe carbuncles: at the beginning of the month when they manifest, there is often yellow fluid. Use vinegar and oil to fry until it resembles porridge, and apply it warm. Change it every two days. For a stronger dressing, wash the sores with soap pod decoction before applying.[205p]

    　　治小儿月蚀疮，随月生死：以胡粉和酥搏之，五日瘥。
    　　治月蚀九窍皆有疮者：烧蚯蚓屎末，和猪膏搏之。　　又：水和粉傅之。

    　　治小儿手足及身肿：以小便温暖渍之，良。　　又：用巴豆五十枚去心皮，以水三升，煮取一升，以绵内汤中拭病上，随手消。并治瘾疹。
    　　治小儿初生，蓐中生热疮：以鸡子五枚，敲破去白，只取黄煮熟，又以乱发如鸡子黄许，二味相和，铫子中煎熬，取汁涂之；更用苦参末敷之，甚奇。刘禹锡云：向在武陵生子，蓐内便有热疮，发于臂腿，蔓延身半，初用他药无益，状候至重，昼夜啼号不乳。因阅《本草》有云：乱发合鸡子黄煎消为水，疗小儿惊热下痢。注云：去痰热百病；又鸡子，《本草》云：疗热疮。因用之，立效如神。煎法：鸡子黄、乱发初入铫煎时甚干，少顷发焦，遂有液出，旋取置一磁碗中，以液尽为度。【《保幼大全》】[206p]

    To treat children's moon disease sores, appearing with the lunar phases: mix ground fragrant powder with butter and apply; it will heal in five days.

    To treat sores in all nine orifices due to moon disease: burn earthworm droppings to a fine powder and mix with pig fat to apply. Alternatively: mix with water and apply in powder form.

    To treat swelling in infants' hands, feet, and body: soak with warm urine; this is effective. Additionally: take fifty ba dou seeds, remove the heart and skin, boil in three liters of water to obtain one liter, then use cotton to wipe the affected area with the liquid; this will dispel the ailment. It also treats itch rashes.

    To treat hot sores arising in newborns: take five chicken eggs, break them, discard the whites, keep the yolks, cook them, mix with loose hair to resemble the size of a yolk, and boil the two ingredients together to extract the juice for application. Furthermore, apply a powder of bitter root; this is remarkably effective. Liu Yuxi states: when I had a child in Wuling, there were hot sores appearing in the arms and legs, spreading halfway across the body. Initially using other medications proved useless, and the infant cried day and night without nursing. Upon reading the "Bencao," I found that mixing loose hair with chicken yolk and boiling produces a liquid to treat children's heat-related ailments and diarrhea. It's noted to expel phlegm and heat from a hundred diseases; the chicken yolk is said in "Bencao" to treat hot sores. Thus, I used it and saw immediate results. Boiling method: the chicken yolks and loose hair are initially quite dry in the pot; after a while, they will char, releasing liquid. Quickly transfer this liquid into a ceramic bowl, using it entirely as needed.[206p]

    • For children with sores all over their bodies: Use a decoction of white bud, fragrant herb, and walnut leaves for bathing.

    　　　　针灸

    　　万氏《片玉心书》曰：小儿一切肿毒，用蜞针法。取水蛭大者五六条，放肿处吮去恶血，可以消丹瘤，决痈肿。王肯堂《证治准绳》曰：治丹毒赤色，游走不定，令口吮血各聚一处，用细磁器击碎，取锋芒者，以箸头劈开夹之，用线缚定，两指轻撮箸头，少令磁芒对聚血处；再用箸一根频击，刺出毒血。轻者上用口吮出毒，用药敷之。如患在头者，不用砭法，止宜用针卧倒挑患处，以出毒血，迟则毒血入腹而难起矣。若砭后毒甚者，宜用神功散；如毒轻者，砭后不可用，恐砭处皮肤既破，草乌能作痛也。　　治流注及痈疽、鹤膝风等证，每日灸二三十壮，痛者灸至不痛，不痛者灸至痛，其毒随火而散。[213p]

    For children's smallpox and sores: Use equal parts of Fritillaria, southern star, silkworm, flower powder, cold water stone, white atractylodes, grass black, rhubarb, and pig's tooth soap pod, grind into powder, mix with strong vinegar, and apply to the affected area for miraculous effects.

    Acupuncture and Moxibustion

    Wan's "Jade Heart Book" states: For all swellings and toxins in children, the leech needle method is to be used. Take five or six large leeches, place them on the swollen area to suck out the bad blood, which can cure red lumps and drain abscesses. Wang Kentang's "Standards of Diagnosis and Treatment" states: For treating red dan毒 (toxic heat), which moves unpredictably, gather the blood in one spot, use a fine porcelain vessel to crush, take the sharp edges, split apart with chopstick ends, and tie with thread. Pinch lightly with two fingers on the chopsticks, allowing the sharp edge to focus on the blood gathering area; then use another chopstick to strike repeatedly, piercing out the toxic blood. If it is mild, let it be sucked out by mouth and apply medicine. If the condition is on the head, do not use the stone therapy; instead, use needles to lift and stimulate the affected area to draw out the toxic blood; delay can lead to the toxic blood entering the abdomen, making it difficult to expel. If the toxicity increases after stone therapy, use Shen Gong San (Divine Efficacy Powder); if mild, avoid using stone therapy afterward to prevent pain from the broken skin. For treating flowing sores and abscesses, as well as "crane knee wind" and similar conditions, perform moxibustion two to thirty times daily; for painful conditions, heat until the pain subsides, and for non-painful areas, continue until pain is elicited, allowing the toxin to disperse with the heat.[213p]

    盖火以畅达，拔引郁毒，此从治之法，有回生之功。其法用大蒜去皮切三文钱厚，安患处，用艾壮于蒜上灸之三壮，换蒜复灸，未成即消，已成者亦杀其毒。如疮大，用蒜杵烂摊患处，将艾铺上烧之，蒜败再易；如不痛，或作脓，或不起发，及疮属阴证者，尤当多灸。凡疮不痛、不作脓、不起发者，皆气血虚也，多主不治。惟患在头面者，不宜多灸。　　治流注结核，或骨痈，鹤膝等证，先用隔蒜灸。若余肿尚存，用此熨之，以助气行血，散其壅滞，功效甚速。又治跌扑损伤，止痛散血，消肿之良法也。其法用葱细切捣烂炒熟，频熨患处，冷则易之。如鹤膝风兼服大防风汤而愈。古今图书集成医部全录卷四百五十八[214p]

    To address the obstruction caused by fire and to dispel toxic elements, this method is essential in treatment and has the power of revival. The procedure involves taking garlic, peeling it, and slicing it into coins about three-fingers thick. Place it on the affected area and apply moxa on top of the garlic to perform three moxa treatments. Replace the garlic and continue the moxibustion; if the condition is not yet resolved, it will dissipate, and even if already developed, it will still eliminate the poison. For larger sores, mash garlic and spread it over the affected area, then apply moxa on top and burn it, replacing the garlic as needed. If there is no pain, or if pus forms, or if it does not develop, particularly for sores associated with Yin conditions, moxibustion should be performed frequently. In general, sores that do not hurt, do not produce pus, or do not develop are indicative of Qi and blood deficiency, and these should typically not be treated. However, for issues on the head and face, extensive moxibustion is not advisable.

    For treating conditions like stream and tubercular swelling, bone abscesses, and conditions like "crane knee," begin with indirect moxibustion over garlic. If residual swelling persists, apply this to aid Qi, promote blood flow, and dissipate the stagnation, yielding swift results. This method is also excellent for treating injuries from falls, relieving pain, dispersing blood, and reducing swelling. The procedure involves finely chopping and mashing green onions, frying them until cooked, and frequently applying them to the affected area, replacing them once cool. For "crane knee wind," it is effective when combined with Da Fengfeng Decoction for recovery.[214p]

    小儿疮疡门

    　　　　医案

    　　《格致余论》曰：东阳进士次子二岁，满头有疮，一日疮忽自平，遂患痰喘。予视之，曰：此胎毒也，慎勿与解利药。众皆愕然。予又曰：乃母孕时所喜何物？张曰：辛辣热物，是其所喜。因口授一方，用人参、连翘、芎、连、生甘草、陈皮、芍药、木通，浓煎沸汤，入竹沥与之，数日而安。或曰：何以知之？曰：见其精神昏倦，病受得深，决无外感，非胎毒而何？
    　　予之次女，形瘦性急，体本有热，怀孕三月，适当夏暑，口渴思水，时发小热，遂教以四物汤加黄芩、陈皮、生甘草、木通，因懒于煎煮，数贴而止。其后此子二岁，疮痍遍身，忽一日其疮顿愈，数日遂成痎疟。予曰：此胎毒也。疮若再作，病可自安。已而果然。若于孕时确守前方，何病之有！
    　　汤氏曰：张三太尉女年十五岁，病丹，诸医百药，俱试而不能中。召余视之，以生料四物汤加防风、黄芩，一日而愈。[215p]

    The local magistrate, Lord Tang Xiaofeng, was twelve years old when he contracted smallpox in the first month of the Wuchen year. At that time, Tang asked me to enter the capital with him, so I invited my fourth son, Bangzhi, and my eighth son, Bangjing, to assist Han Fengqi in treating the pockmarks. At the end of March, Xiaofeng returned north and, upon reaching Shangcai, was greatly worried. I reassured him, saying, "Do not worry!" Upon examining him, I found that his hand was not painful but weak and powerless; he could not lift it by himself and had to use his left hand to do so. When Tang asked the reason, I said, "It is due to liver heat and Qi deficiency." The liver governs the tendons, providing blood for nourishment; in cold, it contracts, and in heat, it expands. Only by replenishing Qi and nourishing blood will the illness resolve. So, I prepared a formula using ginseng, astragalus, angelica, ligusticum, white peony root, teasel root, licorice, white atractylodes, balloon flower, cardamom, coix seed, and mifang to make into pills, which he took for half a month and recovered.

    A small child, after bathing, experienced swelling all over his face and body and asked me to treat him. I replied, "This is due to water Qi."     　　《医学纲目》曰：武阳仇天祥之子，病发寒热，诸医作骨蒸劳治之，半年病甚。戴人往视之，诊其手脉尺寸皆朝于关，关脉独大。戴人曰：肺痈也。问其乳媪，曾有痛处？乳媪曰：无。戴令男去衣，举其两手，观其两胁下，右胁稍高。戴人以手侧按之，儿移身避之，按其左胁则不避。戴人曰：此肺部有痈，已吐脓矣。药之而愈。
    　　李叔和一日问东垣曰：中年来得一子，至一岁后，身生红丝瘤，不救。后三四子至一二岁，皆病瘤而死，敢问何也？曰：予试思之。翊日见叔和曰：吾得之矣。汝肾中伏火，精中多有红丝，以气相传，生子故有此疾，遇触而动，发于肌肉之间，俗名胎瘤是也。汝试视之！果如其言。遂与滋肾丸数服，以泻肾中火邪，补天真之不足，忌酒肉辛热之物。其妻以六味地黄丸养其阴血，受胎五月后，以白朮、黄芩二味作散与服。后生儿至三岁，前证不复作矣。叔和曰：先生乃神医也！遂从受学。其子今已年壮矣。[221p]

    The "Medical Overview" states: Wu Yang, the son of Qiu Tianxiang, fell ill with chills and fever. Various physicians treated him for bone steaming fatigue, but his condition worsened over six months. A physician named Dai examined him and found that his pulse was strong and directed towards theuan (an acupoint), while the pulse at the same location was notably large. Dai stated, "This is lung abscess." When he asked the boy's wet nurse if there had been any painful areas, she replied, "No." Dai instructed the boy to remove his clothing and raised both of his arms, observing that the right side of his ribcage was slightly elevated. When Dai pressed on it, the boy moved to avoid the pressure, but did not react to pressure on the left rib. Dai concluded, "There is an abscess in the lung, and it has already discharged pus." After treatment, the boy recovered.

This condition often occurs in children, requiring careful examination to distinguish between surface and internal ailments and the severity of the evil for treatment. Wang Haizang stated: "Why should both the beginning and end not be purged?" The answer is: "The beginning should not be purged because the rash has not yet appeared on the surface, and purging would prevent the evils from fully manifesting. This pulse condition shows a presence at the surface without internal conditions, so purging the beginning is prohibited. The end should not be purged because the rash toxins are already evident externally, with no roots or solid foundation internally; if the bowel movement is not substantial and there are no other internal conditions, purging would cause the rash to sink, thus it is forbidden to purge at the end."[229p]

    　　一儿作痒发热，以消毒犀角饮一剂，作吐泻，此邪气上下俱出也，毒自解。少顷吐泻俱止，其疹果消。吐泻后脉见七至，此小儿和平之脉也，邪已尽矣，不须治果愈。洁古云：斑疹之病，其为证各异。发焮肿于外者，属少阳三焦相火也，谓之斑。小红点行皮肤之中，不出者，属少阴君火也，谓之疹。凡显斑证，若自吐泻者，慎勿乱治而多吉，谓邪气上下皆出也。斑疹并出，小儿难禁，是以别生他证也。首尾不可下。大抵安里之药多，发表之药少，秘则微疏之，令邪气不壅，并令其次第出，使儿易禁也。身温暖者顺，身凉者逆。[230p]

    Jie Gu states: In the case of rashes and spots, the symptoms vary. If there is redness and swelling on the surface, it belongs to the lesser yang and the triple burner’s fire, referred to as “spots.” If there are small red dots beneath the skin that do not surface, this pertains to the lesser yin and the imperial fire, called “rashes.” In general, for evident spot conditions, if there is self-induced vomiting and diarrhea, one must be cautious not to treat indiscriminately, for this indicates the pathogenic Qi is expelled both up and down.

    When spots and rashes manifest together, children are often unable to withstand this; hence, it can develop into other symptoms. The beginning and end should not be treated lightly. Generally, there are many medications that stabilize the interior and few that promote external release. It is essential to gently guide the Qi, preventing blockage, and allow it to exit in sequence, making it easier for the child to withstand. A warm body is treated with soothing methods, while a cool body requires stimulating treatment.[230p]

After half a year, the child gradually became stronger, and the lumps began to dissipate. The child also took Di Huang pills and Xiao Yao powder and was completely healed.

    A child had three lumps on the neck, and the intention was to apply medicine, but the condition extended to the front of the ears. I believed this was caused by issues in the liver and gallbladder channels. Examining the mother, her liver and gallbladder pulses were still strong and rapid. I concluded that the mother and child were connected, and by treating the mother, the child would naturally heal. Doubting me, they took a specific remedy that resulted in vomiting and diarrhea, leading to death by morning.

    Another child had oozing pus and unabsorbed lumps, with increased fever and chill. This indicated deficiency of qi and blood in the liver with accompanying heat. The primary remedy was a Yin-replenishing Eight Treasure Decoction, interspersed with a Clear Liver and Nourish Flourishing Decoction, leading to recovery. Afterward, the child developed new lumps, and the urination was reddish and painful, experiencing evening fevers and thirst. The primary treatment was Shen Zhu Zi Ling Decoction, supplemented by Liu Wei Di Huang Wan combined with Chai Hu, Shan Zhi, and Si Wei Fei Er Wan, resulting in recovery.[253p]

    　　一小儿十五岁患此，发热作渴，日晡颊赤，脉数无力，属阴虚而有热，用补阴八珍汤五十剂加参、芪，又二十剂而溃。但脓水清稀，肌肉不生，此脾气虚弱也，以参、芪、归、朮为主，佐以芍药、熟地黄、麦门冬、五味子，气血乃复；遂进必效散一服，毒下而痊。
    　　一小儿患此，服克治之药，致寒热腹胀，此肝脾疳证，先用五味异功散加柴胡、升麻，佐以九味芦荟丸，渐退；又用四味肥儿丸、五味异功散而消。
    　　一小儿九岁患此，面色常青，肿硬不溃，肉色不变，乃伐肝化痰。余曰：但调补肝脾。不信，果虚证蜂起，复请余治。仍欲伐肝。余曰：面带青色，肝虚而本色见也；面色变白，肺虚而本色见也；痰涎上涌，脾虚而不能摄也；两目连札，肝血虚而生风也。经云：胃为五脏之本，当先救胃气。遂用五味异功散加升麻、柴胡，元气稍复；朝用补中益气汤，夕用五味异功散，佐以九味芦荟丸，面色始黄而核渐消；又以四味肥儿丸间服地黄丸而愈。[254p]

    A young boy, fifteen years old, suffered from this condition, experienced fever and thirst, had red cheeks in the evening, and exhibited a weak, rapid pulse, indicating Yin deficiency with heat. I used the Eight Precious Decoction with additional ginseng and astragalus for fifty doses, followed by another twenty doses, after which it burst forth. However, the pus was clear and watery, and the flesh did not regenerate, indicating weak spleen Qi. I primarily used ginseng, astragalus, angelica, and atractylodes, assisted by peony, cooked rehmannia, ophiopogon, and schisandra, which restored Qi and blood. Consequently, I administered the Must-Effect Powder once, expelling the toxins and achieving recovery.

    Another young boy presented with similar issues and, after taking the medicine administered for treatment, developed chills, fever, and abdominal distension, indicating liver and spleen deficiency syndrome. I first utilized the Five-Flavored Unique Function Powder with added bupleurum and ephedra and supplemented it with the Nine-Flavored Aloe Vera Pill, gradually improving the condition. I then employed the Four-Flavored Nourishing Pills and the Five-Flavored Unique Function Powder to reduce the symptoms.

    A nine-year-old boy suffered from this condition, having a constant greenish complexion, with hard swellings that did not burst, and unchanged flesh color. This indicated liver Qi stagnation transforming into phlegm. I advised that we only need to regulate and nourish the liver and spleen. Doubting my words, the pathology of deficiency surged; he sought my treatment again, still wanting to attack the liver. I remarked: A greenish face indicates liver deficiency, revealing its original color; a whiter complexion signifies lung deficiency; phlegm rising indicates spleen deficiency, which fails to contain it; two tightly closed eyes suggest liver blood deficiency leading to wind. The classic states: the stomach is the root of the five organs; we must first rescue the stomach Qi. I proceeded with the Five-Flavored Unique Function Powder, adding ephedra and bupleurum, slightly recuperating the vital energy. In the morning, I administered the Middle-Boosting and Qi-Increasing Decoction, and in the evening, the Five-Flavored Unique Function Powder with supplementation from the Nine-Flavored Aloe Vera Pill. Gradually, the complexion began to turn yellow, and the lumps started to dissipate. I then alternated administering the Four-Flavored Nourishing Pills with cooked rehmannia pills until he recovered.[254p]

    　　一小儿甫周岁，项间结核，两臂反张，索败毒之药。余意此属肝经血燥，询之果前患惊风，曾服朱砂等药。遂与六味地黄丸滋其肝血，数服而愈。
    　　一小儿项侧结核，痰盛发搐，服金石香燥之剂，手足筋挛。此肝血复伤，即急惊也。遂用加味小柴胡汤加钓藤钩、山栀、芎、归，六味丸料加五味麦门而痊。
    　　一小儿每受惊，项间结核，发热减食，睡间四肢微抽，此肝木侮脾土也。用五味异功散加柴胡、升麻、钓藤钩随愈。毕姻后，腿臂腕间结核，误服行气破血药，腿臂筋挛，肌体消瘦，如瘵证。余考绩到京，用地黄丸生肝肾之血，佐以补中益气汤补脾肺之气而愈。
    　　一小儿耳前后结核，遇惊即痰盛，咬牙抽搐，摇头，却服香燥之药，以致慢惊而卒。
    　　一小儿痘疮，如期而愈，痕赤如赭。余谓此乳母有热也。诊之，果有肝脾郁火。先用加味逍遥散四剂，与母服之，子饮少许而并愈。[255p]

    A young child, just a year old, had a lump on his neck, arms stretched out, asking for medicine to dispel toxins. I believed this to be related to dryness of liver blood, as he had previously suffered from convulsions and had taken medicine like realgar. I therefore provided him with Liuwei Dihuang Wan to nourish his liver blood, and after several doses, he recovered.

    Another child had a lump on the side of his neck, with excessive phlegm causing convulsions, and he took a medicinal formula that dries up phlegm, resulting in cramps in his hands and feet. This was a sign of renewed injury to the liver blood, indicating an urgent convulsion. I thus used a modified Xiao Chai Hu Tang with added Gua Lou, Gardenia, Chuanxiong, and Donggui, and after adding Wuwei and Maidong to Liuwei Wan, he recovered.

    A child every time frightened would have a lump on his neck, fever, decreased appetite, and slight twitches in his limbs while sleeping; this indicated that the liver wood was harming the spleen earth. I used Wuwei Yigong San with added Chaihu, Shengma, and Gua Lou which led to recovery. After the marriage, he developed lumps between his legs and arms after mistakenly using qi-moving and blood-breaking medicine, resulting in cramps and emaciation, resembling tuberculosis. I examined the situation upon arrival in the capital, used Dihuang Wan to nourish liver and kidney blood, and supplemented with Bu Zhong Yi Qi Tang to replenish spleen and lung qi, leading to recovery.

    A child had lumps in front of and behind his ears; upon being startled would produce excessive phlegm, grind his teeth, and have convulsions, shaking his head. He took a drying medicine, which led to chronic fright and eventual death.

    A child with smallpox healed as expected, but the scars were red like ochre. I believed the wet nurse had heat in her body. Upon examination, there was indeed stagnation of liver and spleen fire. I first used a modified Xiaoyao San in four doses, administered to the mother, with the child drinking a little, and they both recovered.[255p]

    　　一小儿痘痕色赤作痛，热渴喜冷，大便不利，先用前胡枳壳散，便利渴止；再用圣济犀角地黄汤而安；又用芹菜汁而靥。
    　　一小儿十六岁痘痕白，用独参汤数斤，色渐如旧；又用地黄丸、大补汤而安。
    　　一小儿咽痛壮热，痘痕色赤，手微热，此余毒未解，用柴胡麦门冬散而安。七日之后复热，手指初捏似热，久捏则冷，此脾气虚也，用五味异功散而痊。
    　　一小儿喉间肿痛，惊悸饮水，服惊风降火之药益甚，仍欲攻风痰。余曰：惊悸饮水，心经虚证，盖胃为五脏之本，先用五味异功散以补胃，加桔梗、甘草以消毒，诸证顿退；后用牛蒡子汤加柴胡而愈。
    　　一小儿发热饮冷，大便黄色，手足并热，不能吮乳，视口内无患，扪其喉间则哭。此喉内作痛，乃脾胃实热也。用泻黄、清胃二散各一剂，母子并服而愈。后因乳母饮酒，儿躁不安，仍用前二散而愈。

    A young child has red and painful pockmarks, experiences heat and thirst and prefers cold, with difficulty in bowel movements. First, administer a decoction of Qianhu and Zhike to relieve thirst and facilitate bowel movements; then use Shengji Rhinoceros Horn and Rehmannia Decoction for stabilization; finally, apply celery juice for improvement.

    A sixteen-year-old child has white pockmarks. Use several pounds of Dushen Decoction, and the color gradually returns to normal; additionally, use Rehmannia Pills and a Great Tonifying Decoction for stabilization.

    A child has a sore throat with strong heat, red pockmarks, and slightly warm hands. This indicates lingering toxicity. Use Chaihu and Mai Dong Powder for stabilization. After seven days, there is renewed heat; initially, the fingers feel warm to the touch, but upon prolonged contact, they feel cold. This indicates spleen deficiency. Use Wuwu Yigong Powder for recovery.

    A child has swelling and pain in the throat, with signs of fright and thirst; medications for dispelling fright and reducing fire only worsen the condition, and there is still a desire to expel phlegm and wind. I say: fright and thirst indicate a deficiency in the heart. The stomach is the root of the five organs; first, use Wuwu Yigong Powder to nourish the stomach, adding Platycodon and Licorice to eliminate toxins, thereby alleviating all symptoms. Later, administer Burdock Seed Decoction with Chaihu for recovery.

    A child has a fever, prefers cold drinks, has yellow stools, and heat in both hands and feet, unable to suckle. Upon inspection, there are no visible issues in the mouth, but palpating the throat causes crying. This sore throat is due to excess heat in the spleen and stomach. Administer one dose each of Xiahuang and Qingwei Powders, to be taken by both mother and child for recovery. Later, due to the wet nurse consuming alcohol, the child becomes restless, and the previous two powders are administered again for recovery.[256p]
